title: MBA Essentials
about: Build a toolkit of key strategic, managerial, and leadership skills for business.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview97/100The importance score that employers attribute to strategic thinking as an MBA-taught skill. QS Top MBA (Feb, 2021).60%The percentage of executives who report that strong leadership behaviour is critical to achieving future preparedness in business.Deloitte (2021).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)
While an MBA trains you to see the business world differently, financial expertise and business acumen, although vital, are not enough to influence your organisation’s leadership. These core skills should be paired with strong leadership techniques and an understanding of your strategic environment to be truly effective.
The MBA Essentials online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) is designed to help you understand your strategic environment, master financial details, and drive business success by influencing colleagues and consumers. You’ll be equipped with an essential MBA toolkit as you navigate the contemporary business environment, guided by esteemed LSE faculty.
This online MBA-based certificate course from LSE arms you with hard and soft business skills to maximise your competitive advantage and lead with influence.
Is this course for you?This certificate course is ideal for any professional interested in improving their hard and soft skills in business. Managers, entrepreneurs, and specialists, including consultants and analysts, will benefit from the interactive, guided approach to learning and the opportunity to grow their global network online. The focus on the mechanics of leadership, influence, and strategy, combined with technical business and finance skills, provides a comprehensive learning experience for working professionals in managerial and leadership roles in a range of industries. The ability to apply MBA-derived skills to current and future roles will benefit those pursuing career development and those interested in undertaking a full MBA in the future.

On this MBA Essentials course, you will learn how to critically and strategically think about business, and how to develop and execute strategy. You will also learn about important business concepts from financial analysis to marketing strategy, which will give you the foundation you need to grow in a business setting.

Career Development for Professionals
This online MBA Essentials course from LSE is designed for busy working professionals looking to develop their skills and grow in their careers. The programme is delivered in an interactive, online learning environment that allows you to learn at your own pace.



This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 95 hours of learning.

Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points

Develop critical-thinking skills and enhanced managerial competencies. On completion of the course, you’ll earn an official certificate of competence from the London School of Economics and Political Science.

title: Oxford Women's Leadership Development Programme
about: Overcome gender barriers and grow as a leader within your career and organisation.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Course overview$13 trillionThe amount by which global GDP could increase in 2030 if urgent action is taken to advance gender equality.McKinsey & Company (Jul, 2020).18%The percentage of firms surveyed globally with a female top manager.World Economic Forum (Jan, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Time and again, the business world has witnessed the many advantages of employing more women in leadership positions. Tackling gender bias and workplace challenges is becoming a necessity for organisations, society, and the economy at large.

The Oxford Women’s Leadership Development Programme from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford offers you the opportunity to take a critical look at your own leadership style and strengths over the course of six weeks, online.

By approaching leadership as a reflective practice, this programme is structured around three main themes: self-acceptance, self-management, and self-development. Through challenging the workplace gender biases that female leaders face, you’ll explore the skills needed to lead, influence, negotiate, and navigate difficult scenarios.
Is this programme for you?
This online leadership development programme aims to better equip current leaders to navigate the many challenges and gender biases that hinder female professionals in the workplace. The coursework is also designed to help aspiring female managers and executives develop the critical leadership skills to influence, persuade, empower, and mentor. Those preparing to transition into senior management or C-suite roles will be able to deepen their leadership knowledge by reflecting on crucible moments and approaches to challenging situations. This programme will serve those aiming to overcome gender barriers in business, and grow both within their careers and organisation.


This Oxford Women's Leadership Development Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 70 hours of learning.
Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

What will set you apart: ['A personal development plan, and enhanced core leadership skills and resources, to help you grow confidently as a leader. ', 'Tools to help you navigate workplace challenges faced by women, and respond to culture and gender assumptions.', 'An understanding of your unique leadership style, strengths, and limiting behaviours, and the ability to recognise your own agency.', 'Guidance from leading industry experts and Oxford Saïd faculty, and the opportunity to learn alongside fellow women leaders from around the world.', 'Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']
About the certificate: Explore women’s leadership development and earn an official certificate of attendance from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford.Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the programme handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the programme.
What past students think: {'Sharmila RajagopalTechnical Communications Manager, Appspace': "I absolutely loved this programme, and I'm so glad I signed up for it as soon as I came across it online. The coursework was structured with gradually increasing complexity, starting with self-reflection and identifying your own strengths and weaknesses, context, and leadership styles, and then moving on to more complex subjects such as strategies in leadership, and finally using the learnings from this programme to think about your future as a leader. This programme, uniquely curated especially for women, has been truly inspiring, educational, and empowering.   We were introduced to leadership approaches specific to women; topics were discussed from both men and women's perspectives; and we heard insights, advice, and personal anecdotes from so many women leaders. Discussion forums that were part of the coursework also enabled the participants to share their own experiences, and encourage and empower each other. The online learning experience has been simply amazing. I would recommend this programme to any woman who is looking to learn the nuances of leadership specially curated for women, by women, with valuable collective experiences."}

title: Property Development and Investment Online Short Course
about: Gain an understanding of the property industry, and develop the ability to identify and capitalise on investment opportunities.
Course overview:
Course overviewR1,352,712The average cost of a freehold home, the price of which has increased by 21 per cent in roughly a year.RE/MAX (Oct, 2021).43%The share of residential home buyers under 35 years of age, a sharp increase of 38 per cent from previous years, as a result of recent interest rate cuts.Ooba (Aug, 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
In Africa and abroad, property remains an exciting industry to enter – for both developers and investors – but only if you evaluate current trends and market conditions effectively to inform decision making.
This University of Cape Town (UCT) Property Development and Investment online short course aims to equip you with the skills to understand the inner workings of the property sector and empower your own property endeavours. Over eight weeks, you’ll learn how to make intelligent investment decisions, navigate the landscape of property development and entrepreneurship, and conduct property management effectively.
Guided by industry experts, you’ll leave this property course with a solid portfolio of evidence – including a sales comparison valuation report, bank loan proposal, and property management plan – and new-found knowledge that you can apply immediately in a business context.
Is this course for you?Anyone looking to develop an understanding of a combination of property disciplines, including property development, investment, and management, will find this course beneficial. It’s designed for investors wanting to capitalise on new revenue-generation opportunities, budding developers requiring a foundational understanding of the steps involved in the development process, and established industry professionals eager to consolidate or expand their knowledge.
Due to its introductory nature, the content is also appropriate for new entrepreneurs and professionals looking to gain the practical skills required to break into property investment or the property career scape. There are no formal prerequisites for this course.


This course is certified by the Engineering Council of South Africa (ECSA) for CPD points. The course has an estimated 80 hours of learning and South African engineering professionals can earn up to eight CPD credits.*
International students need to consult their national professional engineering bodies to check whether this course is recognised for points towards maintaining professional status.
*Should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The University of Cape Town and GetSmarter accept no responsibility. If you would like to claim validation or points, use the ECSA validation number UCTGSPDI22.*The University of Cape Town (UCT) and GetSmarter are committed to gender empowerment and working towards an equal future. In celebration of National Women's Day, get 20% off when you register and pay for this course during the month of August* using the code WOMENOFUCT. *Exclusive offer valid until 31 August 2022

title: Data Analysis Online Short Course
about: Learn how to sort, analyse, and interpret data to inform business strategy.
Course overview: Course overviewTop 3Data analysts, data scientists, and big data specialists are among the top three roles globally that are set to experience an increase in demand in the lead up to 2025.World Economic Forum (Oct, 2020).48.5%The proportion of industry-leading firms that report that they are driving innovation with data.NewVantage Partners (2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)With more and more businesses relying on statistical analysis to drive decision-making, the ability to extract meaning from data has become a highly valued skill. Data analysts play a key role in helping business leaders make informed choices, distinguish between effective and ineffective practices, cut costs, and solve key problems – they are, therefore, an integral part of any successful organisational team.The Data Analysis online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will introduce you to the fundamentals of data analysis and the broader potential of analytics in business. Over the course of eight modules, you’ll learn how data is collected, stored, organised, analysed, and interpreted, and you’ll be given the chance to practice data analysis techniques on real-world data sets. Ultimately, you’ll walk away with practical skills that you can apply immediately in your organisation to address specific business needs in the areas of finance, sales, marketing, operational management, and human resource management.Is this course for you?Anyone interested in moving into the realms of data science and analytics will find this UCT online short course useful. The content is geared towards those eager to update their skill sets to remain relevant, as well as established professionals looking to unlock new opportunities within or outside their current organisations. Data analysts, and others who already work with data, can add to existing certifications by learning how to better leverage numbers to achieve results and drive growth. Students will need access to Microsoft Excel to complete the practical components of the course.

What past students think: {'George NezarDivisional Sales Manager, Heineken South Africa': 'The course content was very informative, and I could relate my current working knowledge to each of the study units. title: Occupational Health and Safety Online Short Course
about: Improve employee safety and satisfaction in the workplace, and ensure your business is compliant with local legislation.
Course overview:
Course overview2.78 millionThe number of workers around the world who die annually as a result of occupational accidents or diseases.International Labour Organization (2020).37%The year-on-year decrease in the number of fatalities recorded in South Africa’s mining industry from 2018 to 2019.South African Department of Mineral Resources and Energy (Oct, 2020).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)
The South African Occupational Health and Safety Act stipulates that all local companies with more than 20 employees must have health and safety measures in place. However, many businesses don’t fully understand their legal responsibilities or know where to start when it comes to health and safety management in the workplace. For this reason, occupational health and safety (OHS) officers are an indispensable part of any organisation.
The Occupational Health and Safety online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will equip you with the skills to ensure legal compliance and create a safe, productive working environment for employees. You’ll learn how to conduct risk assessments, effectively manage workplace hazards and stressors, compile an investigative report, and oversee OHS training at your organisation. Ultimately, you’ll leave with knowledge that can be applied across corporate and industrial settings, and a certificate validating your competencies in occupational health and safety.
Is this course for you?Those looking to advance their career prospects and take a lead on OHS matters at their companies will likely find this course beneficial. It’s suitable for both professionals looking to break into the field, and those who already have experience in occupational health and safety and want to build on an existing qualification. The content of this Saiosh-accredited online course is also ideal for business leaders who want to ensure employee safety and satisfaction, and guarantee compliance with legislation. The online learning approach builds in both structure and flexibility, and students will receive support from tutors throughout the 10-week journey.
GetSmarter is accredited by the South African Institute of Occupational Safety and Health (Saiosh), a South African Qualifications Authority (SAQA)-registered professional body for occupational health and safety (OHS) professionals. Saiosh administers professional accreditation and industry insights for OHS professionals in South Africa. By completing this Occupational Health and Safety online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT), you’ll gain locally recognised and Saiosh-endorsed professional skills.Saiosh has accredited this online short course as meeting the academic requirements for 5 CPD points. As such, students may be eligible to qualify for Saiosh membership at a technical or associate level, depending on their years of work experience. Technical Membership criteria include an accredited certificate at NQF Level 5 or equivalent and two years’ experience. Should students not meet these criteria, they can apply for a non-professional Associate Level Membership, which requires an NQF Level 5 certificate or equivalent and less than two years’ experience.*
*The Saiosh registration board is responsible for determining the grade of students when applying. Thus, GetSmarter and UCT bear no responsibility for the claiming or validation of these endorsed professional skills with Saiosh.

title: Data Analysis for Management Online Certificate Course
about: Learn the skills to analyse, interpret, and communicate data with confidence and impact within your organisation.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview2.6XThe factor by which chief data officers (CDOs) can increase business value if they're involved in setting strategic objectives.Gartner (Mar, 2021).$6.4 billionThe projected value of the global marketing analytics market by 2026.Research and Markets (Mar, 2022).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
As the world becomes more data driven, future-focused professionals need to develop the quantitative skills to inform corporate decision-making and managerial strategy. Guided by experts from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), this online certificate course empowers you with the knowledge and practical tools to understand, interpret, and communicate data relevant to your role and organisation.
Develop an understanding of how data-driven models can improve your ability to make decisions in a fast-paced, real world. Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll participate in a capstone project and apply the techniques and concepts covered to extract actionable business insights from a real data set. You’ll also gain experience using Tableau – a leading business intelligence and data analytics software – to visualise and report on insights extracted from data sets.
Learn to analyse data and gain actionable insightsAnalytical skills are becoming increasingly valuable and are in high-demand, but there aren't enough professionals with them to go around. Begin to understand big data concepts and statistical analysis by using Tableau to confidently visualise and report on insights extracted from data. Learn how to apply these data analysis techniques and new skills to a real-world data set.Is this course for you?This LSE course will equip managers and analysts in a variety of industries with the skills to make data-driven decisions. Marketing and sales analysts will gain the ability to extract and interpret key business insights for competitive advantage. Similarly, finance, HR, and business analysts will develop data analysis skills that can be directly applied in their role and organisation. There are no formal prerequisites for this course, but some numerical literacy is advantageous, as well as a basic working knowledge of Microsoft Excel. You’ll be granted a student licence to download and use Tableau free of charge, for the duration of the course. 
This Data Analysis for Management course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies.
	The course has an estimated 70 hours of learning.
	
Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Professional Communication: Business Writing and Storytelling
about: Learn how to craft accurate, engaging and impactful pieces of writing for the business context.
Course overview: Course overview"Never use a long word where a short one will do."– George OrwellOrwell Foundation (Nd). Accessed 15 June 2021."Look for the clutter in your writing and prune it ruthlessly. Be grateful for everything you can throw away [...] Simplify, simplify." – William ZinsserBBC (May, 2015).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Professional Communication: Business Writing and Storytelling is an online short course from The Economist designed to help business professionals attract and address broad audiences across various written formats. Based on the newspaper’s editorial practice, this six-week course offers a self-reflective journey through the craft and purpose of writing and storytelling, equipping you with the confidence to communicate with partners and employees. An accessible 'tools not rules' approach to grammar unlocks practical skills for constructing cohesive sentences and paragraphs, and shows how elements such as word choice, punctuation and structure can maximise impact and clarity. You’ll also explore ways to source information accurately, learn to strengthen arguments with data visualisations, and uncover methods for constructive and collaborative editing.Enjoy a free three-month digital subscription with this executive-education course from The Economist. Read daily articles on Economist.com, listen to our podcasts, watch videos, browse newsletters, immerse yourself in our app or join us at exclusive events.Is this course for you?This course will benefit anyone seeking to improve their business writing and storytelling abilities. Participants who are looking to communicate with more conviction will learn how to craft narratives that hook and convince their readers, whether they are employees, partners or clients. Individuals will gain practical skills in sourcing, writing and editing content, and in the effective use of data visualisation.This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 50 hours of learning. Note: should students wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon them. title: Real Estate Economics and Finance
about: Make more informed real estate finance and investment decisions with an in-depth understanding of markets, economics, and finance.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview$57 trillionThe amount invested in real estate that produces income and is tradeable between investors worldwide.United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (2019).14.8 billion square feetThe expected increase in industrial real estate demand by 2023.Deloitte Insights (2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)The Real Estate Economics and Finance online certificate course prepares you to critically evaluate property investment options and make informed decisions based on sound economic and financial theories and research. Through these lenses, explore the functioning of urban real estate markets with guidance from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) faculty and industry experts. You’ll also learn how to use different techniques to value property and how those valuations and real estate portfolio considerations are used to make informed real estate investment decisions.  Over eight weeks, you’ll explore sustainable real estate practices and their value, as well as fund management, which includes how best to fund the purchase of a property. At the end of the course, you will have completed a capstone project, demonstrating your ability to apply the theoretical frameworks you develop during this real estate finance course to inform your assessment of the property development process and real estate opportunities.Is this course for you?This course is aimed at those interested in real estate finance, financial modeling, property management, property investment, and property development. It has wide, international application and will be valuable to property professionals from a range of backgrounds who wish to better understand the real estate market and improve their business strategy.
Gain a strong foundation in real estate finance and investment
This online certificate course in real estate economics and finance will equip you with the skill set necessary to grow your career. The course material covers key areas that will give you a strong foundation in real estate financial analysis. You’ll also learn the importance of data analysis, and using financial instruments to make sound decisions when it comes to property portfolio management and performance measurement of real estate investments.
Understand the real estate market
This real estate economics and finance course is an introduction to the principles of market structures, capital markets, and financial markets. The course content covers how these markets operate and their effects on the real estate industry and economy. Participants will learn about the role of financial institutions in the property market, as well as the different types of securities available to real estate investors.

There are no formal prerequisites for this course, and no prior knowledge of real estate is required. However, good numeracy skills and basic knowledge of Microsoft Excel will be needed. A financial calculator is not needed.

This Real Estate Economics and Finance online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 70 hours of learning.
Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.
What past students think: {'Anthony A ChammahAssociate, Colliers International': 'I have been working in commercial real estate for the past three years, first as an analyst and now as a broker in occupier services. Having graduated from Duke University with a degree in history and a minor in political science, I lacked the fundamental economic background needed to be successful in commercial real estate. I have taken several courses on real estate finance and modelling but the LSE Real Estate Economics and Finance course provided me with the opportunity to combine my technical skills with a comprehensive knowledge of real estate economics. It was a fantastic course that will benefit me long into my real estate career.'}

title: Paralegal Practitioner
about: Learn how to offer vital legal support by administering key technical and operational tasks.
Course overview: Course overview12%The percentage by which employment of paralegals and legal assistants is projected to grow up to 2028.US Bureau of Labor Statistics (Sep, 2019).426,617The number of new legal aid matters that arose in South Africa in the 2017–2018 financial year.Legal Aid South Africa (2018).Duration: 16 weeks (excluding orientation)As professionals who offer much-needed assistance to licensed lawyers, paralegals play a vital role in professional legal environments.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Paralegal Practitioner online short course aims to equip you with both the legal knowledge and the practical skills to fill this important function. You’ll gain a comprehensive understanding of the South African legal system, and be introduced to the Bill of Rights, the South African Constitution, and areas of private law, criminal law, and business law.To give you a competitive edge, the course concludes with several modules on legal reading, writing, interviews, and research, preparing you to take on a wide range of technical and administrative responsibilities.Is this course for you?This course is designed for aspiring paralegals, legal assistants, and legal secretaries eager to unlock new career opportunities and work at a law firm or in a commercial environment. The content will also appeal to existing paralegal practitioners who want to refine their skill set, update their knowledge of local law, and expand their scope of influence within their organisation.

title: Project Management Foundations Online Short Course
about: Learn how to approach and execute projects more effectively and efficiently.
Course overview:
Course overview73%The proportion of organisations that successfully meet their goals using formal project management approaches.PMI (2018)22 millionThe number of new project-oriented jobs that will be created by 2027.PMI (2018)Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)Project management is an important skill for those eager to boost their impact on their organisation. This online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will guide you to discover new and established project management tools and techniques, and help you gain an understanding of a project life cycle.Whatever industry you find yourself in, the transferable skills that this project management course gives you will help you to work more effectively and efficiently. You’ll learn how to build and lead project teams, handle time and budget constraints, and communicate workable solutions to stakeholders.Is this course for you?This course is aimed at both those currently working in a project-oriented role and those aspiring to launch a career in formal project management. Professionals who are new to the field, or who are looking to upskill themselves, will gain the foundational knowledge and confidence they need to run projects more effectively to make a real difference to their company. At the same time, existing project managers can polish and consolidate their understandings, and earn a certificate as proof of their refined competencies. There are no formal prerequisites for this course.





GetSmarter is approved by the Project Management Institute (PMI®) as an Authorized Training Partner (ATP), a partnership that enables you to join the world’s largest project management network. This Project Management Foundations online short course will count for 68.25 PDUs in total, and the division of hours is as follows: Technical - 38.25, Leadership - 14.50, Strategic - 15.50.

PMI is responsible for setting project management standards and providing certification. By taking this course, you’ll gain PMI-endorsed skills that are globally recognised. You can also use these learning hours towards furthering your professional project management development. See PMI.org for more information.

Please note that GetSmarter and UCT bear no responsibility for the reporting of these PDUs and/or hours to the PMI. The onus, therefore, falls on you to do so.

The PMI® Authorised Training Partner seal is a mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.

title: Public Management and Governance
about: Address the values, ethics, and competencies related to public administration in developing countries.
Course overview: Course overviewEfficient and effective managementA key priority laid out in the Department of Public Service and Administration’s Strategic Plan.DPSA (Nd). Accessed 10 Jan 2020.Doing good for all“There is no greater challenge and there is no greater honour than to be in public service.” – Condoleezza Rice, Former US Secretary of StateNo Higher Honor (2011).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)The University of Cape Town (UCT) Public Management and Governance online short course is practically focused, addressing the need for ethics training while still teaching you the theory and skills essential to impactful government service. On this course, you’ll learn to lead teams and effectively manage situations unique to the context of the public sector. Develop your policy and evaluation expertise, explore real-world case studies and practical applications, while networking with a cohort of peers. Under the guidance of a leading public management expert, and with personalised support, you’ll improve your ability to influence others towards positive change. Meet the increasing demand for well-qualified, public-oriented officials who can manage service delivery ethically and earn the university certificate you need to compete for a management or leadership role in the public sector, and contribute to a healthier administration that best serves the country.Is this course for you?This course is aimed at busy senior government professionals looking to improve their performance in their current leadership role, or those working towards their next promotion by adding to their capabilities. It’s particularly valuable if you want to develop expertise in human resource, policy, and decentralised service management, or are aiming to advance into a management position. The course will also benefit private sector professionals with business ties to government or the public sector looking to refocus their service to deliver what the public really requires.

title: Business Sustainability Management
about: Develop an action plan to tackle social, economic, and environmental sustainability challenges within your organisation.

Course overview8 million tonsThe amount of plastic that floods into the ocean each year.National Geographic (Jan, 2019).
$128.5 billionThe amount consumers spent on sustainable fast-moving consumer goods in 2018.Food Business News (Oct, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
As awareness of climate change, resource scarcity, pollution and inequality rises, businesses and governments are being held increasingly responsible for their individual contributions to social and environmental sustainability. Businesses need to comply with mounting legislation and pressure from stakeholders, or risk reputational harm.
By taking this Business Sustainability Management online short course, you’ll gain the insights needed to champion sustainable development and secure your market position in an uncertain future.
Learn to develop and motivate an action plan for sustainable business practices and implement corporate sustainability in your organisation, guided by the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL), a globally influential institute developing leadership and solutions for a sustainable economy.1 By addressing the challenges of implementation in both public and private sectors, you’ll develop the skills to overcome them and seize the opportunities associated with creating a sustainable business. Adapt to growing global concerns and shifting landscapes and lead positive change throughout your sphere of influence.
1CISL (Oct, 2018).
Is this course for you?
This online short course from CISL is geared towards experienced professionals who want to stay relevant in a rapidly changing landscape. By strengthening their corporate social responsibility efforts and implementing sustainable practices in their organisation, these participants will be equipped to remain competitive and secure a sustainable future for their business. The course is also suitable for entrepreneurs wanting to identify new sustainable social, economic, and environmental opportunities, and who need to expand their knowledge on the role and importance of sustainability in their business. title: Human Resource (HR) Management
about: Gain a competitive advantage by attracting, engaging, and retaining top talent.
Course overview: Course overview7%The rate at which the employment of human resource managers is projected to grow from 2018 to 2028.US Bureau of Labor Statistics (Sep, 2019).54%The percentage of all existing employees who will require significant retraining and upskilling by 2022.World Economic Forum (2018).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)Employees are the lifeblood of an organisation. Consequently, how staff members are selected, managed, motivated, and trained can have a significant impact on a business’s bottom line. As the professionals tasked with overseeing a company’s workforce, human resource managers are widely recognised as a vital cog in the broader business machine.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Human Resource (HR) Management online short course is designed to develop your ability to efficiently manage people. Taking a highly practical approach, the course equips you with the latest HR management knowledge, focusing on employment legislation, recruitment, performance management, and employee well-being. It aims to teach you practical skills that you can apply immediately to improve your practice. Guided by a dedicated head tutor and support team, you’ll learn how to use strategic HR management to help your organisation move closer to its goals.Is this course for you?This course is suitable for professionals who want to learn how to practically implement effective HR management strategies and plans in any industry or organisation. The content is especially suited to current and aspiring HR administrators, talent managers, training and development professionals, and team leaders. In addition, it’s likely to be beneficial for small business owners and entrepreneurs looking to improve their ability to recruit and manage personnel.

title: Blockchain and Digital Currency: The Future of Money
about: Gain an in-depth understanding of crypto assets and harness the potential they offer.
Course overview: Course overview53%The amount of global organisations that view blockchain as a strategic priority.Deloitte (2019).77%The number of executives globally who believe they will lose their competitive advantage if they don’t adopt blockchain.Deloitte (Jul, 2019).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)It’s no longer enough to simply know about cryptocurrencies. With crypto assets and blockchain technologies growing at unprecedented rates, professionals need the ability to analyse and understand how the latest developments in the finance industry will fundamentally change the way the financial system functions in the present and near-future. Organisations that adapt their offerings to either compete with cryptocurrencies or offer services that support the industry are best positioned to take advantage of the rise of crypto assets.The Blockchain and Digital Currency: The Future of Money online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) provides you with a deeper understanding of how blockchain works – and exists – within the current and future financial system. Over six weeks, you’ll explore the growing field of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) and discover how they are influencing the future of the financial industry through an emerging market perspective. You’ll also investigate the ethical implications of investing in the crypto asset industry, and discover how ethics and governance can shape new financial infrastructure for the benefit of society.On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with the enhanced skills and up-to-date industry knowledge of blockchain and cryptocurrencies needed to take advantage of the opportunities it creates. Is this course for you?This course is designed for anyone with an interest in new forms of money, particularly those involved in the financial industry, governments, central banks, and individuals involved in crypto assets in their personal capacity. Those who want to expand their working knowledge of blockchain and crypto assets to augment their role will also benefit. Professionals who already understand blockchain and digital currencies will walk away with future-focused skills that can be immediately applied within their role or business context. This course is broken up into weekly modules with incremental deadlines created to allow working professionals improve their skills without compromising on work and family responsibilities.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Blockchain principles', 'Module 2': 'Applying blockchain technology', 'Module 3': 'Crypto assets and the future of financial instruments', 'Module 4': 'The evolution of financial markets', 'Module 5': 'Programmable money', 'Module 6': 'Ethics and governance of a new financial system'}

What past students think: {'Kate BarnesPayments Strategist, FNB': "I highly recommend this course to anyone involved in financial services. This is potentially the new frontier of banking, and while there's a vast amount of material to read online about crypto assets and distributed ledger technology, it's not always easy to follow, to know what is credible or relevant, or to make sense of what it means for our industry. This course brings the topic together with many related issues, such as financial inclusion or the potential impact of Big Tech on financial services. This provides an important grounding for further exploration of the topic."}

title: Professional Communication and Office Management
about: Learn how to manage correspondence and oversee administrative tasks in an office environment.
Course overview:
Course overview1 of 10Strong communication skills are one of 10 vital competencies needed for success in the future workplace.Forbes (Apr, 2019).The impact of communication“In teamwork, silence isn’t golden, it’s deadly.” – Mark Sanborn, President of Sanborn & Associates, Inc.Entrepreneur (Jun, 2019).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)Skilled office management and administration professionals aren’t just supporting players. As employees who help to ensure efficient operations across all business functions, they’re fundamental to an organisation’s success.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Professional Communication and Office Management online short course is designed to equip you with the skills and knowledge needed to thrive in this key administrative and operational role. You’ll explore document, meeting, diary, and petty cash management, and be taught how to communicate effectively in a modern professional environment. Learn how to structure a business letter, plan company travel arrangements, supervise the day-to-day running of an office, and take on a range of new responsibilities to help your organisation function optimally.Is this course for you?This course is suited to professionals who want to unlock new employment opportunities and move up into an office management or corporate communication-related role. Those already working as office administrators and assistants can also take this course to refresh their skills, formalise their knowledge, and validate their expertise with a certificate from Africa’s leading university, UCT.1

title: Business Risk Management
about: Develop your ability to analyse, mitigate, and respond to organisational risk.
Course overview:
Course overview51.8%The percentage of companies globally who believe that risk management processes need to be improved.Aon (2019).Economic slowdownThe top identified risk facing companies across industries.Aon (2019).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)The business world is still reeling from the sudden onset of Covid-19. In this new environment, risk assessment and the ability to implement a reliable risk management strategy has become vital to navigating the increasing volatility.This Business Risk Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) is designed to give you a comprehensive overview of the burgeoning field of risk management. You’ll learn how to promote a strong risk culture in your organisation and recognise the importance of industry compliance. You’ll also learn to leverage business risk management frameworks to determine the risk severity, and evaluate it using qualitative and quantitative factors.Gain the ability to use a risk register to assess the viability and resource allocation of all of your projects and use reporting tools effectively to offer real insight for your business.Is this course for you?This course is designed for professionals in both senior leadership and risk-related positions. Through the course’s content, business leaders will learn to create a more secure future for their organisations by ensuring they’re compliant with industry regulations, and can effectively prepare for any potential risks they may face. Those working as compliance managers or in other risk-related roles will have the opportunity to update their skills with an understanding of best practice, and set themselves apart in an increasingly competitive industry.


This course is endorsed by the Institute of Risk Management South Africa (IRMSA). IRMSA is a South African Qualifications Authority (SAQA) and, therefore, a recognised professional body for risk managers. It is dedicated to the advancement of the risk management profession and provides professional accreditation. Upon completion of the UCT Business Risk Management online short course, students will gain professionally endorsed, industry-recognised, contemporary skills in risk management. For more information, please click here.
Please note that GetSmarter and UCT bear no responsibility for the claiming or validation of these endorsed skills with IRMSA. The onus, therefore, falls on you to do so.
This Business Risk Management online short course is endorsed by UCT’s African Institute of Financial Markets and Risk Management (AIFMRM).

title: Compliance Management
about: Gain a deeper understanding of compliance risk analysis and management in order to enhance your organisation's operations.
Course overview: Course overview77%The percentage of organisations that fear reputational damage resulting from non-compliance.ITWeb (Feb, 2019).54%The proportion of firms that allocate up to a quarter of their total spending to maintaining compliant business operations.Reuters (Jul, 2018).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)As businesses grow and technology develops, the world is seeing increased levels of regulatory risk. This has led to the adoption of more stringent standards and regulations, which are increasingly changing how organisations manage their operations. The compliance function of an organisation has never been more important, as it now needs to proactively govern everything from internal policies to employee behaviour.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Compliance Management online short course teaches you the skills to create a culture of ethical compliance in your organisation. Over eight modules, you’ll gain an in-depth understanding of compliance risk analysis and management that can be applied to your own context. Ensure the long-term sustainability of your business by adhering to regulations, implementing policies, and developing a strategic approach to managing compliance risk.After completing this course, you’ll receive a one year student membership to the Compliance Institute Southern Africa (CISA). Should you complete both UCT compliance online short courses offered by GetSmarter, within a one-year period, you’ll then get a two-year CISA membership. Is this course for you?This course is suitable for professionals who work in corporate governance, compliance management, or a related field, and intend to apply compliance principles to their own organisations. It would also benefit those looking to enhance their existing knowledge and skills to move into a strategic role within their compliance team. Existing compliance professionals will be able to validate, refine, and develop their current skill set. It is also ideal for business leaders looking for an advanced set of skills to augment their legal, risk management, and compliance knowledge in order to assist their compliance team and improve company performance.GetSmarter is endorsed by the Compliance Institute Southern Africa (CISA). CISA sets, maintains, and promotes best-practice standards for the compliance profession and has developed a Generally Accepted Compliance Practice (GACP) framework to govern business standards. By completing this course, students will gain compliance-management skills aligned with CISA GACP benchmark standards, which are nationally recognised. CISA also administers professional accreditation for compliance professionals. By completing the Compliance Management course, you’ll be eligible for 15 Continuous Professional Development (CPD) hours. Please note that GetSmarter and UCT bear no responsibility for membership registration and other benefits with CISA. The onus, therefore, falls on you to do so.The University of Cape Town (UCT) and GetSmarter are committed to gender empowerment and working towards an equal future. In celebration of National Women's Day, get 20% off when you register and pay for this course during the month of August* using the code WOMENOFUCT. *Exclusive offer valid until 31 August 2022

title: Organizational Design for Digital Transformation
about: Plan for digital transformation by focusing on your organization's design and operational backbone.
Course overview: Course overview$6.8 trillionThe expected global spend by 2023 on technologies and services that enable digital transformation.International Data Corporation (Oct, 2020).91%The percentage of business leaders who rate digital transformation as a current business priority to remain competitive.AWS (Sep, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)As technology continues to reshape industries, many companies are seeking large-scale digital transformation as a way to maximize results and get ahead of their competition. To succeed in the digital economy, established businesses must develop and apply new technology and organizational capabilities. In the Organizational Design for Digital Transformation online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management, Faculty Director Jeanne Ross offers an in-depth exploration of the five key dimensions of digital transformation, and how successful transformation can occur when systematically driven. These five dimensions form the foundational design principles for organizations seeking to leverage new technologies for innovation. The program also explores how business leaders can influence their organizational mindset to change deeply held, traditional practices. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll examine ways to facilitate digital transformation in your company through business design and strategy, and earn an MIT Sloan digital certificate, online and at your own pace.Is this course for you?This program is designed for leaders across sectors who are eager to make digital transformation a strategic priority and optimize their digital business models. Mid-, senior- and top-level managers, including C-suites and other leaders, can benefit from the opportunity to engage with industry experts within the MIT network, and learn to leverage an array of digital technologies to develop new value propositions for their customers.

title: Managerial Finance
about: Make informed managerial and investment decisions with a practical understanding of your organisation’s financial health.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science

Accessed 26 May, 2022.85%The proportion of finance teams that are currently experiencing or planning transformation.Gartner (Nd). Accessed 26 May, 2022.Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)To effectively drive organisational success, business leaders and managers across functions require a firm grasp of finance. It’s a key component to understanding how an organisation operates, and these professionals need to be commercially-minded to participate in financial discussions and decision-making. The Managerial Finance online certificate course from LSE equips you with a practical grounding in modern finance. Over the course of six short weeks, you’ll develop the tools to understand corporate finance, financial statements and reports, and fundamentals such as the time value of money. You’ll also learn how to apply these to your business context through forecasting methods, project evaluation, realistic performance plans, and the monitoring of financial outcomes. Increase your managerial impact with stronger financial insight, and make more informed contributions to organisational discussions and decisions.Is this course for you?As employees are promoted to more senior positions or management, these new roles often call for greater financial accountability. This online certificate course focuses on providing vital corporate finance knowledge and skills to non-financial managers, and is geared towards anyone in a managerial or leadership position – as well as those aspiring towards one. You’ll develop your commercial acumen, as well as a practical understanding of the dynamic between a company's finances and its non-financial departments and projects.This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. title: Blockchain Technologies: Business Innovation and Application Online Short Course
about: Harness the economic potential of blockchain technology.
Course overview:
Course overview73%The proportion of financial executives who believe their organization will lose an opportunity for competitive advantage if it doesn’t adopt blockchain.Deloitte (2021).40 millionThe number of jobs that blockchain is predicted to affect or enhance by 2030.PwC (2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
Blockchain technology has the potential to fundamentally change the way business is conducted, and to transform the foundations of our economic and social systems. The MIT Sloan School of Management Blockchain Technologies: Business Innovation and Application online short course draws on the work of leading MIT faculty and cryptoeconomics expert Christian Catalini, and examines blockchain technologies from an economic perspective.
With a focus on its organizational opportunities and limitations, the program will equip you with the tools to leverage blockchain technology to drive innovation and efficiency in your company. On completion, you’ll be able to implement a blockchain-based solution to address a business problem within your own context.
Is this course for you?This blockchain online short course is not technical, but rather focuses on the applications of blockchain technology for business. It’s geared toward leaders and managers seeking a deeper understanding of the impact of blockchain technologies in an economic environment, and to identify areas for implementation in their organization.
What is blockchain implementation?
When it comes to blockchain technology, there are a few implementation methods that businesses can choose from. The most common method of  implementation is a private blockchain. In this implementation, the blockchain is controlled by a single organization or group of organizations. This allows businesses to have more control over who has access to the blockchain and how it is used.
Blockchain development
Before businesses can start implementing blockchain technologies, they need to understand the basics of blockchain concepts and development. Learn about distributed databases that allow for secure and transparent transactions. This online short course can equip you with an understanding of blockchain solutions, networks, ecosystems, concepts and development.
Understand the business applications that can be implemented
This blockchain course can teach you how to harness the power of this exciting new technology. In addition to learning the impact of blockchain technologies in an economic environment, you will also gain a deeper understanding of its business applications. This can help you to determine whether blockchain is a good fit for your business.

title: Digital Marketing Online Short Course
about: Learn how to design and implement an integrated digital marketing campaign.
Course overview:
Course overview68%The proportion of marketers who report that paid digital advertising is “very important” or “extremely important” to their overall marketing strategy.HubSpot (2020).9 hours, 22 minutesThe average amount of time South Africans spend using the internet daily.We are Social and Hootsuite (Jan, 2020).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)
An effective digital marketing strategy is key if you want to ensure that your brand remains visible and competitive in the modern market.
This University of Cape Town (UCT) Digital Marketing online short course will teach you how to reach the right audience by helping you to develop the online marketing skills you need to improve targeting and personalisation, and create a consistent cross-platform brand narrative. Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll learn to develop an integrated digital strategy that uses the right tools for the right purposes and aligns internet marketing priorities with bottom-line business goals.
Win the war for attention and secure verifiable proof of your new digital marketing capabilities with an official certificate from UCT.
Is this course for you?
The Digital Marketing online course from UCT is as appropriate for business owners looking to boost their brand’s online presence as it is for existing and aspiring marketing professionals. Those already working in a marketing role can use this opportunity to upgrade their skills to keep up with the times. Meanwhile, professionals just entering the field will benefit from the sound introduction to digital marketing that this short course provides. Students can enjoy a personalised online learning experience and access the right level of support for their needs – the student support team is available at all times to offer assistance where it’s required. There are no formal prerequisites for this course.The University of Cape Town (UCT) and GetSmarter are committed to gender empowerment and working towards an equal future. In celebration of National Women's Day, get 20% off when you register and pay for this course during the month of August* using the code WOMENOFUCT. *Exclusive offer valid until 31 August 2022

title: Sports Management: Business Principles in Sport
about: Apply core business skills and strategies to empower your career in the sports industry.
Course overview:
Course overviewPrepare for the future of sports“[W]ith the South African sports industry facing an unprecedented level of change and disruption, it has never been so important to prepare for what’s to come in order to stay ahead of the game.” – Kelvin Watt, Managing Director, Nielsen SportsBizcommunity (Jun, 2018).646 millionThe expected total of eSports viewership in 2023.Business Insider (Dec, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
Brought on by the growth of technology, changing consumer habits and an eSports revolution, the sports industry is facing an unprecedented level of change – by 2022, the global sports market is expected to reach $614.1 billion.1 The transformative effects of these factors and how to respond to them requires qualified professionals in all aspects of management, from marketing to sponsorship, events, coaching, technology, media, and administration.
During this Sports Management: Business Principles in Sport online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT), you’ll have the opportunity to refine your business management knowledge for use in the context of the sports industry. Learn sports-relevant business strategies and engage in personal reflection, as you build the fundamental skills needed for success as a sports manager.
1 Business Wire (May, 2019)Is this course for you?This online course is ideal for professionals already working in the sports industry, and who wish to validate or update their business acumen within the sports context. Those aiming to enter the sports industry will benefit from the foundational combination of business knowledge and industry insight, while entrepreneurs who are interested in a new venture in the realm of sports will gain valuable understanding of the industry at large.

title: Negotiation Programme
about: Achieve optimal negotiation outcomes using practical skills and theories developed by LSE.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview: Course Overview54%The percentage of employees who will require significant reskilling and upskilling by 2022, with negotiation being one of the skills growing in prominence.World Economic Forum (2018).NegotiationA skill that CIOs consider increasingly important in new hires over the next three years.Deloitte (2018).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Effective negotiation skills are crucial to success in any industry or organisation. Great negotiators achieve results and enhance relationships by planning and tailoring their approach to the specific context rather than acting on impulse.The highly interactive Negotiation Programme from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) enables you to reach your potential as a negotiator and enhance your business impact. Practise real-world scenarios with professionals from the UK and further afield in live online negotiations, where you’ll apply proven negotiation techniques in a digital environment. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll analyse different approaches to negotiating based on the communication channel, and investigate the impact of culture, power, and influence in negotiation. Finally, using expert insight and peer feedback, you’ll create a development plan to identify your personal negotiation style and provide an active record of your improvement.Live online negotiation sessions will be between one-and-a-half to two hours long. You'll be able to indicate your time-slot preference for these sessions based on your time zone and schedule.Is this course for you?This six-week course is suitable for any professional interested in developing their strategic negotiation skills and confidence to become more influential, persuasive, and impactful. The skills you’ll gain are applicable across a broad range of industries and business functions. The practical strategies and tools you’ll explore during this course on negotiation are relevant to both your current and future career. Novice negotiators will gain knowledge of new skills and techniques, while those with more experience will have the opportunity to hone their skills through an increased understanding of negotiation strategies and additional practice in live negotiation sessions. If you’re a professional, entrepreneur, or business owner who interacts with stakeholders, you’ll benefit from the practical nature of this negotiation course.This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 50 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation Module': 'Welcome to Your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Essential concepts of negotiation', 'Module 2': 'Negotiation strategies', 'Module 3': 'Principled negotiation', 'Module 4': 'Creativity and emotions in negotiation', 'Module 5': 'Culture, power, and influence in negotiation', 'Module 6': 'The future of negotiation'}

Becoming a better negotiator influences my overall life – personal and business. This course has enhanced me not only professionally, but helped me in developing better interactions in my personal life. title: MBA Essentials
about: Develop the technical business skills needed to make better managerial decisions.
Course overview: Course overview44.4%A weighted progress score indicating the supply of business-relevant skills in South Africa (with 0% being poor and 100% being prime).World Economic Forum (Oct, 2020).Problem solving and critical thinking Two of the top soft skills required of professionals in 2021.LinkedIn (Feb, 2021).Duration: 15 weeks (excluding orientation)The MBA Essentials online short course from the University of Stellenbosch Business School Executive Development (USB-ED) aims to equip professionals with the insight to make key strategic and operational decisions in any industry. Using a practical, case study-based approach, you’ll learn from experts and thought leaders about the three key pillars of business covered in an MBA course: economics, quantitative methods, and managerial accounting, as well as gain technical skills and broaden your knowledge of probability theory and cost behaviour. You’ll develop these practical capabilities and gain a better-informed perspective of the economic climate, in order to set yourself apart as a business leader or as an MBA programme applicant. Ultimately, you’ll walk away from this online short course with a certificate of completion from USB-ED validating your understanding of certain core MBA fundamentals.Is this course for you?This course is aimed at busy working professionals looking to sharpen their business acumen and develop the skills to stand out in the current corporate landscape. Senior staff, such as managers and executives, will develop a broad understanding of the various factors that influence strategies and the decision-making process. Business owners and entrepreneurs will also benefit from the interactive approach to learning and networking opportunities. If you’re considering a full-time MBA, this course will familiarise you with the fundamentals of some of the key subjects, as well as help you gauge your appetite for further study.USB-ED has received the prestigious triple crown of international accreditation from the three most influential organisations in global business education: the European Foundation for Management Development (EQUIS), the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB), and the Association of MBAs (AMBA). Only 1% of business schools worldwide hold this accreditation.* USB Executive Development (2021).

title: Property Management: Marketing, Contracts and Administration
about: Minimise costs and maximise rental income by taking control of the leasing and maintenance of your own or your clients’ property.
Course overview:
Course overview10 competenciesCommunication and customer service skills are two of the 10 core competencies property managers need to succeed.Mashvisor (Jul, 2019).48%The proportion of commercial real estate professionals who plan to maintain or increase their investment in technology related to tenant experience.Deloitte (Dec, 2020).

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
Rent earned from an additional property can serve as a lucrative secondary source of income, but in order for real estate to be profitable, it needs to be maintained and administered effectively.
The Property Management: Marketing, Contracts and Administration online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) is designed to empower you to assume the role of property manager and take over the maintenance and letting of a real estate portfolio. Develop a core understanding of the business of property by examining key techniques and principles used in the field, and learn how to navigate the practicalities of leasing your own property, applying marketing strategies, and leveraging new technologies to make managing your property more efficient. As you progress through the course, you’ll have the opportunity to practically apply each module’s theoretical learnings by managing a fictional building.
Is this course for you?This course is aimed at both property owners and property professionals who manage, or aspire to manage, real estate. Private investors can empower themselves with the knowledge needed to excel in the business of property, while those working in the property industry can update and refresh their skills. Property administrators, real estate agents, and individuals looking to move into a career in property management for the first time may also find this course beneficial.





This course is certified by the Engineering Council of South Africa (ECSA) for CPD points. The course has an estimated 80 hours of learning and South African engineering professionals can earn up to eight CPD credits.*

International students need to consult their national professional engineering bodies to check whether this course is recognised for points towards maintaining professional status.

*Should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The University of Cape Town and GetSmarter accept no responsibility. If you would like to claim validation or points, use the ECSA validation number UCTGSPMG22.

title: Sustainable Finance
about: Explore the benefits of sustainable finance systems and develop a plan for creating a sustainable economy with long-term value returns.
Course overview: Course overview $200 billionThe amount JPMorgan Chase & Co pledged in 2020 for environmental and economic development deals, while simultaneously restricting fossil fuel loans for oil drilling and coal mining in the Arctic.CNBC News (2020).479The number of green bonds issued worldwide in 2019, up by a quarter compared to the previous year.CNBC News (2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)In today’s business landscape, it’s no longer sufficient for organisations to simply acknowledge global sustainability challenges like climate change, resource depletion, and inequality – they’re expected to lead the way through them.The Sustainable Finance online short course from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL) offers the tools and insights needed to develop financial strategies that create value for society and invest in a sustainable future.Over eight weeks, you’ll learn about the pressures, trends, and opportunities in the current financial system. You’ll also investigate the strategic business implications of social and environmental challenges, and discover how best to plan for the future through sustainable initiatives like impact investing, the integration of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) investing, and positive screening.With expert guidance from CISL faculty, you’ll gain the skills to implement sustainable finance solutions in your own context, and better understand how these strategies can positively impact your organisation’s long-term value gain. This course will also give you new perspectives on how businesses, banks, and insurers are shifting to more sustainable business models that offer positive returns for both their clients and society.Is this course for you?This course will be relevant to anyone interested in harnessing sustainable finance initiatives to bring about positive change – both professionals currently working in the finance sector, such as financial service providers, financial advisors, sustainability consultants, and fund managers, as well as those outside the industry seeking a more practical understanding of how sustainable finance can strategically drive long-term business returns (including managers, marketing specialists, investors, and those who work with NGOs). Policymakers in the public sector will also benefit from this finance course, as will anyone with an interest in integrating environmental considerations into development planning and finance. Similarly, this course is ideal for those looking to understand how both mindsets and the broader financial system are evolving in response to social and environmental pressures and, ultimately, how this can be financially and environmentally beneficial.This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 60 hours of learning. Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. CISL and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Commercial and Contract Law
about: Gain the skills to read, interpret, and draft commercial contracts.
Course overview: Course overviewR35 millionThe amount Ford Motor Company of Southern Africa was fined for contravening the Consumer Protection Act.South African Government (Nov, 2019).Contractual protection"Contracts, either written or oral, not only govern the relationship between parties at various stages of the relationship, but they also provide a degree of protection should things not go according to plan.”SME South Africa (Feb, 2019).Duration: 9 weeks (excluding orientation)An understanding of commercial and contract law is crucial to doing business in South Africa. Commercial law focuses on the purchase and sale of goods and services, including intangible entities such as intellectual property rights. Contract law, on the other hand, underpins private enterprises and provides the legal framework within which people and legal entities transact and exchange resources.This online course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will provide you with an overview of the South African legal system, an introduction to contract law, and a nuanced understanding of the Consumer Protection Act. You’ll learn the requirements of contractual validity, as well as the obligations and terms of a contract. Develop the skills and knowledge to recognise, address, and offer solutions to problematic areas in contracts. You’ll avoid expensive mistakes and be able to negotiate better results for your company, in your personal life, or for your clients.Is this course for you?This online short course is suitable for anyone working with contracts in the business world, as the knowledge gained can be applied across a wide range of sectors and professions. Bankers, insurance brokers, asset managers, publishers, employment agents, and business owners will all benefit from exploring the legal frameworks that shape the way organisations operate in South Africa. This course can also help paralegals broaden their legal knowledge, ensure business leaders and management understand what contractual decision-making entails, and allow professionals to add further value in their existing role through an up-to-date knowledge of the commercial legal landscape.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'An introduction to contract law and the South African legal system', 'Module 2': 'Requirements for the formation of a valid contract', 'Module 3': 'Terms of a contract and contractual obligations', 'Module 4': 'The Consumer Protection Act', 'Module 5': 'Contracts of sale and contracts of lease', 'Module 6': 'Contracts of insurance and agency contracts', 'Module 7': 'Contracting with businesses', 'Module 8': 'Civil litigation and alternative dispute resolution procedures', 'Module 9': 'Basic contract drafting skills'}

What will set you apart: ['The ability to read, interpret, and draft contracts within the South African business landscape.', 'The skills needed to oversee all contractual business decisions and confirm their legitimacy.', 'A comprehensive understanding of the Consumer Protection Act in order to ensure your organisation adheres to its rules and regulations.', 'A certificate of completion as proof of your legal competencies.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']
About the certificate: Develop an understanding of commercial and contract law, and earn an official certificate of completion from the University of Cape Town.Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Neuroscience for Business
about: Harness the power of neuroplasticity to positively impact your personal and organizational performance.
Course overview: Course overview46%The share of professionals indicating that leaders should strive for agility and nimbleness as a critical priority.LinkedIn (Jan, 2020).12%The percentage of professionals that believe their leaders have the mindsets needed to lead them forward.MIT Sloan Management Review (Jan, 2020).In today’s rapidly evolving business climate, it’s imperative that leaders are able to navigate environmental uncertainty with resilience and agility.Drawing on key scientific principles, the Neuroscience for Business online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management will help you understand how changing your thinking and behaviors can improve your performance in both personal and professional contexts. The program takes an action-based approach to leadership, equipping participants with the tools to help analyze thought patterns and rewire habits to become more effective problem-solvers.Over the course of six weeks, you'll explore neuroscience principles like neuroplasticity to rewire your brain and your organization to become more effective, agile, and resilient in your role.Is this course for you?The design of this neuroleadership-focused online course is suited to current executives, managers, and leaders looking to improve their professional and organizational capabilities. Additionally, anyone looking to move into a leadership role will be able to develop key skills for growth. Those interested in applying neuroscience in areas such as coaching, management training, and leadership development will also benefit from this course. This applies to consultants, executive coaches, and learning and development professionals who want to enhance employee engagement and workplace culture.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Understanding and optimizing your brain', 'Module 2': 'Neuroplasticity: Rewiring your brain', 'Module 3': 'Brain agility and cognitive diversity', 'Module 4': 'Maximize your brain: Building mental resilience', 'Module 5': 'Leadership visualization and action', 'Module 6': 'Leadership influence and neuroplasticity in organizations'}
