title: Ethics of AI
about: Investigate the ethical challenges and opportunities presented by artificial intelligence (AI).
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview: Course overview66%The percentage of consumers who expect AI models to be free of prejudice and bias.Capgemini (Sep, 2020).59%The share of companies that invest in ethical AI, even if it impacts profits.EY (Jul, 2020).Duration: 3 weeksArtificial intelligence (AI) is developing rapidly, transforming the way we work and interact. Yet, AI is rife with ethical challenges – from potential biases in algorithmic recruiting technology to the privacy implications of work surveillance applications. In order to implement AI effectively, it is essential to understand and address these ethical dilemmas, and to stay up-to-date on trends and best practices.The Ethics of AI three-week online course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) examines the societal challenges and opportunities presented by AI. Through a condensed learning format, you’ll build an analytical toolkit and enduring skill set to apply to real-world issues. Discover how technological change can impact the distribution of economic resources and productivity gains, learn how AI can exacerbate or combat discrimination and power imbalances in the workplace, and investigate how technology is changing everyday social interactions.Over the course of this high-quality three-week master class, you’ll unpack the ethical tensions inherent in AI with insights from faculty at LSE’s Department of Philosophy, Logic and Scientific Method – internationally renowned for a type of philosophy that is both continuous with the sciences and socially relevant. Build your intellectual curiosity, and update your personal and professional skill set in a consolidated amount of time.Is this course for you?This highly topical and applicable online course is designed for a range of professionals within the public sector, private sector, and civil society who are faced with ethical issues relating to AI, data, and general technological advancement. Leaders working in organisations that deal with big data or who are looking to implement AI technologies will be empowered to guide their organisations towards responsible innovation by gaining tools for managing the social impact of potential technological changes. Professionals within the tech industry will also benefit from enhancing their knowledge of ethics and AI as a way to further their career development and personal growth. This course is applicable not only to those looking for professional development, but also to anyone interested in understanding the impact of AI on individuals and society.
What will set you apart: ['An understanding of the theoretical foundations of democracy and administrations to diagnose challenges and opportunities posed by AI.', 'The ability to evaluate inequalities of resources, opportunities, and power in the workplace as a result of AI.', 'An understanding of the roles and obligations of governments and multinational corporations in responsibly designing and deploying AI.', 'A set of critical thinking skills to debate key ethical issues in AI, delivered entirely online. ', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.', 'Work through your downloadable and online instructional material', 'Interact with your peers and learning facilitators through discussion forums', 'Enjoy a wide range of interactive content including videos, podcasts, quizzes, and more ', 'Develop an essential skill set to apply immediately in your context and career', 'Apply what you learn throughout this master class experience and develop an analytical set of tools to practice ethical reasoning and manage the diverse impacts of AI.']
About the certificate: Validate your skills online with an official digital badge from the London School of Economics and Political Science.

title: Cybersecurity: Managing Risk in the Information Age
about: Develop your personal cybersecurity leadership plan.
Course overview:
Course overview$248.26 billionThe projected size of the cybersecurity market by 2023.Markets and Markets (Sep, 2018).142 millionThe number of threats blocked by Symantec’s Global Intelligence Network daily.Symantec (Feb, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)News of large-scale cybersecurity threats and cyberattacks frequently dominate the headlines: hackers exploiting vulnerabilities of retail giants, foreign influence in elections, and new forms of ransomware underscore the importance of preparing for these threats.Cyber risk management has become a fundamental component of business operations, and understanding and mitigating risk has become an essential skill for business leaders, analysts, as well as security and technology specialists.The Cybersecurity: Managing Risk in the Information Age online short course from Harvard’s Office of the Vice Provost for Advances in Learning (VPAL), in association with HarvardX, equips you with a comprehensive understanding of how to identify and manage operational, litigation, and reputational risk. Over eight weeks, you’ll learn how to conduct a vulnerability assessment and mitigate web and network security vulnerabilities within an organization’s networks, systems, and data, and explore strategies for responding to a cyberattack. Develop the knowledge and skills to protect the integrity and confidentiality of digital assets with this cybersecurity course.Is this course for you?
This online short course offers an in-depth exploration of cybersecurity that is valuable for executives and specialist roles such as cybersecurity analyst, security administration, or information security manager. Business leaders will gain the knowledge needed to lead their organizations through the complexities of the cybersecurity landscape, and develop the know-how to set appropriate budget guides for this task. This web security-focused online course will also allow cybersecurity professionals, risk analysts, technology specialists, and information security professionals the opportunity to build confidence and understanding in a key area of importance for their roles. Other professionals will benefit from gaining an up-to-date overview and understanding of cybersecurity and risk.
Learn cybersecurity fundamentals of systems and network security
With cybersecurity threats on the rise, so too is awareness around these threats and attacks. As a business leader, executive, or specialist, it is essential to have an understanding of cybersecurity to protect your organization from a potential cyberattack and its associated risks. The Cybersecurity: Managing Risk in the Information Age online short course from Harvard's VPAL provides you with the knowledge and skills to confidently lead your organization through the cybersecurity landscape.
Grow your confidence and understanding
With cybersecurity threats on the rise, so too is awareness around these threats and attacks. As a business leader, executive, or specialist, it is essential to have an understanding of cybersecurity to protect your organization from a potential cyberattack and its associated risks. The Cybersecurity: Managing Risk in the Information Age online short course from Harvard's VPAL provides you with the knowledge and skills to confidently lead your organization through the cybersecurity landscape.
What are common types of cyberattacks?
Data breaches and cyberattacks come in many forms, and there are many common types of attacks that you should be aware of. One common type of cyberattack is phishing, a technique used to obtain digital information such as passwords or credit card details by pretending to be a trustworthy entity by using electronic communication. Cybercriminals often use phishing emails as the initial entry point into a network to steal data or install malware. Malware is another common type of cyberattack and refers to software designed to disrupt or gain unauthorized access to a computer. A cybersecurity course is a great way to gain an understanding of cyberattacks and improve cybersecurity skills.
Protect networks and computer systems
It's important that business leaders and cybersecurity professionals, such as a cybersecurity engineer and security architect, protect networks and computer systems from unauthorized access and cyber threats. Data breaches and cyberattacks can have a devastating effect on individuals, businesses, and governments, making data integrity a key  issue for organizations.
Ensure data integrity
Data integrity is the assurance that data has not been changed or corrupted in any way, accidental or intentional. This cybersecurity course can equip you with cybersecurity awareness, understanding, and skills to develop and lead your organization's cybersecurity plan.

title: Nutrition Science course
about: Understand the foundational science underlying nutrition and how it’s linked to health, and preventing disease.
Course overview:
Course overview59/100The score of the average American diet on the Healthy Eating Index (HEI), which measures how well food intake aligns with the Dietary Guidelines for Americans, 2020 – 2025.Dietary Guidelines for Americans (Nd). Accessed 18 June, 2021. 28%The percentage of Americans who reported that their diet worsened during the COVID-19 pandemic.Gallup (Apr, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)As a health or wellness professional, having a sound understanding of the science behind nutrition is crucial for giving clients and patients informed advice about longevity, vitality, and holistic disease management.The Nutrition Science online short course from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE), a part of Stanford Medicine, provides you with a foundation in nutrition as it explores the role of micronutrients and macronutrients in the body, and how this relates to human health in different contexts of human development.Guided by the renowned Prof. Christopher Gardner, you’ll learn to interpret nutritional evidence and make nutritional assessments and dietary analyses, with the assistance of nutritional guidelines. You'll also gain the insight to recognize the value of optimal nutrition in terms of preventative care, develop the skills to critically examine contemporary research, and ultimately earn a certificate of completion from the SCHE.Is this course for you?The Nutrition Science online short course is aimed at healthcare professionals, including medical doctors, occupational therapists, dietitians, pharmacists, and nurses, as well as lifestyle specialists such as nutritionists, fitness instructors, coaches, health educators, and food writers. The curriculum is designed to help these professionals grow in their current roles by providing them with the knowledge and frameworks to advise patients and clients on dietary plans for healthy living and disease prevention.
The importance of health educationHealth and nutrition education has become increasingly recognized due to the advent of COVID-19. This nutrition course introduces learners to basic concepts of nutrition and how these concepts are linked to health. Modules cover the major nutrient groups and their role in human health, as well as the different methods of nutrition assessment, highlighting the importance of dietary and nutritional guidelines. Additionally, the course offers  nutritional information which can be used to maintain a healthy diet and prevent disease.

title: Digital Photography
about: Learn how to capture and edit high-quality digital photographs for business or personal purposes.
Course overview:
Course overview32%The percentage of marketers who say visual images are the single most important form of content for their business.Social Media Examiner (2018).
10 trendsA focus on vertical shots is one of 10 key movements shaping photography currently.Design Shack (2019).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)Images are a powerful way to immortalise moments and tell compelling stories. Whether you plan to draw on photography in a personal or professional capacity, these skills are a valuable addition to your repertoire of competencies.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Digital Photography online short course introduces you to the features and functionalities of digital SLR cameras, and teaches you how to use different settings to take high-quality images under a range of conditions. You’ll also discover the principles of composition, and learn basic photo-editing techniques.During the course, you’ll apply what you learn practically to produce a range of images, and you’ll benefit from ongoing constructive feedback from your head tutor, professional photographer Roberta Crumplin.Is this course for you?This course covers foundational digital photography terms and techniques. It’s therefore suited to both hobbyists and aspiring or self-taught photographers wanting to build or refine a practical skill set. Similarly, the content will appeal to professionals looking to develop digital photography skills for application in marketing, journalism, and other business contexts. In order to complete this course, students need access to their own digital SLR camera.

title: Tax Law
about: Gain the confidence and skills to effectively manage your personal or corporate tax affairs.
Course overview: Course overview3.1 millionThe number of companies that are registered for tax in South Africa.South African Revenue Service, and National Treasury (Dec, 2018).38%The percentage that personal income tax contributed to total tax revenue collected in South Africa during the 2017-2018 fiscal year.Statistics South Africa (Jun, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)As tax is an inescapable part of life, it’s critical that individuals, business owners, and finance professionals have a solid grasp of the principles of taxation and their related obligations.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Tax Law online short course seeks to demystify the world of tax administration by improving your understanding of the latest South African tax laws and their implications for you or your company. Independent citizens can empower themselves with the skills to manage their own tax affairs, eliminating the need for costly external help. Business owners and consultants can learn how to run legally compliant, tax-efficient enterprises, and accountants, bookkeepers, and lawyers can refine their understanding of current tax legislation so that they’re better positioned to offer clients advice and assistance.

title: Public Policy Analysis Online Certificate Course
about: Gain analytical frameworks and practical skills for analysing, evaluating, and communicating public policy.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview4 Policy failure factorsOverly optimistic expectations, dispersed governance, inadequate collaboration, and the unpredictability of the political cycle have been cited as the top reasons policies fail.LSE (Jan, 2019).Engage with public policy“The LSE School of Public Policy prepares the policy and political leaders of tomorrow to transform people and societies.” – Professor Andrés Velasco, Dean of the School of Public PolicyLSE (2020). Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)
In the context of an increasingly connected and complex world, it is vital to be able to analyse and anticipate the impact of public policy and evaluate interventions to make more informed, evidence-based policy decisions and recommendations.
The Public Policy Analysis online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) merges research, theory, and practice, as it empowers participants with analytical frameworks for understanding the policy process. Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll gain the quantitative tools and techniques needed to conduct evidence-based public policy impact evaluations and develop effective policy communication skills. 
Benefit from this multidisciplinary approach to public policy and practice your skills by engaging with real-world, global case studies. Guided by expert LSE faculty with topical research experience across a variety of policy areas in Europe, Africa, and the United States, you’ll develop practical skills and strategies for immediate application in policy-related projects, or within your organisation.
Is this course for you?This course, developed by LSE’s School of Public Policy, is relevant for public policy professionals. Policy makers, civil servants, NGO staff, and individuals in public and private sector organisations seeking to influence public policy design and better understand their current roles within policy formulation will find it beneficial. Those in the public sector, non-profit, consultancies, and think tanks – who want to enhance their impact by critically engaging with public policy, employing evidence-based impact evaluations, and developing the insight to make policy recommendations and decisions – will also benefit from this course.
Understanding the role of political and social science
The social and political sciences are a vital part of public policy making. They help us to understand the complexities of human behaviour, social interactions, and political systems. The study of social science can also provide insights into the workings of government and the economy. Public policy making is a complex process that is different in every context. This online course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) will give you an understanding of different policy making processes, and how to design effective public policies.


This Public Policy Analysis online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 80 hours of learning.
Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Advanced Business Risk Management
about: Elevate your ability to manage volatility and uncertainty to support company performance.
Course overview:
Course overview69%The proportion of companies surveyed that have a formal risk management department in place.AON (2019).Top 10Labour unrest and failure of governance are two of the top 10 risks facing businesses in South Africa.The Institute of Risk Management South Africa (2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Owing to widespread economic, political, ecological, and technological change, businesses of today are facing a broad range of risks that, if not adequately addressed, could threaten their survival. As a result, more organisations are realising the importance of having competent senior risk management professionals on their side.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Advanced Business Risk Management online short course moves beyond foundational concepts to teach you how to not just identify and assess organisational risks, but develop strategies and controls to mitigate them. You’ll explore the management of reputational, financial, investment, and behavioural risks, and discover how to use insights to inform decision-making.As the course journey simulates the risk management process, you can expect a highly practical learning experience, with the chance to apply theory and best practices to real-world case studies.Is this course for you?Working professionals who want to build or further a career in business risk management will find this course useful. Established risk officers can update their skill sets and boost their knowledge of new developments to ensure optimal performance in their current roles. At the same time, those with business and management experience can acquire the tools and know-how necessary to shift into a risk-focused role. There are no formal prerequisites for this course, but financial literacy would be advantageous and it is recommended that students have either completed the UCT Business Risk Management online short course or are currently working in the risk management field.
This advanced business risk management course is endorsed by UCT’s African Institute of Financial Markets and Risk Management (AIFMRM).
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'The business context', 'Module 2': 'Governance, ethics and reputational risk', 'Module 3': 'Internal controls', 'Module 4': 'Information systems risk', 'Module 5': 'Financial risk and foreign operations', 'Module 6': 'Investment risk', 'Module 7': 'Behavioural risk', 'Module 8': 'Risk awareness: Recording, monitoring and reviewing'}

Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Commercial Real Estate Analysis and Investment
about: Identify opportunities for profitable investment in the commercial real estate sector.
University name: MIT School of Architecture and Planning
Course overview:
Course overview$1.9 million The average commercial real estate sale in 2019. 

National Association of Realtors (May, 2019).
$893.2 billionThe forecasted market size, measured by revenue, of the commercial real estate industry in the United States in 2021.

IBISWorld (Dec, 2020).
Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Making informed investment decisions in commercial real estate hinges on understanding micro and macroeconomic theories and frameworks, and using practical financial analysis tools. The Commercial Real Estate Analysis and Investment online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (SA+P) draws on real-world examples of real estate investment and development projects, with a focus on unique tools, terms, and theories that have been pioneered and developed by the Faculty Director, David Geltner. On completion of this course, you’ll be armed with the skills needed for real estate valuation, investment analysis, and decision making, and you’ll earn an MIT SA+P certificate, validating your newfound real estate finance and development knowledge. Is this course for you?This online short course is geared toward finance, property investment, and real estate professionals who want to understand how to apply financial tools to analyze the commercial real estate market and make informed investment decisions. This program has a technical focus, and previous financial or real estate investment experience will significantly benefit you.

title: Women in Leadership
about: Develop your leadership style to overcome workplace challenges faced by women while expanding your influence as a leader in business.
Course overview:
Course overview5%The difference in share performance from companies with more than 20% female management compared to those with less than 15% female management.CNBC (Oct, 2019).20%The percentage by which gender diversity in the boardroom has increased – it has doubled over the last decade.Credit Suisse (Oct, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Companies that rank highly for gender diversity on their executive teams are 21% more likely to outperform on profitability, and 27% more likely to have superior value creation.1 The connection between gender equality and financial performance has never been more clear, and globally the barriers and unconscious bias experienced by women in leadership positions are being recognised.
You have the opportunity to overcome these hurdles for yourself and the women around you by developing practical strategies for leadership development with the University of Stellenbosch Business School Executive Development (USB-ED). The Women in Leadership online short course will help you explore the core strengths of female business leadership and how it can be used to bolster the performance of your organisation. You’ll learn to mitigate unique workplace obstacles and build the business case for greater representation of women in senior positions.
1 McKinsey (Jan, 2018).Is this course for you?This course is particularly relevant to women executives and managers seeking to progress within their leadership role and expand their impact. Those new to senior management positions or those preparing to move into such positions will also benefit by learning to overcome the unique gender-biased challenges with long-term solutions and strategies. Human resources professionals or those aiming to increase representation and diversity will get the opportunity to develop their own diversity proposal, and will formalise their commitment to leadership with a certificate from the University of Stellenbosch Business School Executive Development. As students learn to realise their leadership goals, they’ll get the opportunity to join a network of empowered female professionals across Africa through this leadership course designed by and for women. USB-ED has received the prestigious triple crown of international accreditation from the three most influential organisations in global business education: the European Foundation for Management Development (EQUIS), the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB), and the Association of MBAs (AMBA). Only 1% of business schools worldwide hold this accreditation.* USB Executive Development (2021).The University of Stellenbosch Business School Executive Development and GetSmarter are committed to gender empowerment and diversity in the workplace. In celebration of National Women's Day, get 10% off when you register and pay for this course during the month of August* using the code USBWILWD2022. *Exclusive offer valid until 31 August 2022
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Unconscious gender bias in the workplace', 'Module 2': 'Developing a leadership identity', 'Module 3': 'Communicating and negotiating with power', 'Module 4': 'Team development and optimising performance', 'Module 5': 'Social capital', 'Module 6': 'Overcoming barriers', 'Module 7': 'Women as strategic leaders', 'Module 8': 'The importance of diversity'}
Convenors: {'Anita Bosch': ['Associate Professor, University of Stellenbosch Business School Executive Education', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBbkFIIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--deb779c3c218758691607c52b5c31009ac2acf7b/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/university_of_stellenbosch_business_school_women_in_leadership_course_convenor_anita_bosch.jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['A diversity proposal for a business of your choice, highlighting the importance of representation.', 'The ability to turn workplace challenges into opportunities for leadership development and organisation-wide solutions.', 'A refined understanding of your leadership style that harnesses the unique strengths of being a female business leader.', 'The skills to empower the women around you and strategically leverage their strengths to improve business performance.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']
About the certificate: Gain practical strategies for navigating the workplace challenges faced by women and earn an official certificate of completion from University of Stellenbosch Business School Executive Development.Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Energy Efficiency and Sustainability
about: Learn to evaluate and implement energy-saving strategies in industrial, commercial, and large-scale residential settings.
Course overview:
Course overviewR338 billionThe total economic loss in South Africa over the past ten years due to loadshedding. CSIR (Jan, 2020).50%The proportion of construction and property decision makers who have experienced operational savings of between 1% and 10% in sustainable buildings.Ramboll (2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)The sustainable use of energy in buildings has become an imperative – it’s key not just to tackling climate change, but to improving the performance of facilities and the competitiveness of businesses too. Consequently, it’s important that anyone involved in the construction, manufacturing, energy, and oil and transport industries today is well-versed in the field of energy efficiency.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Energy Efficiency and Sustainability online short course offers a holistic overview of the energy efficiency landscape and the economics of this field. Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll explore the latest developments and regulations in the energy industry, and investigate energy use in commercial and industrial contexts. You’ll also learn how to verify energy savings using industry-accepted techniques, examine how to assess the financial viability of energy-efficiency projects, and build a strong business case for interventions.Is this course for you?This course, which is certified by the Engineering Council of South Africa (ECSA) for CPD points, is suited to practising and consulting engineers, facility managers, architects, building designers, energy managers, energy auditors, manufacturing professionals, and environmental consultants. In essence, it’s designed for all professionals looking to learn how to identify energy conservation opportunities to promote efficiency in buildings and businesses. Additionally, professionals will gain the knowledge needed to specialise their business offerings and take advantage of this increasingly important trend. As students will be asked to apply formulas and perform calculations, basic competence in mathematics is required in order to complete this course.


This course is certified by the Engineering Council of South Africa (ECSA) for CPD points. The course has an estimated 80 hours of learning and South African engineering professionals can earn up to eight CPD credits.*
International students need to consult their national professional engineering bodies to check whether this course is recognised for points towards maintaining professional status.
*Should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The University of Cape Town and GetSmarter accept no responsibility. If you would like to claim validation or points, use the ECSA validation number UCTGSEES22.The University of Cape Town (UCT) and GetSmarter are committed to gender empowerment and working towards an equal future. In celebration of National Women's Day, get 20% off when you register and pay for this course during the month of August* using the code WOMENOFUCT. *Exclusive offer valid until 31 August 2022

I will definitely pursue advanced study in this area. It’s been an interesting journey. I know I am a better architect today than I was eight weeks ago when I started this course.'}

title: Strategic Business Management
about: Drive business success with a dynamic and competitive strategy.
Course overview: Course overview70%The percentage of executives who feel their strategy is not clear enough about how they create value for their customers.Strategy& (2019).4 out of 5The amount of executives who admit their business strategy isn’t well understood within their own company.Strategy& (2019).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)South Africa’s current economic climate is characterised by change and competition. This environment has created the need for managers with solid theoretical knowledge and practical skills in business management. In order to succeed, organisations need to remain competitive, adaptable, and resilient through accurate planning, implementation and forward-thinking strategies. The Strategic Business Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) aims to equip you with these critical business skills, enabling you to thrive in an increasingly competitive business world. You’ll apply innovative and analytical thinking to various market analyses, such as a SWOT analysis, STEEPLE analysis, Porter’s five-force model, and the SELECT framework. In applying strategic management processes to a hypothetical business environment, you’ll walk away with a business strategy, ready for implementation, that is aligned to your long-term organisational objectives.Is this course for you?This course is designed for professionals aiming to pursue a career in business management. Aspiring business managers will become empowered to move to the next tier of management with theoretical and practical business skills from this online short course. Existing managers will benefit by advancing and updating their skill set – better equipping them to navigate the contemporary South African business environment. It’s also relevant to organisation stakeholders who need the skills to enable greater strategic direction within their business.

title: Feature Journalism
about: Navigate the styles, structure, and processes of feature journalism.
Course overview:
Course overview65%The amount of people who trust traditional media as a source for general news and information.Edelman (2019).36%More than a third of newsrooms increased the number of long-form pieces they ran over the course of 2019.International Center for Journalists (2019).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)The rise of online content marketing and brand journalism has ignited the demand for professionals who produce quality content that is accurate, informative, and generates readership. The University of Cape Town’s (UCT) Feature Journalism online short course equips you with the skills needed to research, write, and sell your features to a variety of publications. Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll refine and enhance your writing skills as you become a better journalist and build towards your writing career.
This highly practical online course explores the development of feature stories, research methods, and interview techniques, amongst other essential content elements such as language, structure, and editing methods. Navigate the legal aspects and ethical implications of journalism, and discover best practices for working with editors. Throughout the course you’ll produce your own 2000-word feature article, guided and reviewed by the award-winning journalist André Wiesner.11 André Wiesner (Nd.) Accessed 2019.Is this course for you?This course is designed for anyone wanting to develop their professional writing by acquiring in-depth research and interviewing skills, as well as those hoping to improve their readers’ experience by refining their structuring and editing knowledge. This is valuable to anyone hoping to enter into the journalism industry, and existing writers who wish to further enhance their skill set and expand their expertise. The course also offers the chance to validate your feature journalism skills with a certificate from UCT, and offers you the chance to expand your writing network by collaborating with fellow writers.

In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.
What past students think: {'Klara LootsPast student': 'The biggest lesson I learnt was to think less (and to ‘show’ rather than ‘tell’) when it comes to writing – it is the only way to be truly original – you can check facts and grammar later – just get it out there, onto paper, and then go back and use a bit of common sense – don’t think, just write!'}

title: Fundamentals of Cybersecurity
about: Learn how to defend your organisation’s systems and data against the growing threat of cyberattacks.
Course overview: Course overview30%The predicted global cybersecurity spend to come from banking, discrete manufacturing, and central government by 2023.HashedOut (May, 2020).$430.33 billionThe predicted global market size of the cybersecurity industry by 2027.Cision (May, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)The digital age has revolutionised the way that organisations do business. Unfortunately, however, it has also exposed companies, and their customers, to many new risks. With cyberattacks now a real threat in Africa and beyond, there’s a need across industries for professionals with the skills to address online security vulnerabilities.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Fundamentals of Cybersecurity online short course introduces you to the key elements of cybersecurity management, from both a South African and international perspective. Learn to become the defender of sensitive company data and learn how to make sound decisions to support your organisation in both thwarting attacks and responding appropriately to incidents.Is this course for you?This course is beneficial for employees at all levels, both technical and managerial, who currently work within cybersecurity. Those new to the industry or within administrative or information security roles will gain the latest knowledge of cybersecurity and develop a competitive edge within the growing job market. Management professionals will explore the regulations and legislation that affects cybersecurity, and learn to develop dedicated cybersecurity training programmes and incident policies. All professionals will have the opportunity to gain the confidence and skills to identify threats and implement the necessary measures to protect an organisation from cyber risks.

title: Women’s Leadership Program
about: Identify your unique strengths and use them to drive network-supported innovation.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview:
Program overviewTop 5LinkedIn research reveals that emotional intelligence is one of the most in-demand skills for organizations.LinkedIn (Jan, 2020).31%The proportion of senior management roles held by women globally in 2021, up from 25% in 2017.Grant Thornton (2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Women remain underrepresented in leadership roles globally. To succeed, women must learn to navigate both the external factors that hinder their access to leadership roles and the internal factors that could cost them opportunities for advancement. The online Women’s Leadership Program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education equips you with the knowledge and skills to develop your full professional potential as leaders in society. Through exploration of values-based leadership and emotional self-mastery, you’ll strengthen your emotional intelligence, understand your individual strengths, and learn to harness creative thinking to maximize the capacity for business challenges, innovation, and problem-solving. Embark on a personal leadership development journey and learn to utilize your distinctive abilities to help guide yourself, your teams, and your organization towards success. Is this program for you?This online leadership course aims to equip existing and aspiring women leaders with the confidence, self-awareness, networking, and leadership communication skills to effectively lead their teams and organizations. Business leaders and senior managers will benefit from gaining insight into the behaviors that have the potential to shape future business, as well as leadership skills to effect positive change within their organizations. It’s also beneficial to middle and junior managers looking to gain personal and professional leadership development in order to prepare to move into a senior or executive management role.
Yale SOM Executive Education offers multiple online, on-campus and live-online women's leadership programs. View all Programs for Women.
Leadership skills and developmentThrough a women’s leadership program, you can discover your personal leadership philosophy and develop a framework to help make ethical decisions in ambiguous situations. You’ll maximize your professional potential through fresh perspectives and new ideas to help organizations thrive.
Organizational behaviorLearn about ways to increase creativity and problem-solving abilities in organizations. Develop a better understanding of your emotions and those of others to build more productive relationships and navigate difficult conversations. You’ll also improve your leadership communication skills and explore what it means to be a values-based leader.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Values-driven leadership', 'Module 2': 'Self-knowledge and self-mastery', 'Module 3': 'Leading growth through experimentation', 'Module 4': 'Emotionally intelligent feedback', 'Module 5': 'Networks and structures of innovation', 'Module 6': 'Positive leadership'}

title: Oxford Future of Real Estate Investment Programme
about: The future of real estate is changing. Explore the megatrends and disruptions impacting occupier and capital markets, and increase the resilience of an investment portfolio in the context of shifts to come.
Course overview:
Programme overviewOver 50%The amount of global assets that’s made up of real estate, identified by the PropTech 2020 report from the Oxford Future of Real Estate Initiative.Saïd Business School, University of Oxford (2020).60%The percentage of global construction activity that will occur in emerging markets by 2025.PwC (2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)From climate change to shifting demographics, pandemics and new technologies, the real estate market is experiencing significant change. The way we transact, manage, and invest in property is being redesigned as a result of global megatrends, innovation, and disruption. In the face of change, professionals are now being asked: how will you adapt your portfolio for greater resilience?Gain insight into the future of investment and development on the Oxford Future of Real Estate Programme from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford. This broad, six-week programme explores the impact of global trends and forces on commercial, residential, and sustainable real estate, both now and in the future. You’ll explore a framework of theory, practice, and innovation, gaining a range of perspectives that empower you to appraise development and investment opportunities. With insights from industry leaders, and the Oxford Future of Real Estate Initiative, you’ll discover solutions to modern-day problems and become equipped to build a resilient real estate portfolio.Is this programme for you?This programme has been built for professionals, executives, functional experts, leaders, and decision makers in real estate, finance, investment, engineering, and construction. It’s also ideal for those from complementary or adjacent sectors aiming to disrupt or transition into the real estate market. With a broad industry outlook, the programme will equip traditional real estate businesses and professionals, as well as those aiming to break into the market, with the skills to respond to industry change. Property investors and venture capitalists will learn to better harness opportunities in start-ups and PropTech, and be equipped to build resilient portfolios that withstand the changes that global trends, innovation, and disruption bring. Experienced professionals working in technology, business development, or real estate sales will gain holistic insight into a shifting landscape. There are no prerequisites for this course, but an  understanding of maths and finance will be beneficial to participants.
During the programme, professionals will have the opportunity to network with industry experts and leaders from around the world. Upon completion, you will join the Saïd Business School e-lumni community and gain access to the Oxford Saïd Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn.*
*Access to this group will only be granted following the participant’s successful completion and passing of the programme.
This Oxford Future of Real Estate Investment Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 60 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Sustainable Supply Chain Management Online Short Course
about: Gain the knowledge, skills, and tools to create resilient, efficient, and sustainable supply chains.
Course overview:
Course overview50%The percentage of major global companies that will be using AI, advanced supply chain analytics, and IoT in supply chain operations by 2023.Gartner (Dec, 2018).
$9.87 millionThe expected global supply chain analytics market size by 2025.Grand View Research (Aug, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
Supply chain management is evolving at a rapid pace. From the growth of disruptive technologies to increasing social and environmental challenges, organisations are feeling the pressure to rethink operations, and harness the latest technology to create efficient, resilient, and sustainable supply chains.
The University of Cambridge Sustainable Supply Chain Management online short course focuses on the technological and environmental aspects of supply chain management to future-proof supply chains. You’ll learn how to leverage industry changes and disruptions to optimise logistics and procurement management, and build sustainable business processes. You’ll also gain an in-depth understanding of how supply chain processes impact the broader environment.
Drawing on innovative business models, integrated supply chain analytics, KPI formulations, and the latest technology, this logistics-focused course will expose you to ongoing industry transformation. You’ll be equipped with the tools to implement meaningful change in your role and organisation.
 Is this supply chain management course for you?
This online course is designed for professionals looking for personal development and to support their organisation in future-proofing their supply chain strategies to allow them to continue adding value as global sustainability evolves. It’s beneficial for members of management who want to understand how to incorporate agile and resilient mechanisms into their supply chains to benefit their organisations, whether they are new to logistics and supply chain management or simply interested in updating their skills. This course is also highly relevant for supply chain managers, sustainability specialists, strategic professionals, those in roles of logistics management and inventory management, and consultants. Professionals in similar positions, such as operations managers and those with certifications in freight logistics and supply chain, who are looking to shift career focus to supply chain management, will gain a thorough understanding of their future career path.
The goal of sustainable supply chain management
Sustainable supply chain management includes practices that aim to minimise the environmental impact of the supply chain while also improving social and economic conditions. The goal of supply chain management is to minimise cost while maximising customer satisfaction. Many businesses are interested in sustainable supply chain management to help reduce their environmental footprint and improve their inventory control, reputation, and meet future demand.1
 1Oracle Netsuite (May, 2021).
Importance of a supply chain management strategy
Every business is different, so your supply chain management strategy will be unique to your organisation. To develop an effective, sustainable supply chain management strategy, you'll need to consider your organisation's business model, industry, sector, suppliers, partners, and customers. A supply chain management strategy spells out an organisation's goals, objectives, and plans to achieve them. The strategy defines what the company wants to do and how it plans to do it. It also sets the direction for the entire organisation, from top to bottom. A well-defined supply chain management strategy can help an organisation improve operational efficiency and effectiveness, reduce costs, and increase revenue.2
2 Gartner (Nd). Accessed May 9, 2022.

This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 80 hours of learning.

The Sustainable Supply Chain Management online short course from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL) is accredited by the International Supply Chain Education Alliance (ISCEA). ISCEA is the global leader in supply chain education, certification, and recognition courses. By completing this course, students will receive globally recognised skills in the supply chain occupation, networking opportunities with like-minded individuals, and discounted fees for Certified Sustainable Supply Chain Professional (CSSCP) certification. For more information on the benefits of taking this ISCEA-accredited course, click here.

title: Business and Climate Change: Towards Net Zero Emissions
about: Gain insights into the organisational risks and opportunities posed by climate change, and learn to lead a transition to net zero emissions and rewire your business model for long-term value and resilience.
Course overview:
Course overview64%The percentage of UK CEOs who view climate change as a threat to their business, with a quarter being extremely concerned.PwC (Jan, 2020).$2,1 trillionThe amount that companies switching to low carbon products, services, and business models are expected to generate in additional revenue within the next five years.CDP (Jun, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)As public concern over sustainability challenges and ESG integration intensifies and climate-related organisational risks escalate, the ability to build more resilient business models that thrive in a net zero economy has fast become a strategic imperative.
The Business and Climate Change: Towards Net Zero Emissions online short course from the Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL) provides a comprehensive understanding of how to mitigate the business risks of climate change and oversee a transition to net zero emissions for long-term resilience and overall value.
Over eight weeks online, you’ll explore real-world examples of successful low carbon initiatives and discover how to utilise innovation to build a resilient, profitable business model for the future, stimulating a ‘triple bottom line’ of people, profit, and planet. On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with a practical action plan to transition to net zero emissions and the ability to lead change within your organisation and beyond.
Is this course for you?This course is designed for any professional looking to upskill themselves in climate change risk mitigation and adaptation, as learning outcomes are applicable across industries.
Climate change consultants, sustainability specialists, and environmental managers as well as those looking to contribute to ‘sustainable development goals’ (SDGs) will benefit from an exploration of the latest low carbon practices, and gain new insights relevant to their current context and role. Those in finance and operations will develop the tools to bring about a transition to net zero emissions, and discover how to shift their business models for long-term resilience and profitability. Senior managers and C-suite executives in both the public and private sectors will learn how to lead sustainable change and turn a net zero future into a strategic 21st century business priority.
This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 80 hours of learning.

title: Basics of Financial Management
about: Gain a foundation in business finance and the tools to help your organisation thrive.
Course overview:
Course overviewWhy SMEs fail“While there are a variety of reasons why SMEs ultimately fail, financial management skills and performance are two of the most often-cited explanations.”
* IFAC (Jan, 2020).
Understand money management“Investing the time to understand money management in a company will help you optimise the profits you want to make in business. You aren’t expected to be an accountant or get into the weeds, but business owners need to understand money management.”
* Forbes (Apr, 2022).
Duration: 9 weeks (excluding orientation)

One of a business's best chances at success lies in how it manages its financial resources. Financial management is an integral function of every business, and it ensures responsible investment decisions and the long-term sustainability of operations.

Maintain the financial well-being of your organisation on the eight-week Fundamentals of Financial Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT). No matter your business, role or position, this course will improve your understanding and practice of finance by exploring financial management through the lens of retail, manufacturing, service, and tech-based industries. The course aims to empower you with a financial toolkit to manage both the short- and long-term financial needs of your company, preparing you to make informed, strategic decisions.
Is this course for you?This course is designed to equip mid to senior managers, directors, and administrators with an understanding of business finance and how financial management can be used to support the success of an organisation. These professionals are looking to add value to their business by incorporating financial data into their strategic decision-making. Students will also gain the knowledge to apply financial management tools within operational and strategic business processes. Aspiring managers and entrepreneurs with minimal experience in finance will learn to bolster the efficiency of a business through responsible financial management practices.

title: Oxford Executive Finance Programme
about: Gain the essential corporate finance knowledge needed for strategic decision-making and delivering value at an executive level.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Programme overview96%The percentage of respondents in management and directorship positions who believe that management and leadership roles are important for driving UK economic recovery in 2021.Chartered Management Institute (Feb, 2021).70%The percentage of survey respondents who expect organizations to disclose ESG performance to investors.Workiva (May, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks
The turbulent nature of the current business climate has highlighted the impact that social, technological, and governmental disruption can have on an organisation. Now, more than ever, you need a firm comprehension of finance in order to participate in financial decision-making and discussions, and deliver value to your company.
On the Oxford Executive Finance Programme from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford you’ll gain the practical knowledge and skills to understand the finances of any organisation and how they make decisions. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll also explore corporate finance in terms of capital structure, taxation and bankruptcy, and investigate the trade-offs of funding through an analysis of debt versus equity and how this choice affects an investment project’s valuation.
Through analysing current industry debates and critical expert insights, you’ll discover the key topics that are changing practices in the fast-moving world of finance, such as corporate governance, and environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors. By the end of the programme, you’ll be able to leverage finance as part of your executive toolkit to make more informed, strategic decisions and improve overall business performance.
The content of this programme also forms part of the six-month online Oxford Strategic Management Executive Programme, designed to help you advance as a business executive.
Is this programme for you?This online programme is designed to empower non-financial business leaders, senior executives, managers, and business professionals with the financial proficiency to participate in key discussions and strategic decision-making at an executive level. Those aspiring to move into a strategic decision-making role will develop an understanding of corporate finance and the financial implications of their decisions, learn to better manage resources, and discover how best to use and interpret financial information to drive their business forward.This programme has no prerequisites, and participants are not required to have extensive finance experience or knowledge. On successful completion, you’ll earn a certificate of attendance from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford.This Oxford Executive Finance Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 60 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Valuation: Time value of money, net present value (NPV), and internal rate of return (IRR)', 'Module 2': 'Financial decision-making: Measuring risk, return, and the cost of capital', 'Module 3': 'Corporate finance: Raising capital effectively', 'Module 4': 'Exit strategies: Initial public offerings (IPOs) and mergers and acquisitions (M&As)', 'Module 5': 'Corporate governance', 'Module 6': 'Environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors'}
Convenors: {'Joel Shapiro': ['Professor of Financial Economics, Saïd Business School, University of Oxford', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBa1VJIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--efbb88a4a1fb3f38183efa690d5b5eb14ee52122/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/oxford_sai%CC%88d_oxford_sai%CC%88d_executive_finance_programme_course_convenor_joel%20_shapiro.jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['A contemporary executive finance toolkit, enabling you to make more informed, strategic financial decisions.', 'The ability to confidently engage in financial discussions and communicate your decisions to stakeholders.', 'An overview of the topics that are changing financial practices such as corporate governance, and environmental, social, and governance (ESG) investing.', 'Insights into some of the critical decisions firms make based on research from leading academics, field experts, and business practitioners, as well as a global network of like-minded professionals. ', 'Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']
About the certificate: Study corporate finance and earn an official certificate of attendance from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford. Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the programme handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the programme.

title: Oxford Algorithmic Trading Programme
about: Develop the ability to implement your own trading strategies and demystify algorithmic trading.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Programme overview$2.5 trillion The expected value of assets managed by robo-advisors by 2023.Traders Magazine (Feb, 2020).$22.1 million The predicted size of the global algorithmic trading market by 2025, increasing from $11.8 million in 2019.GlobeNewswire (Jul, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
While algorithmic trading has been around for a long time, the rise of machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) has substantially accelerated its course of development. This allows trading algorithms to find market efficiencies and better recognise profitable patterns of their own accord, making trades at a very high frequency. The performance of these algorithms, therefore, often exceeds those of professional traders and financial advisors.
The Oxford Algorithmic Trading Programme from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, equips you with a comprehensive understanding of the rules that drive successful algorithmic trading strategies and hedge funds, as well as a grounded introduction to financial theory and behavioural finance. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll learn four principles established by Programme Director Nir Vulkan, to guide you through the process of evaluating an algorithmic trading model. You’ll also discover what biases are present in the market and how these behavioural traits create exploitable patterns. On completion, you’ll have the ability to assess whether a trading model or fund is worth investing in.
Is this programme for you?This programme is aimed at working professionals in the trading and investment space or those not currently familiar with the algorithmic trading platform. It will be of value to anyone interested in hearing from industry leaders and top academics on the key issues facing algorithmic systematic traders. The programme will also interest professionals looking to learn about the predicted impact of AI and automation on the course of financial trading’s future. Private and part-time traders who wish to improve their trading abilities and experiment with algorithmic trading models will also benefit from the programme. This non-technical programme features optional activities for participants interested in engaging in the technical side of algorithmic trading by discovering how to build a model using Python. These activities are entirely voluntary and run through an integrated development environment. No extra software is required.The Oxford Algorithmic Trading Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 60 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Introduction to classic and behavioural finance theory', 'Module 2': 'Systematic trading and the state of the investment industry', 'Module 3': 'Technical analysis and the methodology of trading system design', 'Module 4': 'Working with an algorithmic trading model', 'Module 5': 'Evaluation criteria for systematic models and funds', 'Module 6': 'Future trends in algorithmic trading'}

Gain a comprehensive understanding of algorithmic trading strategies and earn an official certificate of attendance from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford.
Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the programme handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the programme.
What past students think: {'Stephen OlayiwolaQuant Analyst and Algo Trader, Virgin Money': 'This six-week programme provided a good taste of what algorithmic trading constitutes. The content and insights gained, particularly from expert presentations, provided real value for money. I enjoyed the materials and the interactive discussion board, and seeing other perspectives on the eclectic range of topics covered. The programme has afforded me the base knowledge needed to develop and expand my algo skill set. I would recommend it to anyone looking to start a career in algo trading, but who have no idea where to begin.'}

title: Gut Health and the Microbiome
about: Discover how the gut microbiome helps shape overall health.
Course overview:
Course overviewThe gut microbiome connects to everythingResearch has linked gut microbiome dysfunction to allergies and digestive and autoimmune diseases. Along with this, poor gut health contributes to mental health issues.Mongabay (Apr, 2022).Nutrition is keyFermented foods could change gut microbiota and reduce inflammatory markers. As a result, diet has the potential to increase gut microbial diversity and regulate immune responses.Science Direct (Aug, 2021).Duration: 2 weeks

Thriving research into the link between the gut and health gives new meaning to the adage ‘you are what you eat’. Beginning at birth, a community of 10-100 trillion microbes populates the human intestinal tract. Just as the body undergoes physiological changes, this invisible ecosystem — the gut microbiome — transforms and is shaped by what you eat and where you live. Now, studies show that microbes aren’t just good for the gut: they can impact the immune system too.1 Understanding the human microbiome in all its complexity has become a scientific and medical priority that could lead to industry-changing interventions and new potential for promoting overall wellness.

Discover the science behind human microbiota in the Gut Health and the Microbiome online micro course from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE), part of Stanford Medicine. Over two short weeks, you’ll learn exactly what the microbiome is, how it’s integrated into human physiology, and the ways it can improve health and treat disease beyond just the gut. Guided by Stanford Medicine experts, you’ll explore how the microbiome is targeted to treat a variety of disease states, and how it continues to guide precision health therapies of the future.

1Cell (Jul, 2021).


Is this course for you?This course is suited to individuals who are interested in the characteristics of a healthy microbiome and the role it plays in nutrition and wellness. It’s applicable to allied health professionals who want to enhance their patients' well-being and quality of life. This includes fitness and wellness specialists, dietitians and nutritionists, exercise physiologists, and personal trainers. The micro course will also benefit non-healthcare professionals and individuals who are interested in understanding how the gut functions, and optimizing their overall health through diet and lifestyle modifications.
What will set you apart: ['A foundational understanding of the microbiome and how it’s integrated into human physiology.', 'Practical strategies to improve health and treat disease beyond the gut.', 'Knowledge of how the microbiome guides precision health therapeutics.', 'Insight into how the microbiome is targeted to treat a variety of disease states.', '', 'Work through your downloadable and online instructional material', 'Interact with your peers and learning facilitators through class-wide forums ', 'Enjoy a wide range of interactive content including tutor lead videos, podcasts, quizzes, and more ', 'Receive a tool kit for practical application in your career', 'Apply what you learn throughout this two-week online micro course and develop practical strategies to improve gut health and impact general wellness.']
About the certificate: Validate your skills online with an official digital badge from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE).

title: FinTech Online Short Course
about: Step beyond current FinTech disruption and prepare for future financial services priorities.
Course overview: Course overview$305.7 billionThe estimated worth of the global FinTech market by 2023.Research and Markets (May, 2019).64%The amount of digitally active global consumers, across 27 markets, who use FinTech.EY (Jun, 2019).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)In recent years, the FinTech landscape has been defined by disruptive technology transforming banking and financial services. Since then, FinTech companies have successfully filled gaps left by existing financial institutions to serve customers’ evolving needs. The industry is now defined by innovation drivers, moving beyond disruption and towards widely adopted technology. This online short course offers an up-to-date look into the maturing FinTech industry. It provides expert guidance and insight into the shifting nature of the financial sector and a holistic understanding of the technologies and innovations set to shape the future of finance and business. Utilizing innovative pedagogical approaches pioneered by the Harvard Business School (HBS), this course adapts the Case Method Approach used in on-campus programs at HBS for online study, presenting real-life challenges that reflect the complex, dynamic nature of the FinTech landscape. Equip yourself with the knowledge to tackle transformative initiatives within the financial technology sector, and earn a premier certificate from Harvard’s Office of the Vice Provost for Advances in Learning (VPAL), in association with HarvardX.Is this course for you?This online course is designed for business decision makers, financial professionals, and senior management professionals to better contextualize, interpret, and respond to the transformed financial services industry. It will benefit anyone within the financial technology and innovation space, particularly those wanting to adopt the creative methods and strategic approaches used within FinTech.

title: User Experience Design
about: Optimise website navigation and create an engaging user experience for customers.
Course overview: Course overview52%The percentage of consumers who’d stop what they’re doing if they had trouble interacting with content on a device.Adobe (2019).60%The percentage of abandoned purchase users who switched to a rival retailer’s website because it was easier to checkout, even if the product was more expensive.Rogerwilco (2020).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)Ease of use is now a vital feature of an effective digital environment. For a website or app to holistically serve its purpose, it needs to offer customers a seamless, intuitive user experience (UX). The University of Cape Town (UCT) User Experience Design online short course enables you to understand how users interact with online content so that you can design environments that meet their evolving needs. You’ll discover key UX research and design techniques, and learn how to work with stakeholders, run user tests, design wireframes, and develop prototypes. You’ll also analyse current trends in the field, and map out a professional journey for yourself so that you can better leverage your new skills to launch a career in UX.Is this course for you?This course is suitable for anyone who wants to boost their understanding of online user behaviour and walk away with tools to improve the usability of a website or app. The content is ideal for professionals who need to develop highly transferable, practical UX design skills in order to improve performance in their current position or who wish to prepare for future career growth. Those already in a design, digital marketing, product ownership, or web development role will further expand their knowledge and validate their existing expertise. No prior technical knowledge of coding is required for this course.

title: Strategic Communications
about: Shape your business communications with data-informed insights.
University name: Columbian College of Arts and Sciences
Course overview:
Course overview92%The amount of communication leaders who believe their staff don’t have the right set of skills to meet organizational demands.Gartner (2020).Top prioritiesAmong the 2019 top priorities for communication leaders was content strategy, message management and overcoming digital communication challenges.Gartner (Jan, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Digital disruption has had a two-fold effect on the way organizations communicate. While it has made communication more complex, it has also highlighted the value of effective communicators.1
The Strategic Communications online short course will equip you with the skills needed to drive consumer behavior through influential messaging. You’ll explore how data can be used to inform your media strategies and address the needs of multiple stakeholders, as well as prepare for any potential risks associated with omnichannel messaging. Learn how to pick the appropriate medium for your message and audience, and approach engagement from a problem-solving angle to ensure your brand stands out in a crowded digital landscape.
1 The Holmes Report (May, 2019).Is this course for you?This course is designed for media and communications professionals who recognize that strategic communication is the key differentiator in creating a competitive advantage. It’s aimed at those looking to set themselves apart in their organization by taking the lead in corporate communications, reputation management or public relations, as well as those who want to stay abreast of the communication skills required in the modern workplace. Managers and professionals in marketing and advertising will benefit from learning to identify the channels for leveraging data-formed insights to successfully improve their brand messaging and better interact with relevant stakeholders. The practical skills taught in this course will ensure that you can effectively align your communication strategies with business objectives.

title: Sustainable Real Estate: Creating a Better Built Environment
about: Discover how you can respond to challenges facing sustainability in the built environment to leverage industry opportunities.
Course overview:
Course overview36%The percentage of CO2 emissions that the real estate sector must reduce by 2030, in order to stay within the 2°C threshold.RICS (Mar, 2019).
73%The percentage of greenhouse gas emissions that can be reduced in the non-residential sector, if buildings are renovated to lower their energy usage by 40% before 2030.Ellen MacArthur Foundation (2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Buildings produce a third of all greenhouse gas emissions and are one of the main consumers of energy in the world.1 The real estate sector plays an undeniable role in the climate emergency and needs to be reimagined if we want a sustainable future.
On the Sustainable Real Estate: Creating a Better Built Environment online short course, you’ll learn how to find opportunities within sustainability challenges in the built environment. Designed by expert faculty from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL), the course addresses and analyses the ecological, social, and governance aspects of real estate. With this overview of industry trends and risks, you’ll examine how sustainable real estate can contribute to a more resilient and inclusive society, and positively impact communities. Towards the end of this eight-week course, you’ll develop a personal action plan to deliver a sustainable outcome in your own built environment context. This strategy will help you realise the role you and your organisation can play in improving your own supply chains, as well as the vast real estate network.
1 World Economic Forum (Jan, 2020).
Is this course for you?This course is for professionals who want to understand the sustainability challenges facing the real estate sector, and want the knowledge and insights to implement resilient measures to address these challenges. Real estate developers, entrepreneurs, city planners, architects, engineers, and other built environment professionals will learn about the latest planning and design considerations, as well as opportunities for sustainable development. Public sector professionals will have the opportunity to study the impact of sustainability on society, systems, and the broader built environment, and explore solutions to potential challenges. Investment professionals will also gain value from the course, as they realise the impact of climate change on real estate investments, and the value behind delivering a sustainable built environment.
