title: General Management Program
about: Gain a comprehensive leadership, strategy and financial management toolkit to develop a competitive edge in today’s complex business landscape.
Course overview:
Program overviewTop 10Self-management is set to become part of the top 10 most sought-after job competencies by the year 2025.World Economic Forum (Oct, 2020).15%The percentage of senior executives who are confident in their leadership team’s ability to manage resilience and change.Forbes (Mar, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Gain a holistic understanding of today’s complex business environment and develop a comprehensive toolkit to identify, frame and solve business challenges in the General Management Program from SDA Bocconi School of Management. Over eight weeks online, you’ll unlock your personal and organizational impact with the help of cutting-edge research, dedicated live sessions with faculty and interactive learning tools. Learn to conduct a comprehensive strategic analysis of your organization and explore the fundamentals of financial and management accounting to help you make informed business decisions to enhance your organization’s competitive advantage. Guided by industry experts, you’ll discover how to evolve as a leader while effectively leveraging your team’s potential.Is this program for you?This program aims to improve professionals’ organizational impact by developing their strategic, leadership and financial skills. The content is geared towards aspiring and new managers interested in growing their corporate influence and career opportunities. Additionally, mid-level managers and functional experts can utilize the professional toolkit gained in this program to become leaders skilled at creating an inclusive work environment that leverages their team’s full potential. Managers at all levels will benefit from the holistic view of business, the strong focus on strategy, and the financial and management accounting foundations explored in this program.
Participants who successfully earn a certificate of completion for the  SDA Bocconi General Management Program may apply to enroll for the Global Executive Master in Business Administration. The General Management Program certificate will count towards a segment of the Executive Master. Upon successful admission to the Executive Master, participants will be entitled to receive a discount of €5,000.
Note: Application to the Global Executive Master in Business Administration is required and the Executive Master assessments remain mandatory.


SDA Bocconi is one of the few elite business schools to have garnered the ‘triple crown’ of the world’s most prestigious international accreditations (AMBA, AACSB, and EQUIS). It is also the only Italian institution to feature in all the major global business school rankings, including those of the Financial Times, Forbes, Bloomberg Businessweek and The Economist.*
*SDA Bocconi (2021)

title: Executive Support
about: Learn to provide high-level administrative support to members of the C-suite, and assist with the execution of your business’s strategy.
Course overview:
Course overview30%The amount a leader’s productivity increases when they collaborate with a high-level executive assistant.Medium (Feb, 2018).7%The projected employment growth of administrative services managers by 2028.U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (Apr, 2020).Executive assistants are the glue that hold an organisation together. They play a vital role in supporting the productivity and effectiveness of senior staff and, by extension, of a company’s entire team. As a result, they can have a significant impact on the overall functioning of a business.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Executive Support online short course is designed to prepare you to take on all the strategic and administrative duties of a professional in this role. You’ll discover key leadership, people management, business communication, and problem-solving techniques. You’ll also learn how to plan meetings, prepare reports, and manage staff training.
Acquire sought-after transferable skills, applicable to any industry, and invest in your executive administration career with this course from Africa’s leading university.1
1 QS Top Universities (Jun, 2020).
Is this course for you?This course is suitable for administrative assistants, personal assistants, and office managers, as well as those in unrelated fields, who aspire to develop the competencies needed to become a high-level executive assistant. It’s also ideal for established executive support personnel who want to update their skills, gain formal recognition of their expertise, and boost the value they can add to a company.

title: Oxford Digital Marketing: Disruptive Strategy Programme
about: Redefine your marketing strategy in an age of disruption.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Programme overview10.8%The percentage of marketers already using augmented reality as a key tactic in their social media marketing strategies.HubSpot (2020).£7.90 billionThe amount expected to be spent on UK programmatic digital display advertising in 2021.eMarketer (Jan, 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

Technologies such as artificial intelligence are reshaping the way businesses think about their marketing strategies, as well as how they choose to harness different channels.

The Oxford Digital Marketing: Disruptive Strategy Programme aims to provide you with the skills and confidence to respond to the forces driving disruption in the digital marketing landscape. You’ll investigate how consumer behaviour and media consumption have evolved, and develop strategies for adapting your marketing approach to account for this. Led by faculty from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, you’ll also learn how to capitalise on the power of social media, and effectively use emerging technology and digital marketing channels in your strategy.

Develop a future-focused perspective on marketing as you learn to leverage data and analytics in your decision-making and create value in the face of disruption.
Is this programme for you?This Oxford Saïd programme is best suited to marketing managers working in leadership positions at digital agencies and other companies across industries. It’s also ideal for experienced professionals with a sound understanding of marketing principles who want to build on foundational training in digital and social media platforms with a programme centred on future-focused strategy development in an age of disruption. The content is specifically designed for those who want to harness digital innovation in marketing and understand the opportunities that emerging trends and technologies will bring to organisations or clients.This Oxford Digital Marketing: Disruptive Strategy Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 80 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Oxford Strategic Innovation Programme
about: Explore and develop future-focused innovation strategies.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Programme overview29%The percentage of companies that have increased their innovation budget since the onset of COVID-19.Edelman Intelligence (2020).59%The share of businesses that report that company culture or entrenched attitudes are the biggest challenge when it comes to scaling innovation.KPMG (2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)For years, innovation has been seen as a tool for finding new solutions to current challenges, in particular those that have been brought on by technological disruption. However, it’s unlikely that the challenges of tomorrow will be anything like those we face today. In such a fast-paced and uncertain world, businesses need to develop the strategic capacity to respond to unforeseen challenges.The Oxford Strategic Innovation Programme approaches innovation as a tool for handling challenges that can’t yet be predicted. Designed by Oxford Saïd’s leading expert on innovation, Marc Ventresca, you’ll redefine what innovation means, why it’s essential, and how it can be mobilised within your organisation.Through a critical thinking and analytical approach, you’ll explore different ways of navigating innovation and how to implement it within your organisational design, structure, and culture. Learn to build systems that can adapt to unpredictable situations, making it a sustainable and routine practice within your organisation.Is this programme for you?This programme is suitable for senior business professionals, leaders, entrepreneurs, or consultants from all industries who want to enable innovation within their organisations. This programme will equip you with the skills to influence strategy and decision-making, and employ innovation practices within your business structure. Build an environment that is optimised for developing new ideas through fostering a culture of innovation in your organisation.

Guided by global thought leaders and Oxford Saïd faculty, you’ll gain cutting-edge insights and discover new approaches to solving business challenges. As this is an industry-agnostic programme, you’ll be equipped with the tools to create increased value regardless of your business area or market sector.





This Oxford Strategic Innovation Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 60 hours of learning.

title: Construction Management Online Short Course
about: Hone your ability to plan, coordinate, and supervise construction projects in the South African context.
Course overview:
Course overview$124.5 billionThe total value of infrastructure and capital projects that were underway in the Southern Africa region in 2020.Deloitte (2020).R104 billionThe value added by the construction industry to South Africa’s gross domestic product (GDP) in 2019.Construction Industry Development Board (Apr, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
With widespread transformation and infrastructure development on the agenda, the construction sector in sub-Saharan Africa is rich with potential. Success in this field requires sound planning, management, and coordination skills.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Construction Management online short course is designed to equip you with the practical skills you need to navigate the day-to-day management of both large- and small-scale construction projects. During this eight-week course, you’ll learn how to handle client relationships, address stakeholder needs, analyse health and safety risks, evaluate environmental considerations, and manage time and cost constraints. You’ll also gain a holistic understanding of the South African construction industry and the economic factors influencing it.Enjoy expert instruction from the leading university in Africa,1 and walk away knowing that you’ve completed South Africa’s only online, university-accredited construction management short course.

1 QS Top Universities (Apr, 2021)Is this course for you?This online short course is suited to those looking for a pragmatic overview of construction management principles and best practices. The content is designed for both established construction industry professionals eager to formalise their knowledge, and those who are new to the field. Site managers, contractors, safety officers, quantity surveyors, and junior architects may also find it beneficial. The course prioritises problem-based learning and makes use of real-world case studies and practical exercises to prepare students for the South African building industry.


This construction management course has been accredited by the Association of South African Quantity Surveyors (ASAQS). Completing the course will entitle you to claim 25 Category 1 CPD hours.*
In addition to this, all existing ASAQS members are entitled to a 10% discount for this course.**
*Should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The University of Cape Town and GetSmarter accept no responsibility. If you would like to claim validation or points, use the accreditation reference ASAQS CPD 2021/01(P).
**Students must furnish proof of their ASAQS membership.

International students need to consult their national professional engineering bodies to check whether this course is recognised for points towards maintaining professional status.

GetSmarter is approved by the Project Management Institute (PMI®) as an Authorized Training Partner (ATP), a partnership that enables you to join the world’s largest project management network. This Construction Management online short course will count for 63.00 PDUs in total, and the division of hours is as follows: Technical - 31.75, Leadership - 0.00, Strategic - 31.25.
PMI is responsible for setting project management standards and providing certification. By taking this course, you’ll gain PMI-endorsed skills that are globally recognised. You can also use these learning hours towards furthering your professional project management development. See PMI.org for more information.
Please note that GetSmarter and UCT bear no responsibility for the reporting of these PDUs and/or hours to the PMI. The onus, therefore, falls on you to do so.
The PMI® Authorized Training Partner seal is a mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.

title: Sales Management Program
about: Lead your sales team and enhance business development for your organization.
Course overview:
Program overview80%The proportion of sales leaders who believe that their team’s skill set will need to change.Salesforce (Mar, 2021).85%The percentage of professionals who believe that sales operations are increasingly more strategic.Salesforce (Nov, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)The role of sales within an organization has grown increasingly strategic and customer-centric. As more customers choose to conduct their research and purchasing journey online and via social media, sales professionals must rethink their approach to strategic engagement. The sales force requires updated skills and tools to better support and guide the informed buyer from their initial interest to the post-purchase experience. To do this effectively, sales teams require analytical and strategy-focused leaders to guide their operations and drive performance.The Sales Management Program from SDA Bocconi School of Management aims to equip you with the ability to lead your team through a shifting landscape. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll learn how to action change management, digital transformation and performance management within your organization. You’ll develop the skills to run a customer portfolio analysis and evaluate the various strategies and approaches to building customer relationships. You’ll gain frameworks to assess team performance, provide feedback and design a compensation plan. Grow your knowledge and confidence as you explore conceptual models, real-world examples and decision-support tools while reflecting on your progress through journaling and in the online forums.Is this program for you?This program is for anyone looking to strategically manage sales in order to outsmart competitors, maintain or grow market share and reach ever-increasing targets. This includes sales managers who are used to working individually but want to gain the skills to lead a team as well as technical professionals who have moved into sales but lack managerial experience. The program would be particularly beneficial to sales managers in charge of a large team. They’ll learn how to improve their performance in their current position by taking a more strategic view of their function and role within the broader business. It is also useful to newly promoted sales managers, aspiring sales professionals and those ready to move to the next stage of their careers.
Participants who successfully earn the SDA Bocconi  Sales Management Program certificate may apply to enroll for the Executive Master in Marketing and Sales. The Sales Management Program certificate will count towards a segment of the Executive Master. Upon successful admission to the Executive Master, participants will be entitled to receive a discount of €3,000.
Note: Application to the Executive Master in Marketing and Sales is required, and the Executive Master assessments remain mandatory.


SDA Bocconi is one of the few elite business schools to have garnered the ‘triple crown’ of the world’s most prestigious international accreditations (AMBA, AACSB, and EQUIS). It is also the only Italian institution to feature in all the major global business school rankings, including those of the Financial Times, Forbes, Bloomberg Businessweek and The Economist.*
*SDA Bocconi (2021)

', 'The expertise to set targets, evaluate performance, provide impactful feedback, as well as a tool kit for managing rewards and compensation more transparently and efficiently. ', 'The skills to lead the digital transformation of sales organizations. ', 'The experience and insights from networking with like-minded international professionals from a wide range of industries, and unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']

In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the program handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the program.

I found it very interesting to learn from others in the same field."}

title: Sales Management
about: Learn how to lead, manage, motivate, assess, and compensate a sales team.
Course overview: Course overviewTop 10A role in sales is one of the top 10 key emerging positions in South Africa.World Economic Forum (2018).75%The proportion of companies that list ‘closing more deals’ as their top sales priority.HubSpot (2018).Duration: 9 weeks (excluding orientation)Despite the emergence of numerous different business models, many enterprises still rely heavily on sales for profit. As a result, sales management is a vital business function that can have a significant impact on a company’s bottom line.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Sales Management online short course aims to prepare you for success in this important field. It’s designed to teach you skills that are both relevant and practical, so you can not only improve your understanding of personal selling best practices, but also enhance your ability to build, train, motivate, and assess a sales team. You’ll learn how to perform cost analyses, select appropriate customer relationship management (CRM) systems, identify pricing strategies, and measure the business impact of your operations. Class-wide online discussions will give you the opportunity to learn from fellow students and discuss topical issues, like closing techniques and recruitment challenges. Alongside course content, these sessions are designed to help you gain confidence in your ability to lead the sales function within any organisation.Is this course for you?This course is suitable for both sales professionals pursuing a promotion into a management role, and existing sales managers looking to validate their skills and enhance their performance. Those who want to improve their knowledge of sales within a business development context will, most likely, also benefit from this content. To get value out of this course, it is recommended that you already have some experience in the sales field.

title: Import, Export and Logistics Management
about: Learn to engage in international trade and identify foreign opportunities for a business.
Course overview: Course overviewR122,02 billionThe worth of South Africa’s exported goods in August 2019.Trading Economics (2019).Top 3China, Germany, and the United States were South Africa’s top three trading partners for 2018 in terms of export sales.World’s Top Exports (Feb, 2020).Duration: 11 weeks (excluding orientation)A company’s decision to expand operations beyond national borders can unlock many new business opportunities. However, international trade comes with its challenges, and professionals in this field must have an in-depth understanding of the forces at play. The University of Cape Town (UCT) Import, Export and Logistics Management online short course aims to give you this understanding so that you can manage the strategic and technical aspects of international trade. Using a case study of a fictional small business, this course will enable you to engage with overseas markets in a manner that’s legally compliant, financially efficient, and culturally sensitive. You’ll learn the principles of logistics management and walk away with knowledge to improve your business’s potential of trading success.Is this course for you?This course is designed for professionals wanting to develop their skills in import, export, and logistics management, as well as those looking to formalise their existing knowledge and experience in this field to improve current role performance. Operations managers, logistics managers, business owners, and imports coordinators will benefit from the course, including those aiming to start their own import and export company.

title: Business Analytics
about: Learn how to apply data analysis techniques to make sense of number sets and drive better business decisions.
Course overview: Course overviewTop 10Business analysis and analytical reasoning are among the top 10 hard skills modern companies need most.LinkedIn (Jan, 2020).>50%By 2022, more than half of major new business systems will incorporate continuous intelligence that uses real-time data to improve decisions.Gartner (Feb, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)The transformative power of data and analytics has never been more important than it is today. Companies increasingly need to deliver insights on customer experience and business trends in order to remain competitive in the market.The Business Analytics online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) aims to equip you with advanced data analysis techniques to support business decision-making and critical thinking in times of ambiguity and uncertainty.This course focuses on practical business application by showing you how to harness data visualisation and storytelling to interpret number sets, identify patterns, and uncover business trends critical to driving growth in your organisation.By practically engaging with various analytical tools (such as SQL and Tableau, as well as Python on an introductory level), this course will empower you to tap into the power of business intelligence to transform your data and deliver actionable insights.Is this course for you?As this is an advanced course, it’s ideal for practicing analysts who want to update their knowledge, grow their careers, and improve their ability to impact business decisions with data insights. It’s also designed for those who aspire to become data scientists, and for managers and senior decision makers who want to learn how to leverage data to make informed choices and add more value to their organisation. While there are no prerequisites for this course, it’s recommended that students have a basic understanding of statistics and analytics before registering. Notably, students will engage with and run code via an IDE notebook, but won’t have to write code themselves.The University of Cape Town (UCT) and GetSmarter are committed to gender empowerment and working towards an equal future. In celebration of National Women's Day, get 20% off when you register and pay for this course during the month of August* using the code WOMENOFUCT. *Exclusive offer valid until 31 August 2022

title: Public Relations (PR)
about: Become an effective communications professional in the digital age.
Course overview:
Course overview$93.07 billionThe estimated global value of the public relations market by 2022.MarketWatch (Aug, 2019).91%The percentage of African businesses who believe PR consultants must increasingly prove their direct contribution to meeting business goals.AMEC (2019).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)The evolution of social and online media channels has caused a visible shift in the way we consume traditional media. As the communications landscape continues to change, businesses and brands must turn to public relations (PR) professionals to help control their public image in order to positively impact their bottom line. Want to be recognised as a tactical and pre-emptive PR manager? The Public Relations online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) offers the perfect opportunity to enhance or launch your career in PR, by exploring the latest techniques and tactics for effective PR practice in a digital age. Over ten weeks, you’ll learn to create your own PR plan, and gain the confidence to build strong public relationships and communication strategies.Is this course for you?If you’re a new or aspiring PR practitioner looking to update your current skill set and enhance your career, this course will provide you with insights to help you grow in your field. Additionally, the course offers those wanting to break into the PR industry with foundational knowledge, practical skills, and validation from Africa’s leading university in the form of a certificate of completion.1

title: Payroll and Tax Administration
about: Explore corporate taxation and learn how to effectively manage employee compensation.
Course overview:
Course overview39%The percentages of organisations that have shifted to cloud-based payroll solutions.Deloitte (2018).
Top benefitAn effective payroll department helps boost employee morale.South African Payroll Association (Sep, 2019).
Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Poor management of payroll and tax matters can cost a business significantly in both time and money, and is likely to frustrate and demotivate employees. Effective payroll administrators that are familiar with current legislation and best practices are, therefore, a valuable asset to any organisation. The University of Cape Town (UCT) Payroll and Tax Administration online short course is designed to empower you with the skills to effectively perform these vital bookkeeping-related functions. You’ll be introduced to key concepts underpinning individual and business taxation, and gain an understanding of how eFiling and VAT returns work. You’ll also learn about different payroll systems and packages, and acquire the tools to manage employees’ remuneration effectively and efficiently to ensure a happy workforce.Is this course for you?As this course covers current legislation and practices, established payroll administrators, finance clerks, bookkeepers, and business owners will be able to update current skills and refresh their tax legislation knowledge. Those looking to develop their careers and move into the administrative, finance, or human resources function of a business will also likely benefit from this curriculum. No prior knowledge of bookkeeping, accounting, or finance is needed for this course.

title: Cost and Management Accounting
about: Learn how to apply costing techniques and generate financial insights to inform key business decisions.
Course overview: Course overview5 principlesEliminating unnecessary costs is one of five core pillars in cost accounting.Chron (2018).25%The proportion of accounting and finance leaders surveyed who are concerned about underestimating business spend in annual budgets.GetApp (2019). Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)In a highly competitive corporate environment, more managers and business owners are seeking to streamline processes and optimise the use of resources. Those working in cost and management accounting roles are responsible for providing information that can guide economical decision-making, and play an important part in maximising profit by controlling financial wastage.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Cost and Management Accounting online short course introduces you to the core principles of this function and covers a range of central concepts, such as job costing, process costing, absorption costing, and variable costing. You’ll discover how to use costings to make informed management decisions, and learn to perform a cost-volume-profit (CVP) analysis and manage funds through budgets.Is this course for you?This course is designed for finance and accounting professionals looking to refresh their knowledge and gain specific skills in the field of cost and management accounting. It’s also aimed at managers who want to improve their ability to make sound decisions based on financial insights, and business owners and entrepreneurs who need knowledge of costing techniques and systems.

title: Sustainable Marketing, Media and Creative
about: Confidently transition your marketing, media and creative practices to align brand and purpose in service of a sustainable future.
Course overview: Course overview80%The majority of global marketers predict that sustainability will be at the top of their agendas in five years’ time.World Federation of Advertisers (Apr, 2021).77%The percentage of global consumers who, within five years, only want to be spending with brands that are practising green and sustainable advertising.Dentsu (2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Marketing, media and creative have long been key enablers of the profit-driven business-as-usual economy, influencing and impacting the sustainability crisis we face today. Professionals from these sectors have a unique opportunity to take meaningful action and change their purpose to drive sustainable solutions. From the heart of the system, and as the engines of value creation in our society, these industries can play a central role in delivering positive leadership and transformation in sustainable production, consumption and behaviour.  The Sustainable Marketing, Media and Creative online short course from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL) equips you with skills and strategies to re-align the purpose of marketing, media and creative to support long-term wellbeing for all people and planet. Over eight weeks, you’ll learn how to inspire and reignite the potential for brands and creative roles to enable positive change. You’ll also gain a heightened awareness of both marketing’s physical impact on people and the environment and its capacity to influence human behaviours and identities, and engage in challenging discussions on issues such as growth, greenwashing and consumption.  You’re invited to join a global cohort of industry pioneers, committed to reclaiming marketing’s role in the world. Through a combination of live sessions, peer support circles and discussion, you’ll build vital connections that can help facilitate innovation and inspire collaborative action. With guidance from faculty and industry experts, you’ll also unlock practical strategies to drive transition and transformation in your sphere of influence, and develop the tools and confidence to maximise impact in your own career. At the end of the course, you’ll move from ambition to implementation with a practical Strategy for Action, setting you up to challenge the status quo and assume your place at the forefront of this change.This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 75 hours of learning. Note: Should students wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on them. The University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.Is this course for you?This course is designed for marketing, media and creative professionals who wish to be at the forefront of sustainability transformation. Marketers, brand, product or account managers and salespeople, across all levels of leadership, will develop a future-ready skill set to navigate and expand their influence in this rapidly growing area. PR consultants, communications specialists and creatives, such as designers, directors, artists and photographers, will uncover strategies to make sustainability part of their practice and improve the authenticity of their outputs. Executives, entrepreneurs and business owners will gain a greater awareness of how to guide their organisation towards social, ecological and climate targets and consciousness, while supporting the transformation of the sector from within. The course will benefit professionals across all industries who want to enhance their careers and drive positive change.

About the certificate: Learn how to embed and inspire sustainability in your organisation, practice and society and earn an official certificate of completion from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership. Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Foundations of Business Management
about: Develop an integrated business management strategy to ensure your business’s success.
Course overview: Course overview48%The increase in profitability that a highly talented manager can achieve within an organisation.Gallup (Jun, 2019). 22%The rise in business productivity that a great manager can achieve within a company.Gallup (Jun, 2019). Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)The tradition of managers working within business silos is disappearing. Now, they need to have an integrated and holistic understanding of how an organisation works, on both a theoretical and practical level, in order to improve performance. By gaining knowledge across the management spectrum, managers can ensure that every decision made is backed by comprehensive business insight.Develop a holistic understanding of business functions in the Foundations of Business Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT). By studying a variety of leadership and management skills, you’ll learn to create integrated business management strategies to ensure your organisation's success. Gain the skills to achieve your objectives in the areas of leadership, marketing, finance, market research, and competitive analysis.Is this course for you?This course has been designed to meet the industry need for skilled managers who require integrated knowledge of multiple business functions. Mid to senior managers looking to increase their organisational impact will receive a holistic foundation to business and management’s most important concepts and practices. Aspiring managers and entrepreneurs will also benefit from this introduction to business management, and become prepared to advance within their career by gaining broadly applicable business skills.

title: Positive Psychology and Well-Being: The Psychological, Biological, and Social Aspects of Happiness
about: Harness the science of happiness to live a more meaningful and abundant life.
Course overview: Course overview26.1%More than a quarter of the global population reports feeling sad during a lot of the previous day.World Happiness Report (2021).79%The share of employees who say their happiness at work directly impacts their customer experience delivery.C&I (May, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Scientists, psychologists, philosophers, and artists have long contemplated the essence of what it means to be happy. As the stressors of the modern world intensify, people the world over are seeking new techniques for attaining wellness. In the Positive Psychology and Well-Being online short course from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE), part of Stanford Medicine, you’ll learn how to become the best version of yourself by investigating the psychological, biological, and social principles of happiness.Discover a holistic approach to well-being that incorporates the latest research from the fields of positive psychology, well-being theory, and the neuroscience of emotion. Over six weeks, you’ll uncover practical strategies for enhancing your own happiness every day. You’ll also explore how the ‘state of flow’, mindfulness and meditation, and spirituality can positively impact well-being, and examine frameworks for understanding the role that relationships and group dynamics have to play in your life. Guided by leading faculty and a diverse range of subject experts, you’ll also learn what it takes to build resilience in the face of adversity and develop your ability to author your own well-being journey by formulating a tailored approach for the future. Walk away with a practical skill set for making meaningful life changes that maximize your personal and professional happiness, and an official certificate of completion from SCHE. Is this course for you?This course will prove valuable to anyone interested in achieving happiness in a personal or professional context. Those tasked with promoting self-improvement, such as healthcare and lifestyle professionals, nutritionists, wellness coaches and teachers, psychologists, trainers, and nurses will discover practical techniques for fostering lasting well-being. Individuals in more corporate settings, such as team leaders, wellness managers, HR professionals, and those responsible for mentoring or training employees will also gain relevant strategies for enhancing happiness in their life and career. Due to its uniquely multidisciplinary approach, the course will appeal to a broad range of learners, from those interested in the neuroscience behind well-being, to those seeking to implement psychology-based concepts, to those simply wishing to lead a more productive and happy life.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Rethinking happiness', 'Module 2': 'The neuroscience of positive emotion', 'Module 3': 'Engagement and flow', 'Module 4': 'Meaning', 'Module 5': 'The relational nature of well-being', 'Module 6': 'Accomplishment and authorship in well-being'}
Convenors: {'Dr. Daryn Reicherter': ['Clinical Professor, Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences, Stanford University', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBa2tWIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--03391c9a246763388c7f6acf43cd438ae33b5a16/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/stanford_center_for_health_education_university_positive_psychology_and_well_being_course_convenor_dr_daryn_reicherter_tp%20(1).jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['An understanding of positive psychology, the key concepts of well-being theory, and the psychiatry, philosophy, and neuroscience of emotion.', 'Practical methods to maximize happiness in your daily life, including mindfulness and meditation, social engagement strategies, and building a ‘state of flow’.', 'A personalized approach to reclaim agency over your well-being, overcome adversity, and leverage your strengths to improve relational experiences.', '', '']
About the certificate: Gain an evidence-based understanding of happiness and well-being, and earn an official certificate of completion from Stanford Center for Health Education.Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Oxford Leading Sustainable Corporations Programme
about: Lead sustainable business practices and contemporary forms of value creation
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Programme overview99%The amount of surveyed CEOs who believe sustainability will be important to the future success of their business.UN Global Compact (Jan, 2019).61%The amount of institutional investors who have increased their investment in companies that excel in environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors.KPMG (2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Corporations are under increasing scrutiny for their contributions to society and the environment. Against this backdrop, a sustainable business strategy that considers its environmental impact is vital. There is increased demand for corporate sustainability leaders with the ability to shift the traditional methods of value creation towards the concept of the triple bottom line.The Oxford Leading Sustainable Corporations Programme takes an executive-level perspective on business sustainability, looking beyond traditional views of measuring and reporting on performance, to integrate environmental, social, and corporate governance (ESG) factors into your business practice. With a focus on corporate sustainability leadership, this programme aims to equip business leaders with the essential skills to address this critical business need.Examine your corporation’s impact on the environment from multiple perspectives, including a view of climate change that accounts for risk, carbon emissions and natural resource management. With expert guidance, you'll develop the ability to drive effective carbon management strategies, while formulating key performance indicators (KPIs) for measuring your corporation’s sustainability efforts, and dependency on natural, social, and human capital.Over the course of six weeks, you’ll gain access to expert insights and leading research from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford. Create a personal plan for developing, implementing, and leading strategies for achieving sustainable development goals (SDGs) in your organisation, as you strive to affect positive change and reduce your organisation’s impact on the environment.Is this programme for you?The Oxford Leading Sustainable Corporations Programme is relevant to a broad range of roles across industries. This programme is designed for professionals interested in actively leading and accounting for low carbon, circular and climate positive business transitions.
Whether you’re a current or aspiring business leader, or a senior professional with an interest in pursuing business sustainability management, you’ll benefit from learning to communicate and implement sustainable business practices and strategies that enable you to drive positive change. If you occupy a finance or operations function, or work in the banking, investment, IT, or manufacturing sectors, an understanding of new metrics of performance and integrated ESG accounting methods will help you facilitate the measurement of your corporation’s environmental impact.
Sustainability leadershipThe social responsibility of business has been a topic of debate for many years, and this programme explores the role businesses play in society, the environment, and economy. You’ll learn about sustainability leadership and develop skills for effective decision-making that takes into account social and environmental considerations.
Sustainability practicesYou’ll learn about the different types of sustainability practices that businesses can adopt, including environmental resource management, social responsibility, and sustainable governance structures. You’ll also explore how to implement these practices in a way that is aligned with your business strategy and objectives.

This Oxford Leading Sustainable Corporations Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 60 hours of learning.
Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the programme handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the programme.

title: Public Sector Financial Reporting
about: Gain an in-depth understanding of the specialised frameworks underpinning public sector financial reporting.
Course overview:
Course overviewR800 billionThe minimum amount needed to mitigate the effects of COVID-19 on the South African economy as projected by its finance minister.PwC (2020).R3 billionThe additional amount allocated by the South African government to recapitalise the state-owned Land Bank in 2020.National Treasury (2020).Duration: 12 weeks (excluding orientation)Rising concerns around global government spending has led to public demand for accurate and transparent financial reports, setting higher standards for treasury management. To meet these requirements, it’s imperative that professionals in this field use the Generally Recognised Accounting Practice (GRAP) frameworks that underpin financial reporting in the public sector. In doing so, they can create a credible record that communicates high-quality expenditure information, which informs policy and decision-making, and in turn drives the better use of public resources.
The Public Sector Financial Reporting online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) is based on the Postgraduate Diploma in Public Sector Accounting offered by UCT. Part of this programme has been developed into smaller online short courses that allow professionals to study specific areas of public sector structures, governance, accounting and finance, in order to bolster their skills in this important and relevant field.
This online short course covers specialised and highly technical concepts to help you accurately recognise, measure, and report on current and non-current assets within the public finance sector. Over 12 weeks, you’ll gain expert tools and insights from faculty at Africa’s leading university,1 as you learn to draft in-depth financial statements for public sector entities.
1 QS Top Universities (Jun, 2020).
Is this course for you?This highly intensive course is aimed at private or public sector professionals looking to enable career growth in the public finance sector. It’s valuable to those who are starting their career and would like to prepare for a future role in public sector finance within South Africa, as well as other countries in Africa. Established balance sheet custodians, accounting consultants, and financial managers who are interested in formalising and augmenting their knowledge within the specialised field of public sector accounting will also benefit from the tangible outcomes and analytical toolkit delivered throughout this 12-week course.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Reporting environment for public sector entities', 'Module 2': 'Conceptual framework for public sector financial reporting', 'Module 3': 'Preparing financial statements for public sector entities', 'Module 4': 'Accounting for revenue: Exchange transactions', 'Module 5': 'Accounting for revenue: Non-Exchange transactions', 'Module 6': 'Accounting for non-current assets: Property, Plant, Equipment (PPE), and investment property', 'Module 7': 'Accounting for non-current assets: Intangible, heritage, and living and non-living assets', 'Module 8': 'Accounting for non-current assets: Impairment of assets', 'Module 9': 'Accounting for liabilities, provisions, contingent liabilities, and contingent assets', 'Module 10': 'Disclosures for liabilities, provisions, contingent liabilities, and contingent assets'}
Convenors: {'Shelly Herbert': ['Chartered Accountant (SA) and Senior Lecturer, College of Accounting, UCT', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdElCIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--c71600527a243cea56ac688de68a9f7e2d7f5606/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/university_of_cape_town_accounting_course_convenor_shelly_herbert.jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['The ability to work with a financial reporting team and implement processes to create annual public financial statements.', 'A thorough comprehension of the differences between the GRAP framework, IFRS, and the modified cash basis relevant to public sector financial reporting.', 'The skills to navigate and manage budget information, cash flow statements, accounting policies, and changes and errors.', 'The accounting principles driving public sector imperatives and methods to accurately report on revenue, assets, liabilities, and working capital.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']
About the certificate: Learn how to use various GRAP frameworks to create public sector financial statements and earn an official certificate of completion from the University of Cape Town. Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Oxford Executive Leadership Programme
about: Elevate your leadership skills for the modern business environment and contribute to your organisation’s success.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Programme overviewTop 10 skillsThe most sought-after skills in the top 10 US companies include communication, management, leadership, and problem-solving.Emsi (May, 2020).Less than 2 in 10The number of employees who believe their organisation’s leadership communicates effectively with the rest of the company.Gallup (Nd). Accessed 5 April 2022.Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
In today’s evolving business landscape, there’s a growing need for highly skilled leaders who can navigate complex challenges and empower their teams to succeed. Combining theory and practice, this Oxford Executive Leadership Programme is centred around refining and developing your leadership skills and purpose in line with your company’s strategic focus.
Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll explore core leadership themes, including: power and influence, motivation, authenticity and adaptability, change, complexity, and diversity. Gain the opportunity to critically reflect on your leadership approach, while using practical insights, tools, and frameworks to lead high-performance teams in dynamic environments and through times of change.
Expand your global network online with Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, as you learn alongside a cohort of like-minded professionals and gain essential skills for the future of work.
The content of this programme also forms part of the six-month online Oxford Strategic Management Executive Programme, designed to help you advance as a business executive.
Is this programme for you?This programme is designed for leaders and managers at all levels who want to further develop their skills to overcome challenges and become a driving force for change in their organisation. The content would support business executives looking to improve their leadership skills, discover or refine their leadership purpose, and make an impact within their business. It would also be helpful for those in senior and middle management who are preparing to move into an executive management role, as well as aspiring leaders who want to gain the confidence to step up.

This Oxford Executive Leadership Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 80 hours of learning.

title: Project Management Essentials
about: Develop fundamental project management skills to effectively execute any project on time, within scope and on budget.
Course overview: Course overview74%The number of respondents in a KPMG, AIPM, and IPMA joint research survey who believe project management skills will be more important in the future than they are today.IPMA (Nov, 2019). £156.5 billionThe estimated contribution of project management services to the UK economy.PWC (April, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Dynamic industries need project managers who can adapt to rapidly changing circumstances, meet growing customer needs, and maximize resources. The Project Management Essentials online short course from the George Washington University School of Business is designed to help professionals lead and deliver projects on time, within scope and on budget. Over the duration of eight weeks, you’ll gain an overview of the fundamental principles of project management and develop an understanding of its role in organizations. You’ll also learn about the project initiation process, different project management approaches, and the importance of effective communication and stakeholder engagement for project success. Throughout this journey, you’ll be introduced to new and popular project management tools and techniques, and equipped with the necessary skills to schedule, control, and organize business projects.Is this course for you?This course will benefit anyone interested in understanding the principles, tools and skills needed for project management, including strategic project planning, scheduling and time, cost, and scope management. It’s equally relevant to working professionals looking to run a project from inception to completion. For those new to project management, or seeking a career shift to a role that requires project management capability, you’ll gain insight into practical project management knowledge applicable to your context. The course also provides an opportunity to explore key interpersonal, leadership, and strategic skills valuable to all professionals, regardless of industry. Whether you’re aiming to leverage future role growth, or seeking validation for existing project management skills, you’ll gain invaluable insight from GW Business resources, specialist faculty, and industry experts.

title: Machine Learning in Business
about: Incorporate machine learning into your business strategy, as you explore the value and impact of this technology.
Course overview: Course overview$20.83 billionThe expected value of the global machine learning market by 2024, a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 44.06% since 2017.Market Research Future (Jan, 2020).75%The estimated percentage of organizations that will leverage AI techniques like ML or deep neural networks (DNNs) to deliver business value by the end of 2022.Gartner (Nov, 2019).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Machine learning offers an opportunity to gain a powerful competitive edge in business and is increasingly becoming a priority for managers and executives. In the Machine Learning in Business online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management and the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL), you’ll be guided to discover the business potential of machine learning while developing strategies for effective implementation.The program focuses on the managerial implications of machine learning and touches on certain technical aspects to provide you with the deeper knowledge needed to craft an effective machine learning integration strategy. Explore the value and impact of this technology, with insights from esteemed MIT faculty and machine learning experts. Is this course for you?Although not technical in focus, this online short course will be useful for leaders and decision-makers who want to gain a grounding in machine learning in order to successfully integrate it into their organization. It’s also relevant for managers, data specialists, consultants, and business professionals interested in exploring the technology’s strategic implications. You’ll walk away with a sound understanding of the applications of machine learning in business, without needing to code or program. You’ll also explore the opportunities, capabilities, and scope of this transformative technology.

title: Oxford Artificial Intelligence Programme
about: Explore the practical applications of AI, within your organisation and society.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Programme overview$110 billionExpected global spend on artificial intelligence by 2024, with the United States accounting for more than half the total, followed by Western European countries such as the UK.IDC (Aug, 2020).
30%The amount of jobs that could be automated by the mid-2030s.PwC (2018).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Artificial intelligence (AI) is already having a major impact across the economy, coursing  in short order across the global business environment. To truly understand the potential it holds, you first need to understand how the technology works. The Oxford Artificial Intelligence Programme aims to provide you with a sound framework of this technology: from its history, functionality, and capability, as well as its inherent ethical challenges. Over the course of six short weeks online you’ll develop an informed opinion about AI's applications with insights from University of Oxford faculty. Reflect on the implications and opportunities of AI, and build a business case for its implementation within your unique organisational context.
Is this programme for you?This programme is designed for managers and business leaders across multiple functions and industries looking to understand the workings and possibilities of AI. It’s also applicable for technical working professionals such as CIOs, IT managers, and business analysts who want to better understand how artificial intelligence can be implemented within their organisations.
You’ll get the opportunity to learn about artificial intelligence online, and develop a foundational understanding of how it works. However, as this is a non-technical programme, you will not be required to code.


This Oxford Artificial Intelligence Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 60 hours of learning.
Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Compliance Essentials
about: Begin your journey in compliance management with practical knowledge of the laws and legislations that make up the regulatory field in South Africa.
Course overview:
Course overviewR282 billionThe market value Steinhoff has lost since it emerged that top executives had perpetuated accounting fraud to the sum of $7.4 billion.Mail & Guardian (Oct, 2019).77%The percentage of organisations that fear reputational damage resulting from non-compliance.ITWeb (Feb, 2019).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Compliance is a crucial facet of any business or industry, and failure to assess and respond to risks can have catastrophic effects on your organisation. On the course, you'll learn the fundamental principles of compliance management, enabling you to assist in limiting liabilities and, ultimately, avoid the legal and financial repercussions of non-compliance. Designed by experts from the University of Cape Town (UCT), this course uses the Generally Accepted Compliance Practice (GACP) framework and the King IV Code to provide you with the necessary principles and guidelines to work in this space. As you work through the modules, you’ll develop the confidence to address potential issues and make recommendations to your team. You’ll also explore the value, scope, and complexities of the role compliance plays in your business and within the broader legislative landscape. After completing this course, you’ll receive a one-year student membership to the Compliance Institute Southern Africa (CISA). Should you complete both UCT compliance online short courses offered by GetSmarter, within a one-year period, you’ll then get a two-year CISA membership.Is this course for you?The UCT Compliance Essentials online short course does not have entrance requirements and is aimed at those new to the world of compliance and legislation. Professionals looking to move into this key business function will gain the necessary skills and understanding to apply for a compliance position. For those whose position already requires them to work closely with compliance functions in their organisation, it can provide the expertise to confidently make recommendations, perform risk analyses, and draft reports. Given the increasing demand for compliance literacy, developing  your knowledge of this field may help facilitate career growth in a variety of industries.





GetSmarter is endorsed by the Compliance Institute Southern Africa (CISA). CISA sets, maintains, and promotes best-practice standards for the compliance profession and has developed a Generally Accepted Compliance Practice (GACP) framework to govern business standards. By completing this course, students will gain compliance-management skills aligned with CISA GACP benchmark standards, which are nationally recognised. CISA also administers professional accreditation for compliance professionals. Upon completion of this course, students will qualify for one year’s free student membership to CISA and access to the latest compliance intelligence. By completing the Compliance Management course, you’ll also be eligible for 15 Continuous Professional Development (CPD) hours. Click here for more information.

Please note that GetSmarter and UCT bear no responsibility for the claiming of the membership and other benefits with CISA. The onus, therefore, falls on you to do so.

title: Investment Management
about: Gain practical insights into South African and offshore investing.
Course overview: Course overview$4 trillionExpected level of investment and consumer spending due to the formation of the African Continental Free Trade Area.International Trade Center (Sep, 2018).27%The percentage of inflows into the Collective Investment Schemes (CIS) industry which came directly from investors in 2019.ASISA (Nov, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Amid falling consumer confidence in traditional portfolio management, South Africans are more willing than ever to take the leap into individual investing – with modern technology providing the tools to do so. However, in order to make informed, responsible investment decisions, it’s necessary to understand the investment environment.The Investment Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) offers a practical guide to the world of financial investments. The course does not offer specific investment advice, but rather empowers you with the skills needed to intelligently manage an investment portfolio. Learn to choose the right company, fund, and investment strategy with confidence.Is this course for you?This course is ideal for anyone interested in investing, but who has no formal knowledge or qualification of the subject. It will also benefit professionals who have a background in finance, but little exposure to investing specifically. These professionals will gain a greater understanding of investment products, including offshore investments, and asset classes such as cryptocurrencies. Through the course, students will become equipped to consider investments from a global perspective, while working towards their own financial reward.

title: Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)
about: Optimise your online presence with powerful SEO strategies.
Course overview:
Course overview93%The high percentage of online experiences that start with a search engine.Blue Corona (Dec, 2018).53%The average search share of traffic generated by SEO, with paid only amounting to 15%.Brightedge (2019).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)Due to the rapid rise of digital technologies, new online and optimisation strategies are required. As a modern professional or business owner, understanding how to harness the power of search engine optimisation (SEO) to market your business is essential to supporting its online presence and ultimate success.Ensure your business is as visible as possible in search engine results pages with the Search Engine Optimisation online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT).  This course aims to equip you with the skills to implement your own SEO tactics and strategies, giving you a competitive market advantage. You’ll gain fundamental principles and practical skills to drive more traffic to websites through SEO-optimised content. By practising on a live eCommerce Wordpress website, you’ll walk away with the ability to offer in-demand SEO services for clients, and boost your website’s ranking.Is this course for you?This course has been designed for both existing digital marketing professionals and those entering the field. Professionals within digital marketing will get the opportunity to refine and advance their skill set with the latest SEO practices, tools, and ethics. Professionals new to online marketing will gain a comprehensive understanding of the need for SEO, content strategies, website structures, and analytics tools. Business owners and entrepreneurs will also benefit from learning practical optimisation strategies which they can immediately implement within their context. Marketers, web professionals, and those starting a career in SEO will have the opportunity to validate their skills with a certificate from Africa’s leading university.1

title: Facilities Management
about: Learn to design a helpdesk process and recommend strategies for optimal facilities management.
Course overview:
Course overview26% to 50%Over a third of businesses outsource up to half of their facilities services.Servest (2019).$1.9 trillionThe global market prediction for in-house and outsourced facilities management by 2024.McKinsey (Nov, 2019).
Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)A once dislocated industry of isolated services, facilities management has transformed into a fully fledged market and profession, targeting the entire value chain.1 Today, it plays a critical and integrated role within an organisation’s strategy, structure, and processes.
The Facilities Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) explores the context of this core component of management, and establishes its place within strategic and operational business matters. You’ll explore the role of projects and maintenance, and the relationship between strategy, budgeting, processes, policies, and the environment. You’ll be introduced to the facilities management life cycle and will learn to design a helpdesk procedure for unplanned maintenance. Contract and tender management, alongside the role of technology in facilities management, will also be explored, equipping you with holistic and comprehensive skills for an in-demand and critical business role.
1 Engineering News (Mar, 2019).Is this course for you?This course is beneficial to those already established within the industry, as well as anyone looking to start a career in facilities management. As an industry lacking formalised training, this online course provides professionals the opportunity to validate their skills and differentiate themselves within the market. Current facilities management employees will be able to advance their existing skill set, while aspiring professionals will gain a solid foundation of the skills required. Upon completion, students will walk away with a certificate, as proof of their expertise, from Africa’s leading university.2
2 QS Top Universities (2019).

title: Global Health Delivery
about: Understand the challenges facing healthcare delivery, and design a solution for real-world implementation.
Course overview: Course overview37.7 millionThe number of people living with HIV globally in 2020.UNAIDS (2021).75%The percentage of people with mental health disorders in low- and middle-income countries who don’t receive treatment.World Health Organization (Aug, 2020).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)The greatest challenge to effectively managing and improving healthcare delivery isn’t availability, but access. Join a global health community in this online short course from Harvard's Office of the Vice Provost for Advances in Learning (VPAL), in association with HarvardX, as you analyze the influence that power and social structures have in shaping disease response. Through real-world case studies, you’ll investigate international approaches to fighting Ebola, HIV/AIDS, and MDR-TB, and understand the burden of mental health. You’ll evaluate how ideologies, problem framing, and the choice of metrics shape health policy. With guidance from expert university faculty, you’ll design your own global health intervention for actual implementation across public and private settings. Over the course of 10 weeks online, this program will also equip you with the managerial and soft skills to complement your medical knowledge, and you’ll ultimately leave with a premier certificate from Harvard’s VPAL, in association with HarvardX.Is this course for you?This online short course is for anyone with a passion for healthcare innovation who is looking for solutions to better serve their communities. This includes professional clinicians and public health practitioners as well as established global health leaders such as advisors, policymakers, and government officials. This program would also be relevant for investors and donors of global health initiatives, or those working in a multilateral organization, bilateral agency, NPO, or NGO.

title: Oxford Entrepreneurship: Venture Finance Programme
about: Gain a holistic understanding of venture finance and make informed decisions for capital funding and investment.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview: Programme overviewNearly $3 trillionThe worth of the global startup economy.Startup Genome (Jun, 2020).15%The percentage that global venture capital funding grew year-over-year in 2020, despite the COVID-19 pandemic. CB Insights (Feb, 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)A lack of funding, not knowing how to spend it effectively, and not adequately balancing the risks of venture financing are just some of the reasons that startups fail. Gaining an understanding of venture finance could enable you to secure funding for a business and help it to realise its potential, whether as an investment or your own entrepreneurial venture. The Oxford Entrepreneurship: Venture Finance Programme aims to provide you with this understanding through an exploration of the nature and dynamics of venture finance. Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll embark on an online learning journey that covers various investment avenues, including venture capital funds and crowdfunding. Led by Saïd Business School, University of Oxford faculty and industry experts, you’ll use a ‘two-hat’ approach to investigate venture finance from the perspective of both an entrepreneur and an investor. This programme also explores how to navigate the funding process, from the initial fundraising to the final exit strategy.  Is this programme for you?The coursework of this online programme is aimed at those who are planning, or currently involved in, a new business and would like to gain a comprehensive understanding of venture capital financing. It’s also ideal for current or aspiring investors wanting to break into the industry. Investors will learn to analyse different funding opportunities, while entrepreneurs will learn how to effectively present and prepare their venture as they go about the fundraising process. Basic financial knowledge or business acumen is recommended. This Oxford Entrepreneurship: Venture Finance Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 80 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Saïd Business School and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Leadership Program
about: Learn to adapt your leadership approach to the needs of your team and organization.
University name: UC Davis Graduate School of Management
Course overview: Program overview9%The overall leadership effectiveness of an uninspiring leader.Forbes (Nov, 2018).80% The amount of global organizations that have a shortage of leadership talent.MMC (2019). Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Effective leaders know how to adapt to various situations and challenges within an organization. Whether your team is new, transitioning through change, or is under pressure to perform, choosing the correct leadership approach is vital.  The Leadership Program from the UC Davis Graduate School of Management (GSM) gives you the frameworks to do this. Guided by the Situational Leadership Model, the program offers an experiential learning process whereby you’ll get the opportunity to lead a fictional team through a number of different scenarios while assessing your role within that environment.  The curriculum focuses on three key areas: the self as a leader, leadership as a relationship with your team, and the environment in which teams are situated. Through these lenses you’ll develop practical strategies to build trust, lead through times of change and crisis, and motivate your team to reach their objectives.The UC Davis Graduate School of Management Leadership Program was recently ranked as one of the top leadership certificate courses in the U.S. by CIO.Is this program for you?This leadership program is designed for professionals who want to enhance their careers, as well as those who are aspiring to step into a management or leadership position. It would also be beneficial to established managers or team leads who are looking to take on more responsibility, further build their teams, or develop their individual leadership style. The situational decision-aid you’ll walk away with is a useful tool for anyone who wants to align their leadership approach with the needs of their team and organization.

title: The Law and Economics of Mergers and Acquisitions
about: Gain an interdisciplinary toolkit to understand and navigate the laws, structures, and challenges of corporate transactions.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview: Course overview60%The percentage of survey respondents who say that shareholder activism is having an impact on their M&A strategy and execution. Deloitte (2020).45%The amount of revenue growth that M&A is expected to spur over the next three years – up 30% from the previous three years.Bain and Company (Feb, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Mergers, acquisitions, public offerings, and corporate takeovers are all subject to the influence of an array of legal, economic, and social factors. This transactionary landscape is renowned for its complexity, so an understanding of these industry drivers, structures, and issues is not just useful, but critical to succeeding in this fiercely competitive space. On The Law and Economics of Mergers and Acquisitions online certificate course, you’ll gain a toolkit for navigating the structures and legal issues of corporate transactions. Designed by experts from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) Department of Law, the course gives you the knowledge, insight, and confidence to play an active role in managing deals. You’ll examine the different types of corporate transactions, including hedge fund attacks, private mergers and acquisitions (M&A) deals, and hostile takeovers. Drawing on case studies and modern finance and economic contract theory, which has significant practical relevance, you’ll become equipped to approach corporate transactions holistically. You’ll also examine the jurisdictional discrepancies across the UK, US, and EU member states, and learn to navigate the drafting and negotiating requirements. Is this course for you?This course gives legal professionals, who are new to the field, the opportunity to gain a deeper understanding of the law and economics of corporate transactions. With fresh insight, they’ll be able to more efficiently deploy their existing legal expertise in the specific context of corporate transactions. Individuals in financial and professional services, which includes accounting and management consulting, will enhance their ability to manage corporate transactions, by gaining further knowledge in law, regulation, and contracting. Finally, this course also benefits professionals who wish to move into the M&A space by providing a holistic overview of the activities, as well as assist business owners and entrepreneurs who will gain the confidence to sell or exit their company.The Law and Economics of Mergers and Acquisitions online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 50 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Social Media Marketing
about: Learn how to leverage key social channels to build brand awareness and broaden customer reach.

Once used predominantly for personal networking purposes, social channels are now recognised as key marketing tools, and organisations need a sound strategy in place in order to properly leverage these platforms for promotional success.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Social Media Marketing online short course is designed to teach you how to develop such a strategy.
