title: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in Healthcare
about: Discover how systemic racism and implicit bias create inequity in the healthcare system, and develop your own DEI strategic plan to address it.
Course overview: Course overview70%The percentage of jobs held by women in health and social care, while only 25% of leadership roles in the same industry are held by women. WHO (Nd.) Accessed April 13, 2022.70% of the U.S.Black, Latinx, Indigenous, people of color make up more than half of the U.S. population and hold around 80 percent of purchasing power, but are still underrepresented in health solution investment, development, and purchasing decisions.Revcycle Intelligence (Mar, 2022).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)The healthcare system hasn't escaped the racism, inequity, and bias present in societal structures. The first step toward rooting out and combating racism and discrimination across social identities in healthcare systems is through the awareness of the myriad forms of prejudice entrenched in them. It’s therefore crucial that healthcare leaders acknowledge and understand the social determinants of health that place marginalized population groups at higher risk for poor health outcomes. And it’s equally important to have a diverse healthcare workforce — which represents the community tapestry — to provide optimal care to diverse patient populations. Learn how to mitigate health disparities and bias in the healthcare system in the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in Healthcare online short course from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE), part of Stanford Medicine. Guided by industry leaders and healthcare experts, you’ll examine why some population groups receive comparably worse healthcare than other groups. Throughout this six-week course, you’ll learn and apply specific DEI strategies to combat discriminatory practices while building a stronger patient-practitioner experience in the process. From an organizational perspective, you'll discover how recruitment policies, organizational change, and team dynamics can be enhanced through the active use of inclusive practices. Walk away with the knowledge and tools to help advance workplace equity for diverse individuals, and build a healthcare organization that prospers.Is this course for you?This course is for anyone interested in understanding and addressing systemic racism, societal biases across social identities, and public health disparities in healthcare while advancing DEI within their own organizations. Healthcare leaders and workforce managers will have the opportunity to engage with expert perspectives and gain a DEI-focused leadership tool kit. They’ll be equipped to understand how DEI manifests in the healthcare sector, and how it affects their management style and team dynamics. DEI professionals and healthcare students who are looking to navigate issues around racial, gender, and other identity-based discrimination within the healthcare sector will find the course content equally valuable.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Social determinants of health and health equity', 'Module 2': 'Systemic medical racism', 'Module 3': 'Healthcare equity across diverse populations', 'Module 4': 'Diversity in recruitment practices', 'Module 5': 'Microaggressions and team dynamics', 'Module 6': 'Leading with a DEI lens'}

title: Developing Digital Transformation Strategies
about: Learn how to stay competitive in an increasingly challenging business environment by harnessing three distinct strategies for organization-wide digital transformation.
Course overview:
Program overview90%The percentage of top management teams that now view digital transformation as a priority — up from 68% before the global pandemic.IMD (2021).69%The share of global leaders who plan to increase their financial commitments to digital transformation over the next 12 months, at an average investment of $12.6 million.Deloitte (2021).Duration: 5 weeks (excluding orientation)In an age of widespread disruption, where most organizations are concerned about the impact of new technologies but few feel like they’re responding adequately,1 digital transformation has become a business imperative. Successful digital transformation involves more than just the integration of digital technology — it’s an ongoing process, conducted at scale, incorporating careful planning, continual learning, and a cohesive short- and long-term strategy.
The Developing Digital Transformation Strategies online program from the Institute for Management Development (IMD) equips you with the skill set to strategically lead your organization through technological change. Over five weeks, you’ll develop a comprehensive understanding of what true end-to-end digital transformation entails, and learn to apply three unique strategies for the creation of digital experiences and transformation of digital functions and businesses in your own context. Leveraging Professor Misiek Piskorski’s proven Digital Transformation Strategy Framework, you’ll learn to effectively harness organizational design to facilitate wide-scale transformation, as well as select and utilize the digital platforms best suited to your company. By the end of the program, you’ll be equipped with a clear digital transformation road map and a work-ready action plan to carve out your competitive advantage and navigate change in your organization.
1IMD (2021).
Is this program for you?This program will appeal to any professional who is seeking to lead their organization’s digital transformation. It is relevant to individuals across industries, at all levels of transformation — whether not yet digitalized, currently digitalizing, or fully digitalized but yet to experience the benefits. C-suite executives, directors, and business leaders will unlock ways to grow their competitive advantage by developing a strategic roadmap for digital transformation, innovation, and decision-making. Senior managers, strategists, and heads of functions or departments will gain the tools to remain relevant and valuable by positioning themselves at the forefront of their firm’s digital strategy. A variety of specialists, consultants, analysts, and managers will have the opportunity to network online with fellow professionals and advance in their careers. Existing technology specialists will learn to supplement their knowledge with strategic insight, and apply it broadly to their work.
IMD is a triple-accredited academic institution, with the Financial Times ranking it first for its open programs nine years in a row. IMD attributes its success to its unique “Real Learning. Real Impact” approach. Based in Switzerland and Singapore, IMD is led by expert and diverse faculty who use their insights, tools, and perspectives to prepare participants for the future of business. As an independent academic institution with a global reach, IMD strives to educate ambitious individuals and organizations worldwide.
By taking this program, you have the opportunity to accelerate your career with the IMD Digital Excellence Diploma. Customize your learning journey with 15 days of programs that are relevant to your digital needs and pass an exam to earn the Diploma. See the programs here, and discover how participants are customizing their diploma.

The elements which were presented in five modules offered a good foundation. Thank you for the great content, it was really useful!'}

title: Copy-editing
about: Learn how to review, edit, and restructure text to eliminate errors and improve readability.
Course overview:
Course overviewR3.1 billionThe amount the South African publishing industry produced in revenue between April 2017 and March 2018.Publishers’ Association of South Africa (2019).30There are 30 common grammatical errors that writers regularly make.HubSpot (2018).
Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)The effectiveness of any published piece of writing can be significantly enhanced by the work of a skilled copy-editor. It’s the editor’s job to ensure that written material is clear, concise, compelling and error free, and the University of Cape Town (UCT) Copy-editing online short course is designed to prepare you for this task. Guided by an expert, you’ll learn how to apply the complex rules of grammar, restructure text for improved flow, and correct errors through proofreading. You’ll also discover more about book editing and working with authors, and you’ll improve your knowledge of the book publishing process.Armed with the ability to critically review copy, you’ll have the foundation to become an invaluable asset to any company that works with words.Is this course for you?This course is suitable for aspiring copy-editors, proofreaders, and writers looking to move into a new in-house or freelance role. The content is also designed for publishing professionals who want to update their editing knowledge, and those in related professions who are eager to expand their current skill set and improve their understanding of English grammar and syntax.Assignments are completed and submitted in Microsoft Word. Therefore, students must have a working knowledge of the program to complete this course. Required proficiencies include the ability to track changes, create paragraphs and indents on the ruler or in formatting, and insert endnotes and footnotes in a document.

title: Rotman Healthcare Leadership
about: Learn to build resilient healthcare teams by focusing on developing compassion, building trust, and promoting collaboration.
Course overview:
Course overviewGet financial aidThe Ontario Student Assistance Program (OSAP) offers funding to qualifying Canadian citizens.Rotman Financial Assistance (2022).86%The percentage of employees who say their relationship with their leaders is the top factor in job satisfaction.McKinsey (Mar, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
The ultimate purpose of any healthcare system is to provide high-quality patient care and promote population health and wellness. These intricate systems rely on a resilient network of medical workforces and caregivers. But in today’s increasingly volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous (VUCA) world, rigid traditional leadership methods that hinge on hierarchical structures are no longer going to cut it. Mindful, self-reflective, and adaptive approaches to leading teams are imperative to supporting those who shoulder society’s critical medical functions.
Discover what makes an outstanding leader in the healthcare sector – and develop a practical toolkit to become one – in the Rotman Healthcare Leadership online program from the Rotman School of Management at University of Toronto with faculty from the Institute of Health Policy, Management and Evaluation at the Dalla Lana School of Public Health.
Over six weeks online, you’ll gain a deeper understanding of how emotional intelligence can translate into leadership performance and organizational change. You’ll improve your ability to lead with impact and influence, while encouraging high-functioning teams in a stressful and complex environment. You’ll leave the program with your own leadership development action plan based on your current context to ensure your growth isn’t temporary, but an important part of your ongoing professional journey.
Is this course for you?With a focus on frameworks designed to enhance leadership performance in the dynamic medical and clinical industries, this program will prove useful to current and future healthcare professionals. If you’re a general practitioner, physician, nurse, surgeon, or allied health professional, this program will provide you with a practical, strategic toolkit. If you’re a non-medical professional facing new challenges and volatility in the healthcare space, the program’s content will equip you with the skills and insights to respond to such change while developing your unique leadership style. The competencies gained in this program – including change leadership, collaboration, self-awareness, team leadership, and innovative thinking – are broadly applicable to all leadership levels in healthcare.

', 'The leadership tools and frameworks for impact and influence, and create a leadership development action plan which can continuously be refined and developed.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']

Learn about strategic change leadership in healthcare and earn an official certificate of professional achievement from the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto.
Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the program handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the program.

title: Accelerated Management Program
about: Develop core management skills for tackling complex business challenges.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview:
Program overview5%The estimated growth of employment in management occupations in the US from 2019 to 2029 – faster than the average for all occupations.US Bureau of Labor Statistics(Apr, 2021).
Complex problem-solvingA key skill expected to increase in importance in the lead-up to 2025.World Economic Forum (Oct, 2020).
Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)In today’s evolving business landscape, there’s a need for leaders with the core management skills and knowledge to analyze and make complex business decisions across all facets of an organization. The Accelerated Management Program, from the Yale School of Management Executive Education, provides you with core skills and tools for managing a business more effectively. Through a unique integrated curriculum from a world-renowned business school, you’ll learn to overcome challenges across organizational functions, by understanding the connected elements of modern business.Over the course of eight weeks online, you’ll engage with a raw case study (from Yale SOM’s unique directory of case studies) as you explore fundamental business management topics, such as decision-making using quantitative models, developing a competitive strategy, and leveraging social networks. You’ll also learn about the time value of money, and develop the ability to interpret financial statements and value a project or company.Is this program for you?This online management program is beneficial for professionals at early, mid, and advanced career stages. It will benefit managers who want to improve their strategic and managerial abilities in current or future roles. Senior managers, executives, business owners, and entrepreneurs will have the opportunity to sharpen their analytical problem-solving skills with updated knowledge from first-class faculty. For non-management professionals, this non-credit-bearing online course offers the opportunity to develop key business and leadership skills, validated with a certificate of participation from Yale SOM Executive Education.

title: Content Marketing and Strategy: Brand and Business Growth
about: Develop a holistic and innovative content strategy that drives business success.
Course overview: Course overview90 percentThe amount of organizations that market using content. Demand Metric (Nd.) Accessed May 12, 2021.31.8 percentThe percentage of companies with a content strategy that outperform those without one. Miller Heiman Group (Jun, 2020).In today's crowded digital marketing space, content is king. From the demands and expectations of consumers to technology and process advancements that support new levels of innovation, it is vital for marketers, businesses and brands to have the strategic tools to navigate this digitized business, economic and social space.Explore the strategic potential of content marketing in the Content Marketing and Strategy online short course from Medill at Northwestern University. Over six weeks, you will discover how content can be used to achieve business goals and the key elements of an effective, brand-focused content marketing strategy. These include content writing, social media, analytics, visual narratives, storytelling, content management and digital innovation. Guided by Candy Lee, professor of marketing and journalism at Northwestern Medill, as well as industry experts, you will gain practical and critical thinking skills to drive an innovative content plan, define your marketing goals and set priorities to meet them. Finally, you will explore how emerging technologies and digital innovations impact content strategy, and how they can give your organization a competitive advantage.Is this course for you?This course is designed for any professional in a strategic role responsible for managing the promotion and positioning of a brand. Marketing specialists, strategists and brand managers will gain the tools to leverage content strategy for their business to thrive in a competitive landscape. Business leaders looking to innovate their content strategies to meet business goals, drive customer satisfaction and fuel business growth will find value in the practical, case study-driven nature of the course. It is equally relevant to professionals in start-up companies who would like to build their own personal brand through content marketing and visual storytelling.

title: Managing the Human Side of Digital Disruption
about: Leverage a human-centered approach to effectively navigate digital change in your organization.
Course overview: Course overview30%The percentage of digital transformations that succeed in achieving their objectives. Boston Consulting Group (Oct, 2020).22%The share of survey respondents who believe their organizations’ leaders have the right mindset to embrace the changes their company needs to succeed in the digital economy.MIT Sloan Management Review (Jan, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Due to continuous technological innovation and the move to remote work, organizations are facing increased pressure to digitize rapidly. To effectively lead a company through this digital transformation, business leaders need to upskill and learn how to control the psychological impact change and transition can have on their employees and teams.Gain the tools to help navigate digital change from the human perspective in the Managing the Human Side of Digital Disruption online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management. Over six weeks, you’ll draw on Faculty Directors Hal Gregersen and Roger Lehman’s original Transition-Curve Framework to understand and manage the development of your team’s roles, capabilities, and emotional responses to change. You’ll also learn how to facilitate effective change at an individual, team, and organizational level through leveraging the superpowers of purpose and inquiry and establishing the essential conditions of psychological safety and trust. Finally, you’ll apply the program content to predict change, learn from it, and confidently and successfully lead current and future transformations.Is this course for you?This course provides managers and business leaders with the skills and tools to help their people and teams through digital change by improving employee experience and engagement. Similarly, the program applies to business leaders looking to analyze digital change's impact on organizational models and implement solutions. This course will also benefit business advisers and consultants who require enhanced digital transformation leadership knowledge and skills to set themselves apart. In addition, HR business partners who aim to improve employee value propositions and experiences in an evolving business landscape will find the concepts covered useful.

title: Communicating for Influence and Impact
about: Develop your leadership abilities with communication skills that foster collaboration and influence positive change in any context.
Course overview: Course overview37%The percentage of PR professionals who agree that mobilising people is the most effective strategy to influence long-term change.USC Annenberg Center for Public Relations (Apr, 2020).Number 1Communication skills top the list of key competencies that contemporary employers are looking for in candidates.World Economic Forum (Aug, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Strong communication skills can help you to achieve impact and accelerate change for the benefit of society. As systems become increasingly volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous, finely tuned communication skills can help foster collaboration, improve problem-solving, and impact decision-making. Whether in social groups or business organisations, leaders across all segments of society and industry need to leverage communication to better meet objectives, influence stakeholders, and drive positive change. The Communicating for Influence and Impact online short course from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL) provides comprehensive insights and a range of tools to develop impactful communication. Throughout the programme, you'll learn how to communicate in a purpose-driven way to overcome barriers to success and get the opportunity to assess your leadership style. You’ll also learn communication techniques to help shape the future you want, while earning a certificate of completion validating your newfound skills.Is this course for you?This online short course is designed to help existing and aspiring leaders to become more effective communicators, and to influence change within and beyond their networks. It’s beneficial to all professionals who are driven to align business success with the delivery of positive social and environmental outcomes. The course curriculum is suited to those looking to build on past training and experience with an online programme designed to provide communication tools and skills to maximise influence and impact, while championing authenticity and integrity.This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 80 hours of learning. Note: should students wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon them. The University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Entrepreneurship in Architecture, Planning and Real Estate
about: Gain insight into the process of launching a venture to address urban challenges.
University name: MIT School of Architecture and Planning
Course overview: Course overview$233.9 BillionThe estimated smart cities market size for the U.S. in 2021.Globe Newswire (Jul, 2021).Make an impact“[N]ew ventures launched by people dedicated to scalable creative ideas will have an important impact in cities and the built environment around the world.” – Gilad Rosenzweig, Executive Director, MITdesignXDuration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Our built environment — the human-made spaces in which we live and work — has evolved over centuries. But this evolution has left gaps in its wake, leading to challenges in modern cities. In the Entrepreneurship in Architecture, Planning and Real Estate online short course, you’ll learn to identify, analyze, and ultimately fill these gaps with a design-based solution. Centering on the value iteration method, this program allows you to create your own solution to an urban problem, and explore the process of launching a new venture through this lens. You’ll also receive insights from experts within MITdesignX, an on-campus venture accelerator housed in the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P), and develop an action plan that you can use to translate your business solution to the real world.Is this course for you?This program focuses on entrepreneurship in urban and the built environment. As such, it will prove beneficial to existing entrepreneurs who work in the built environment already, and are looking for new skills or opportunities that can be applied to their current or new businesses. It will equally provide key knowledge to those who work in the built environment, but are not yet entrepreneurs. These professionals will learn the process of launching a venture in an environment they’re already familiar with, allowing them to translate their current experience into new areas. Existing entrepreneurs who haven’t worked directly in the built environment will gain insights into this sector, and will have the opportunity to explore the value offered by this growing market.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Imagine design solutions in the built environment', 'Module 2': 'Test ideas, research the market, and define stakeholders', 'Module 3': 'Calibrate an idea and create a development framework', 'Module 4': 'Determine the value proposition and model the user journey', 'Module 5': 'Prototype your built environment solution', 'Module 6': 'Create a business model', 'Module 7': 'Tailor the message and pitch your venture', 'Module 8': 'Develop an action plan to operationalize your venture'}

Study Entrepreneurship in Architecture, Planning and Real Estate, and earn an official MIT SA+P digital certificate.

title: Women’s Leadership Program: Leading Teams
about: Develop your unique leadership style by leveraging your network, gaining practical decision-making tools, and harnessing everyday moments for impact.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview: Program overview1 in 5The proportion of women who are often the only woman in the room at work. In senior roles, this is twice as common.McKinsey (Sep, 2021).The multiplier effectFor every woman who joins an organization’s C-suite, three advance to senior positions of leadership.Deloitte (Nov, 2021).Duration: 6 weeksNo two leaders are the same. Each will have a unique approach and authentic style. The Women’s Leadership Program: Leading Teams from Yale School of Management Executive Education gives you the tools to leverage your unique leadership capabilities. Over six weeks, you’ll focus on three cornerstones of effective leadership: decision-making, networks, and everyday leadership moments. You’ll also equip yourself with practical approaches and tools, such as the Vroom-Yetton-Jago model, to enhance your existing skill set. This online program combines live sessions and the opportunity to engage with a global network of women leaders as you explore the future of work from a woman’s perspective. Under the guidance of expert faculty and thought leaders, you’ll gain the skills and strategies to combine your existing capabilities with newly discovered strategies for influencing and leading teams.Yale SOM Executive Education offers multiple online, on-campus, and live-online women's leadership programs. This program is a natural continuation of the Women’s Leadership Online Program. Each can be taken independently, as a stand alone program, but they also build on each other to offer a holistic approach to leadership. View all Yale SOM programs for women and those who support them here. Is this program for you?This program equips professionals with the tools to navigate a continually changing leadership landscape. Senior leaders, the C-suite, and business founders will learn how to improve their decision-making and develop their leadership skills while growing and leveraging their networks. Mid to senior managers will have the opportunity to enhance their skills and networks to advance in their careers, while aspiring leaders will learn more about what it takes to develop influence in their team.

title: Oxford Climate Emergency Programme
about: As a leader, you have a critical role to play in addressing the climate crisis. Learn how to act now and how to act collectively to reimagine the way you do business.
University name: Saïd Business School | Smith School of Enterprise and the Environment
Course overview:
Course overview+1.5˚CGlobal warming beyond this temperature, as compared to pre-industrial levels, will accelerate long-lasting changes that humans won’t be able to mitigate in time.Deloitte (2020).
Leading risksFor the first time in the Global Risk Report’s history, climate-related issues dominate the top long-term risks by likelihood.World Economic Forum (2020).Duration: 6 weeksAt the end of 2019, UN Secretary-General António Guterres warned that the “point of no-return” on climate change was fast approaching – in fact, the next ten years will shape the climate risk outlook for the next century.1 It’s no longer sufficient for businesses to simply address the effects of climate change, they now need to play a critical role in confronting (and mitigating) the causes of the crisis.
The Oxford Climate Emergency Programme will empower you to take the required action. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll discover how to navigate risks and capture opportunities through catalysing change and reconceptualising the way you do business. Saïd Business School and the Smith School of Enterprise and the Environment, two leading institutions at the University of Oxford, have brought together extensive research and critical insights to create  this six-week programme, in which you’ll explore the climate emergency from a systemic, organisational, and individual perspective. As you explore the need for radical transformation, you’ll engage with economic system change, business model innovation, future-focused policymaking and more. You’ll be encouraged to reflect on opportunities for collaboration, as well as the importance of prioritising your own personal resilience and leadership when facing the climate emergency. This practical programme uses interactive peer engagements, case studies, and accessible tools, with a 100-day plan for driving urgent and meaningful change, helping you build a sustainable future vital for business growth
1 World Economic Forum (2020).
Is this programme for you?This programme is designed for senior managers and leaders, as well as consultants, who want to understand the impact of climate change on business, and vice versa. It will provide them with the tools and frameworks to innovate the way they do business, while still balancing environmental sustainability with profitability. Those within the sustainability, social, and environmental sector will be able to improve the way they collaborate and create action in addressing the climate emergency. Public sector professionals, policymakers, and regulators will discover what it takes to build a circular and regenerative economy, and gain a new systemic perspective to combat the crisis.This Oxford Climate Emergency Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 60 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Digital Business Strategy: Harnessing Our Digital Future Online Short Course
about: Integrate transformative technologies into your own digital strategy, and leverage their benefits to drive your organization forward.
Course overview:
Course overview100%The increase in digital sales, year over year, after the restaurant chain Chipotle upgraded its mobile apps to improve customer experience.Deloitte (May, 2020).$6.8 trillionThe forecasted amount that businesses will spend by 2023 on technologies and services to enable digital transformation.IDC (Oct, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
The MIT Sloan Digital Business Strategy: Harnessing Our Digital Future online short course investigates the principles that frame research by esteemed MIT faculty and The New York Times best-selling authors, Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfee. This program focuses on a unique approach to finding a balance between traditional methods and new ways companies can harness transformative technology to include in their digital strategy and improve best practices. With an emphasis on enabling an effective digital strategy and pushing digital transformation, this MIT Sloan Executive Education online program focuses on the rebalancing of three key relationships: human minds and machines, physical products and digital platforms, and the core (centralized knowledge) and the crowd (decentralized knowledge). It’s through these lenses that you’ll explore the potential of disruptive technology for business, equipping you to drive innovation within your own organization. Throughout the online short course, you’ll be encouraged to apply your newfound digital strategy business insights to real-life scenarios and ultimately walk away with an MIT digital certificate of completion.
Is this course for you?This digital strategy and transformation-focused online program aims to provide CEOs, managers, C-suite executives, and entrepreneurs with the knowledge they need to analyze traditional business strategy models and adapt these in light of current disruptive, digital technologies. It’s also valuable for professionals with strategic decision-making responsibilities across a range of industries. Similarly, it will be beneficial to any member of a senior leadership team looking for a transformation-centered course to stay abreast of how the global business context is changing.
What is a digital strategy?
Digital strategy is the use of technology to achieve business goals. The MIT Sloan Digital Business Strategy: Harnessing Our Digital Future online short course teaches you how to use disruptive technology in your business for innovation and competitive edge.
Drive effective digital strategies and transformation in your organization
Digital strategy online short courses help executives and managers who want to understand how technology is changing business models and strategies. This MIT digital strategy online short course is designed for professionals who want to lead their organizations through disruptive, transformative change with a positive impact.
Digital leadership
This MIT Sloan School of Management Digital Business Strategy: Harnessing Our Digital Future online short course provides an overview of how to lead a digital strategy, and ultimately, how it is used to drive value in organizations. Learn about the value of digital business models, innovation, and the role of technology in creating new markets and value propositions.
Why do business leaders need a digital strategy?
Technology is changing business in fundamental ways. Many businesses are using digital technologies to create new products and services, enter new markets, and improve operations. To keep up with the competition, it is essential to have a digital strategy that aligns.

What will set you apart: ['An understanding of the key features of digitization for business success in the digital economy, guided by esteemed MIT Faculty.', 'The knowledge to identify new opportunities for innovation and drive digital growth within your organization.', 'Effective strategies to ensure your business model stays ahead of digital disruption', '', '']
About the certificate:
Learn how to improve digital strategies for business to support digital transformation and earn an MIT Sloan digital certificate of completion.
This program also counts toward an MIT Sloan Executive Certificate, which you can earn upon completion of four programs where at least three of the four come from your chosen certificate track and at least one is completed in person. Find full details here.

title: Rotman Organizational Leadership
about: Gain the tools and understanding to navigate the complexities of organizational leadership.
Course overview: Program overviewGet financial aidThe Ontario Student Assistance Program (OSAP) offers funding to qualifying Canadian citizens.Rotman Financial Assistance (2022).27.1%The average growth in revenue as a result of cross-functional digital transformation investment at companies adept at breaking down silos, compared to 6.6 per cent at others.Accenture (2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)The increasing complexity of the modern organization – driven by changes in technology, the economy, and society – has resulted in a need for business leaders who can guide their teams through cross-functional intricacies. Success can no longer be achieved through an adherence to siloed hierarchies of teams and functions, but requires enhancing the performance of seemingly disparate parts within the organization itself.The Organizational Leadership online program from the University of Toronto Rotman School of Management offers you the tools, frameworks, and models to produce highly effective organizational teams. In it, you’ll gain a nuanced understanding of the complexities and challenges of senior leadership in order to lead teams towards a high-performance future. You’ll also learn to break down silos, influence business-wide culture, and manage change in your organization. Additionally, you’ll have access to Professor Hugh Arnold’s congruence model of organizational effectiveness, which will help you develop new ways of thinking about organizational effectiveness, and walk away with concrete, practical insights and approaches into the realities of organizational leadership in the modern age.Is this program for you?Focusing on frameworks and models designed to enhance organizational performance, this program will prove useful to senior managers across industries. If you already have experience as a senior manager, the program will allow you to enhance your ability to work across silos and manage change. If you’re new to management or making the transition into a senior role, you’ll develop an understanding of the challenges you might face and the complexities of senior leadership. If you own your business, you’ll learn how you can navigate organizational complexities and foster cross-functional collaboration to enhance performance.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Understanding the nature of organizational leadership', 'Module 2': 'Understanding the determinants of organizational effectiveness', 'Module 3': 'Building collaboration in order to break down silos', 'Module 4': 'Building and leading your senior team', 'Module 5': 'Leveraging organizational culture for high performance', 'Module 6': 'Leading effective change management'}
Convenors: {'Hugh Arnold': ['Adjunct Professor and Executive-in-Residence of Organizational Behaviour and HR Management, Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBaE1QIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--5cefe9799a451e5fe10885b003de7ab3b43ec44f/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/university_of_toronto_organizational_leadership_program_course_convenor_hugh_arnold.jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['A comprehensive toolkit of frameworks and models to produce highly effective organizational teams.', 'A nuanced understanding of the organizational complexities and challenges associated with senior leadership positions.', 'The ability to break down silos, shape organizational culture, and articulate your vision as you lead cross-functional teams towards the future.', 'A practical approach to organizational leadership that leverages insights from real-world case studies to enhance your team leadership.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']
About the certificate: Drive performance with an understanding of organizational complexity, and earn an official certificate of professional achievement from the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto. Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the program handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the program.

title: Climate Change and Business: Sustainability, Risk and the Push for Net Zero
about: Successfully navigate the challenges climate change poses for your business.
Course overview: Course overview$105trnThe estimated increase in capital spending needed to reach net-zero emissions in the next 30 years McKinsey (March, 2022).49%The proportion of people who believe climate change poses a major risk to their business. World Economic Forum (February, 2022).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)As the impacts of climate change mount, the need for companies to become climate-resilient is ever clearer. To do so, firms need professionals with the skills to navigate the complex and oft-misunderstood concepts of greenwashing, sustainability, net zero and circularity.Gain the knowledge and tools to implement effective, climate-conscious strategies on Economist Education’s online course, Climate Change and Business: Sustainability, Risk and the Push for Net Zero. Through real-world case studies, you will explore social and environmental issues that have an impact on the business world and analyse the science and economics behind climate change. Guided by industry leaders, you will investigate the pitfalls and opportunities involved in developing a corporate decarbonationsation strategy, and reflect on the considerations and shortcomings of environmental, social and governance (ESG) investing. Walk away with the knowledge to make informed decisions around climate change, and a practical understanding of the tools used to measure, reduce and offset carbon emissions. Is this course for you?This course will benefit senior to C-suite level professionals who want to manage the impact climate-related risks will have on their business and develop the skills to implement a carbon-management strategy. Those already in “green-collar” roles will gain the knowledge and tools to improve the execution of climate plans in their organisation.

title: Oxford Enterprise Leadership Programme
about: Develop an intellectual toolkit to align purpose, strategy, and capability in your enterprise for enhanced business performance.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Programme overview37The number of new winners in Canada’s Best Managed Companies awards program who consider a clearly defined organizational purpose a contributing factor to their success.

Deloitte (May, 2021).
13%The percentage of employees who strongly agree that their business leaders communicate effectively with the rest of their organization.

Gallup (Jul, 2021).
Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)The Oxford Organisational Effectiveness Programme is a specialised business strategy programme that highlights the impact of aligning purpose, strategy, and capability. The programme takes a fresh approach to an established concept by proposing strategies devised from insights in a new field of research termed ‘strategic alignment’.
Strategic alignment encapsulates the intersection of leadership and strategy to ultimately improve the effectiveness, operations, and performance of an enterprise and its project management. It also ensures organisational capability and strengthens teams by driving individuals within the enterprise to work together toward a common goal. In a highly competitive, complex, and shifting marketplace, this alignment can determine organisational success or failure.
Based on active research at Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, the programme investigates each link of the enterprise value chain that forms the core foundation of every organisation. Over the course of six weeks, it uses evidence-based insights, strategic frameworks, project case studies, and real-world applications to help you understand this new concept. As you position yourself to transform and future-proof your enterprise, you'll gain the practical skills to produce and apply a fit-for-purpose business strategy for your organisation’s unique context.
Is this programme for you?This programme takes a unique view on organisational effectiveness, aligning purpose, strategy, and capability. It aims to equip you with the intellectual toolkit to facilitate strategic alignment in any enterprise, be it in the private, public, government, or not-for-profit sector. While the practical application of your learnings, as well as stakeholder buy-in, is dependent on your level of influence, the principles taught are industry-agnostic. Guided by Oxford Saïd faculty,  heads of department, middle management, HR professionals as well as those in the field of project management, will learn how to strengthen their teams and facilitate strategic alignment between departments and within projects. Executives, directors, and business leaders tasked with operational transformation will benefit from the strategic approach to improving performance, creating future-facing objectives, and enhancing leadership skills. Consultants will explore the latest research and improve their ability to advise on clients’ organisational effectiveness.


This Oxford Organisational Effectiveness Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 60 hours of learning.
Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

What will set you apart: ['Strategies for improving organisational effectiveness based on the concept of strategic alignment, as well as an understanding of the role it plays in determining your enterprise’s long-term performance and competitiveness.', 'An ability to motivate for, and implement, transformation throughout your enterprise value chain, by aligning enterprise purpose, business strategy, organisational architecture, and management systems.', 'An intellectual toolkit, along with practical frameworks, for developing strategies that support and fulfil the organisation’s purpose.', 'Enhanced knowledge supported by real-world case studies, guest experts from some of the world’s leading enterprises, and exclusive insights from Oxford Saïd.', 'Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']
About the certificate: Learn how to implement strategic alignment in your chosen enterprise and earn an official certificate of attendance from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford.Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the programme handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the programme.
What past students think: {'Yann Le CamChief Executive Officer, EURORDIS – Rare Diseases Europe': 'The programme provides rich and brilliantly structured content. It trains leaders to ask themselves and their teams the right questions to achieve high performance. The online learning experience was exceptionally easy, enabling me to take full advantage of the programme in a flexible manner. I feel ready to apply the Strategic Alignment Framework in my international NGOs.'}

title: Making AI Work: Machine Intelligence for Business and Society
about: Discover a human-centered approach to deploying machine learning and learn to use AI as a tool for inclusive prosperity.
University name: MIT Sloan and MIT Schwarzman College
Course overview: Course overview$110 billionThe predicted global spending on AI in 2024.IDC (Aug, 2020).50%Half of executives identify responsible AI as one of their top three priorities.PwC (Jan, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Artificial intelligence (AI) is used to assist decision-making in health care, law, security, criminal justice, social media, and beyond. The possibilities are near-endless, but AI isn’t without risk. It’s now clear that data-driven decisions can have far-reaching impacts on individuals, organizations, and society as a whole. These unintended consequences are often difficult to identify and challenging to mitigate, but doing so creates new opportunities. Given the costs and risks of AI investment, it’s critical that leaders proactively anticipate and address these issues.The Making AI Work: Machine Intelligence for Business and Society online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management and the MIT Schwarzman College of Computing offers a systematic approach to examining the power and limitations of machine learning (ML) tools. Over six weeks, you’ll explore the vulnerabilities of AI and understand the steps needed to create robust systems with privacy at their core. You’ll also investigate the importance of human-technology collaboration in gaining a competitive advantage for your organization. On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with a proprietary ML Deployment Framework and practical strategies to redirect current AI and ML models to shape the businesses and society of the future.Is this course for you?This program is designed to equip business leaders with the skills and insights to manage the organizational and societal impacts of AI. It provides practical frameworks and strategies that address effective and responsible data usage, machine learning systems, and general technological advancements. Those in leadership roles in both the public and private sectors will be empowered to guide their firms toward responsible innovation. This program also bridges the gap between executives and technical professionals. Those who already have functional expertise in this area will identify opportunities to build better AI and machine learning models, and be further prepared to assist leaders in critical decision-making.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Power and limitations of machine learning', 'Module 2': 'Robustness and privacy', 'Module 3': 'Risks of using predictions for decision-making', 'Module 4': 'Human-technology interaction', 'Module 5': 'AI in your business', 'Module 6': 'AI’s contribution to inclusive prosperity'}

title: Supply Chain Management
about: Understand effective supply chain management and how it drives competitive advantage.
Course overview: Course overview75%The percentage of companies that have felt a negative business impact as a result of supply chain disruption.Accenture (Nd). Accessed 5 July, 2022.22%The percentage of companies that have a proactive supply chain network, which means the end-user is able to address shifts in supply or demand before they become critical.Procurement Tactics (2022). Duration: 11 weeks (excluding orientation)Supply chains are the arteries of today’s globalised economy. In an increasingly complex and connected world, the supply chain has become a key source of competitive advantage. It offers opportunities to spearhead innovation, maximise profits, and positively impact your customers’ experience of your business or brand.The Supply Change Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) introduces the basic concepts of production, inventory, storage, and transportation of goods and services, and what is needed to manage your supply chains efficiently and effectively. With a focus on competitive gain, you’ll explore the four functional areas of supply chain management and how they can work to set your business apart. Guided by faculty, you’ll understand what an integrated supply chain is, when to implement a supply chain management system, and how to ensure you stay up-to-date with trends. Using your own context as a case study, you’ll design an integrated supply chain plan and assess the potential competitive advantage of its implementation.Is this course for you?This course is aimed at anyone seeking to grow their supply chain management knowledge and skills to remain relevant and unlock new career opportunities. It’s particularly suited to individuals already working in the areas of logistics, warehousing, transportation, inventory control, purchasing, marketing, sales, customer service, and retail. It’s also applicable to business owners or entrepreneurs who want to increase the efficiency of their supply chain functions.

title: Data Analysis and Visualization
about: Develop data analysis and visualization skills to drive decision-making.
Course overview: Course overview10%The reduction in overall cost to businesses that have big data analytics.Entrepreneur (Jan, 2019).$274.3 billionThe estimated worldwide revenue of big data and business analytics by 2022.Businesswire (Apr, 2019)Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)As the increase in data changes the way in which organizations operate, professionals with a hybrid blend of analytical skills and domain-specific expertise are required to propel data-driven business decisions. In the Rice University Data Analysis and Visualization online short course, you’ll develop the skills and knowledge to effectively analyze, visualize and communicate data insights within your organization.  Guided by industry experts, you’ll discover how to navigate technical tools such as Tableau, SQL, and VBA. Learn to harness the fundamentals of data analysis such as advanced Excel functions, databases, and practical statistics. Through data-driven insights and effective visualization techniques, you’ll learn to communicate effectively with stakeholders through data storytelling.Is this course for you?This course is designed for professionals in data-driven roles, for decision makers who need to leverage data effectively, and for those interested in moving into these spaces. Functional analysts will further their ability to inform specific functions and business decisions, while managers will benefit from the ability to use analytics tools in their decision-making. Any professional interested in taking the first steps towards an analytical role will also benefit from a new understanding of data analysis and visualization. A basic proficiency in Excel is recommended, and while there are no prerequisites for this course, it’s recommended that students have a basic understanding of SQL before registering.

title: Digital Transformation in Operations
about: Leverage the latest digital technologies with a practical guide to strategically optimize the quality and speed of your operations, and enhance your business performance.
Course overview: Course overview67%The share of organizations that have accelerated their digital transformation strategy in the wake of the global pandemic, with 63% increasing their digital transformation budget.KPMG (Jul, 2020).69%The percentage of organizations that aim to increase their commitment to digital transformation over the next year, at an average investment of $12.6 million.Deloitte (2021).Duration: 5 weeks (late enrollment may be considered until the start of Module 1)Digital transformation is no longer just a productivity advantage, but an essential shift in sustaining effective operations that align to the future of business. Prepare to transform your operations management practices and drive organizational success with the Digital Transformation in Operations online program from Kellogg Executive Education at Northwestern University.With an introduction to key concepts in operations management, you’ll learn to recognize the value that digitalization and digital transformation can bring to your operations. You’ll also gain tools to identify opportunities for digital transformation in your operations, with insight into how 4IR technologies such as automation, smart controls, big data, machine learning, and analytics can be applied. Learn to improve the speed and scale of processes and management, enhance personalization using a digital approach, and have a direct effect on your business's bottom line.Is this program for you?This online executive education program is designed for those working in operations management or related fields looking to harness the benefits of digitizing traditional operations. These professionals will benefit from learning about the latest digital developments in operations, and how digitization and analytics can lead to improved performance management and increased efficiencies.

title: Market Research, Consumer Insights, and Competitor Analysis
about: Harness market research insights to inform your business strategy and gain a competitive edge.
Course overview: Course overview$80 billionThe global worth of the market research industry.Research World (Sep, 2019).81%The majority of executives who consider their businesses to be leaders within customer data analytics and reported increased revenue as a result.Forbes (Jun, 2018).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)With the massive amount of consumer data available today, it has become increasingly important for businesses to adequately gather and analyse this information to succeed. The Market Research, Consumer Insights, and Competitor Analysis online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) aims to equip you with the critical skills to interpret customer data and turn it into actionable business insights. By exploring real-world cases, you’ll discover how market trends and business data can be interpreted and utilised in multiple scenarios and industries. As you gain the relevant tools to understand your market, competitors, and customers, you’ll become better equipped to shape a competitive, data-driven corporate identity, enabling you to respond to change more effectively. You’ll also learn how to conduct your own market research, and lead a team to do the same.Is this course for you?This course is designed to empower professionals to use market and consumer-informed data to drive strategic business decisions. Marketing analysts and managers in particular will benefit from the ability to better understand their audience and market as a whole. The skills taught will also enable product and business development managers to harness valuable insights to shape their strategies and establish a distinct business identity. Both aspiring and current market and consumer analysts will have the opportunity to validate their knowledge by earning a certificate that speaks to their unique skill set in a competitive market. Finally, entrepreneurs will find value in the real-life case studies and practical approach to market research, preparing them for a rapidly evolving business landscape.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Market-led strategies for solving business problems', 'Module 2': 'Customer insights and behaviour', 'Module 3': 'Market trends and competitor analysis', 'Module 4': 'Collecting and leveraging customer data', 'Module 5': 'Data interpretation and storytelling', 'Module 6': 'Staying ahead of the curve'}

title: International Relations: China, Russia, the US and the Future of Geopolitics
about: Gain exclusive global perspectives with specialists at The Economist.
Course overview: Course overview​39%​The share of US employees who felt their leaders communicated a clear plan of action in the wake of covid-19.Gallup (Mar, 2020).62%The percentage of Americans who view China’s power and influence as a threat.Pew Research Centre (Apr, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)A shift within international politics is under way as Russia throws the geopolitical order into disarray and the rivalry between the United States and China intensifies. These risks, alongside climate change, migration levels and ageing populations are of critical concern to world leaders and business professionals alike.International Relations: China, Russia, the US and the Future of Geopolitics is an online short course from Economist Education. It is designed to equip you with a unique blend of conceptual and practical understanding of global politics and its impact. This six-week course takes you through the main players in power, their political strategies, economic goals and relationships, crucial events, the role of technology and the sweep of global trends. You’ll learn how your organisation may be affected by recent events and how you should respond to emerging shifts.Enjoy a free three-month digital subscription with this executive education course from The Economist. Read articles on Economist.com, listen to the weekly edition, watch videos, browse newsletters, immerse yourself in our podcasts and app, or join us at exclusive events.Is this course for you?This course is for senior professionals across industries, as well as in public policy and government, who are responsible for leading strategy or interested in professional development. It will equip executives and officials with the tools to plan effectively for change, and confidently discuss these themes with stakeholders inside and outside their organisations.This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 50 hours of learning. Note: should students wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon them. The Economist and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'From cold war to US-China rivalry', 'Module 2': 'The decline of US dominance', 'Module 3': 'The Chinese century', 'Module 4': 'The role of technology', 'Module 5': 'Disruptors, inbetweeners and game-changers', 'Module 6': 'Goodbye globalisation?'}

What will set you apart: ['An understanding of current China-US relations and how to steer your business through future disruptions.', 'Insight into Russia’s expansionism and other geopolitical challenges, as well as how these will affect your business strategy.', 'The latest analysis of globalisation and its future—to prepare for yours.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.', '']

Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.
What past students think: {'Dr Gordon PerchtholdAssociate Professor of Strategic Management (Practice), Lee Kong Chian School of Business, Singapore Management University': 'This course intelligently gathers the disparate threads of social, political, economic, and technological influences littered across the global landscape over the past 50 years, and weaves them into an analytical discourse that emphasises key tactical and strategic considerations for business executives trying to make sense of the new global order. The flow and pace was quite manageable over the six weeks. The textual storylines were interspersed with podcasts and videos by experts from The Economist and externally, as well as discussion forums on the topic among the couple hundred participants. The diversity of perspectives and constructive commentary from executives from different countries and cultures around the world was enlightening in itself. Each module ended with a reflection on the content presented, and its impact on your organisation and role.'}

title: Human Capital Strategy: Creating a Sustainable Competitive Advantage
about: Shape people strategies to create an effective, sustainable, and resilient organization.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview:
Program overview$32.7 billionThe total amount that the human capital management market is expected to hit by 2027.Fortune Business Insights (Sep, 2020).84%The percentage of the value of an S&P 500 company that lies in the skills, talents, work ethic, knowledge, and the health of employees.Gallup (May, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Today’s highly competitive business landscape is experiencing a labor transformation on a scale never seen before. Jobs are being automated at an intense pace,1 making an ability to reskill, adapt, and assume new roles the top-ranked employee characteristics for navigating the future of work.2  This widespread transformation signals the need for a shift in the way organizations approach talent optimization from the traditional siloed approach to a big-picture perspective. Organizations must shrewdly manage and empower human capital through high-level business and operational strategies if they wish to stay ahead of the pack.
Learn to make human capital strategy an integral part of your business operations in the Human Capital Strategy: Creating a Sustainable Competitive Advantage online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education. Following a sequential format, you’ll find out how to answer the crucial questions facing workforce management today: from talent acquisition and role alignment to learning and development. By the end of the six-week program, you’ll create your own practical action plan to prepare for the future of work.
1 World Economic Forum (Oct, 2020).
2 Deloitte (Dec, 2020).
Is this program for you?This program focuses on high-level strategy and is therefore ideally suited to management, leadership, and decision-making professionals who are interested in aligning their human capital planning and business operations to promote their organization’s competitive edge. The skills and insights available to participants will appeal to entrepreneurs and small-to-medium business owners. In addition, this program will benefit human resources, and learning and design professionals who want to act as competent business talent advisers while remaining agile and up to date on industry trends. They may also use this program to achieve personal growth by expanding their knowledge and developing strategic leadership skills.

title: Advanced Project Management Online Short Course
about: Move beyond foundational project management, and elevate your tactical and strategic skills.
Course overview:
Course overview11.4%The proportion of organisational investment that is wasted due to poor project performance.PMI (2020).64%The percentage of project managers surveyed who always or mostly engage in risk management.Wellingtone (2021).Duration: 12 weeks (excluding orientation)
As more organisations adopt a dynamic approach to work, the demand for advanced project management skills increases. In particular, leaders who are well equipped are able to balance a range of considerations to achieve project goals – and broader business objectives – within time and budget constraints.
The University of Cape Town (UCT) Advanced Project Management online short course outlines and unpacks the key subjects you need to grasp to move beyond project management basics and handle increasingly complex tasks. With a firm focus on strategic skills, this course will help you align project management activities with your organisation’s overarching aims to bring about real change.
A strong practical component allows you to develop tools that you can immediately apply to address pressing challenges and improve current and future role performance. In addition, you’ll walk away with a certificate backed by UCT that verifies your new, advanced project management competencies.
Is this course for you?This course is designed for professionals with existing project management knowledge or postgraduate experience in a relevant role who want to formalise their expertise or further build their skill set. Managers, business owners, events coordinators, and project team members will benefit by improving their ability to plan and execute high-level, large-scale projects. For those with limited time, course content is presented in manageable weekly modules, and students are assisted by an academic support team.

GetSmarter is approved by the Project Management Institute (PMI®) as an Authorized Training Partner (ATP), a partnership that enables you to join the world’s largest project management network. This Advanced Project Management online short course will count for 153.25 PDUs in total, and the division of hours is as follows: Technical - 81.50, Leadership - 30.75, Strategic - 41.00.
PMI is responsible for setting project management standards and providing certification. By taking this course, you’ll gain PMI-endorsed skills that are globally recognised. You can also use these learning hours towards furthering your professional project management development. See PMI.org for more information.
Please note that GetSmarter and UCT bear no responsibility for the reporting of these PDUs and/or hours to the PMI. The onus, therefore, falls on you to do so.
The PMI® Authorized Training Partner seal is a mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.

What past students think: {'Wesley MoffettPast Student': 'The Advanced Project Management course ranks as one of the most enjoyable, challenging and thorough online courses I’ve done. Using the GetSmarter platform was natural and intuitive, and the course content great. The forum discussions built great engagements between fellow classmates, some of which are now real-life friends. This course thoroughly enhanced my understanding of project management and brought real-world examples together into a practical and concise way, pushing my personal quality standards higher. The online support was great and very supportive when real-life curveballs hit.'}

title: Social Entrepreneurship
about: Gain the entrepreneurial skills, tools and knowledge to drive positive change and measure your social impact.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview: Course overview75%The percentage of organisations that believe ethics will play an important role in securing their success in the future of work.Deloitte (May, 2020).41%The share of millennials who need to know that a company is run ethically and responsibly before they consider purchasing from it.Morning Consult (2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)A business-as-usual approach to social and environmental concerns is no longer enough. In an age of radical transparency and accountability, organisations need to do all they can to ensure they’re driving positive change and creating value outside of profit. Gain an in-depth understanding of the processes, tools, and skills needed to create a socially conscious organisation with the Social Entrepreneurship online short course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE). Throughout this course, you’ll examine the challenges and opportunities associated with social entrepreneurship, and learn how to develop a business plan that actively addresses social issues.Over eight weeks, you’ll examine the key organisational considerations for founding a social entrepreneurship enterprise, and learn how to measure the social impact and value it creates.Is this course for you?This course will benefit a variety of professionals, including current and future entrepreneurs looking to start a socially conscious organisation. Those in a management role, especially within non-profit organisations, social-sector consultancies, and social enterprises will gain the skills needed to make a measurable social impact. Policymakers will gain the knowledge and tools to better collaborate with social enterprises, philanthropic foundations, and social-impact funders. This course will also be beneficial to any leaders, executives, or managers looking to support and address a social issue and embed purpose within their firms.This Social Entrepreneurship online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 70 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Leadership Development Program
about: Build a practical toolkit for influential leadership through self-reflection and confident communication.
Course overview:
Program overview64%The percentage of C-suite executives who identified “developing next-gen leaders” as their biggest challenge.SHRM (Apr, 2019).
70%The percentage of employee engagement that is directly influenced by their leader.Gallup (May, 2020).
Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Effective leadership requires a multifaceted skill set, including the ability to communicate, collaborate, and engage in self-reflection. By taking a holistic approach, the Leadership Development Program from the University of Dayton Center for Leadership equips leaders to become self-aware, confident team players, and organizational influencers.Develop your people management skills to focus on practical communication and collaboration, and effectively lead and influence teams. This program stimulates self-reflection aimed at developing a leadership style that can effectively adapt to organizational changes across broad contexts.
Enjoy the benefits of a high-touch support model, as you study through a top-tier research university1 and learn to take the lead with the University of Dayton Center for Leadership.
1 Bizjournals (Jan, 2018).Is this program for you?This program is beneficial to those currently in a leadership role, and those with ambitions of moving into a leadership position in the future. Organizational leaders will develop the communication skills needed to successfully lead employees, as well as the intervention solutions required to address relational and broad organizational issues. Managerial personnel will benefit from an understanding of the interpersonal skills required to elevate their leadership style, portfolio, and position. Finally, aspiring leaders will be empowered with team leadership skills and a personal leadership identity.

title: Teaching Certificate: Online and Hybrid Learning Design
about: Prepare for a changing teaching environment. Gain the tools to set yourself apart as an educator of the future.
University name: School of Education and Social Policy
Course overview:
Course overview$404 billionThe amount that global EdTech expenditure is expected to reach by 2025. HolonIQ (February 2021).77%The percentage of educators, according to a study, who believe technology is a highly effective way to engage students.Promethean (2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Over the years, technology has increasingly been used to support teaching and learning. But the rapid move to online learning has shown that a traditional approach isn’t enough. Future-focused teachers across the globe need additional support and training to make sure they can keep up with the fast-changing classroom environment. The Teaching Certificate: Online and Hybrid Learning Design from Northwestern University’s School of Education and Social Policy introduces a hybrid approach that harnesses the strengths of both online and in-person learning. Over six weeks, you’ll gain clarity on the relationship between technology, education, and social interactions, and build practical skills to improve your teaching with technology. Guided by leading experts, you’ll learn how to successfully incorporate technology into your classroom and use it to facilitate autonomous learning. You’ll also learn effective strategies for using technology to overcome barriers to accessibility, equity, and inclusion, and find out how to cultivate productive online communities. Discover the future opportunities that EdTech will create, and develop a learning environment that works for you and your students.Is this course for you?This course is designed for educators of all levels who want to effectively implement technology in their pedagogical practices. It’s also beneficial for those who want to understand how classrooms and pedagogical environments are evolving to prepare themselves for the future. Professionals hoping to take advantage of new developments in online or virtual learning and enhance their current teaching models will also find this course suitable.
*This online short course does not constitute a teacher preparation program and does not lead to, or qualify an individual to seek, licensure in teaching.
