title: Operations Management
about: Develop the skills to navigate the operational challenges that exist in an evolving economy.
Course overview:
Course overview142,800The number of new positions projected to open up for general and operations managers in the lead-up to 2029.Business Insider (Apr, 2021).
Between €40 and €65 billionThe yearly amount the automotive industry could save if it integrates end-to-end supply chain planning and synchronisation.McKinsey (Jul, 2021).
Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
The Fourth Industrial Revolution – or Industry 4.0 – presents the opportunity for organisations to reconfigure their operations. Along with the rapid evolution of digital technologies and manufacturing processes, changing consumer preferences, and other developments such as a global move towards sustainability are supercharging business transformation. This ever-changing environment demands that companies run their operations as efficiently and effectively as possible. Sound operations management ensures that resources are used intelligently to maximise efficiency, profit, productivity, and success.
The University of Cape Town (UCT) Operations Management online short course will help you develop competencies in production, capacity, supply chain, and quality management. Discover the 10 key principles of effective operations management and learn how to improve planning, manage the production scheduling process, and use forecasting techniques to solve demand-related issues. Ultimately, you’ll formulate a sound operations strategy using lean thinking and leave the course with the ability to make informed management decisions to drive your company forward.
Is this course for you?This course is ideally suited to those currently employed in a business’s production or operations function, and those looking to launch a career in operations management. Professionals already working in this field will improve their ability to effect change in their organisations and boost performance in their current roles. In addition, individuals looking to move into an operations role will acquire transferable skills that could open up new opportunities across various industries.The University of Cape Town (UCT) and GetSmarter are committed to gender empowerment and working towards an equal future. In celebration of National Women's Day, get 20% off when you register and pay for this course during the month of August* using the code WOMENOFUCT. *Exclusive offer valid until 31 August 2022

title: Practical Labour Law
about: Elevate your understanding of South African employment law and promote fair labour practices in the workplace.
Course overview: Course overview5,160The total number of mutual interest disputes dealt with by the CCMA during the 2018/19 financial year.South African Department of Labour (2019).5 prominent themesIncreased restrictions on fixed-term engagements and improved rights for working parents are two of five current trends in employment law.Eversheds Sutherland (2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)South African labour law has evolved considerably in recent years, with key acts being amended and employment equity gaining more prominence. It’s imperative that employers, human resource (HR) practitioners, and legal professionals stay abreast of such legislative changes so they can ensure compliance, avoid lawsuits, and resolve disputes.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Practical Labour Law online short course introduces you to the local employment law landscape, its various acts, and the rights and responsibilities of employers and employees. Guided by labour relations specialist Pieter Koornhof, you’ll learn how to navigate the complexities of contracting, dismissal and retrenchment, and discover strategies for avoiding workplace discrimination. Throughout the course, law concepts will be illuminated through the presentation of practical scenarios, which will equip you with skills and knowledge that you can apply immediately in your current context.Is this course for you?As this course covers many facets of South African labour law, it’s suited to HR practitioners looking to expand their knowledge of this subject area to add more value in current and future roles. It’s also ideal for legal professionals who want to learn how to handle labour-related issues, and small business owners who need up-to-date knowledge of employment regulations to ensure compliance and the fair treatment of staff. As students will receive a certificate of completion from UCT, this course is a good option for those looking for official validation of their labour law expertise.

title: Management Analytics: Decision-Making Lessons From the Sports Industry
about: Learn to use data and analytics to improve decision making within your organization.
Course overview: Course overview$77 billionThe amount the big data industry will be worth in 2023.Entrepreneur (Jan, 2019).A personalized marketplaceAI, when used with care and compassion, enables companies that are data-, machine-, and network-centric to begin understanding the feelings of their customers and suppliers.MIT Sloan Management Review (Aug, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)As the amount of data in the world grows, so does the demand for skilled executives who are equipped with the knowledge to lead a data-driven organization. This program aims to teach managers and executives the strategic, technical, and managerial skills to integrate data analytics into an organization.   Drawing on case studies from the sports industry, which has led the way in performance analytics, you’ll learn how to use data in your organization for improved decision making, goal setting, selection of appropriate technologies, structuring of teams, and communication.   Guided by MIT faculty and industry thought leaders, this program helps you navigate the process of data transformation in your business or organization, from concept to implementation.Is this course for you?This MIT Sloan course aims to guide you to lead a data-driven transformation in your company. With an emphasis on process, management, and innovation, this program is designed to help business owners, leaders, and aspiring analysts understand the core elements of data analytics from a business perspective and harness it to gain a competitive edge. No technical experience is required.

title: Strategic Change Management
about: Establish a competitive advantage through your organization’s ability to adapt to change.
Course overview:
Program overview75%The number of organizations that are set to initiate multiple types of change in the near future; only a third of all change initiatives are a clear success.Gartner (Nd). Accessed November 9, 2021.$2 trillionThe amount lost in the United States each year to failed change management initiatives.Forbes (Aug, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks (late enrollment may be considered until the start of Module 1)In today’s constantly shifting market, organizational change has become unavoidable. Transformative technology, business innovation, and global competition have made adaptability vital for companies that want to remain competitive in their industry. This includes having managers with the ability to perceive change in the marketplace, and who are able to pivot strategy and retool an organization, not just to remain relevant but to thrive.
The Kellogg Executive Education Strategic Change Management online program teaches you how to achieve and nurture sustainable change in your organization. You’ll gain the tools and insight to encourage creativity and implement change plans successfully. You’ll also learn to maintain strategic and organizational agility by creating a learning-ready company and effectively manage aversion to change.
Is this program for you?This online program is aimed at professionals ready to support their organization in maintaining a competitive edge through the anticipation and management of change. It will, therefore, be beneficial to senior and middle management who want to foster change in their company, as well as those in a specific change management role. While this program is geared towards those in medium to large organizations, it will also be highly relevant for leaders of small organizations who want to effectively manage growth and scaling. It’s also valuable to seniors in the human resources (HR) department — those who are traditionally responsible for these developments — looking for deeper strategic insight into organizational change management beyond their current understanding.
What is an example of strategic change management?Change is inevitable in today's fast-paced business environment, and strategically managing change within an organization is critical to achieving and maintaining a competitive edge. This involves creating an organizational structure and culture that is adaptive and responsive to change, as well as being able to implement change plans effectively.
What are the five key elements of a successful change management process?Key components of a strategic change management process include understanding the drivers of change and anticipating change needs. Managers need to develop a thoughtful change management plan, including effective communication strategies, ensuring organizational changes are in alignment with the company's overall goals and objectives. Other important elements include assessing stakeholder readiness for change and building a supportive organizational culture to help cultivate collective skills and knowledge. In addition, it’s critical to have the right leadership in place to support change in your organization.
What key strategies are needed to achieve successful change management in an organization?To effectively manage an organizational strategy for change, it’s important to have a clear roadmap defining concrete steps that encompasses all aspects of the change process.
What key performance indicators should be included in a strategic change management plan?There are several key performance indicators (KPIs) that can be used to measure the success of change management initiatives. These include project completion rates, return on investment, customer satisfaction levels, employee satisfaction levels, safety records, and production quality levels.

title: Product Marketing: Research, Consumer Behavior and Analytics
about: Future proof your organization with innovative techniques that turn customer data into insights, and insights into actions that drive business success.
Course overview:
Course overview85 percentThe share of chief marketing officers predicting that “significantly more” of their organization’s marketing decisions will be based on marketing analytics by 2022.Gartner (Oct, 2020).72 percentThe percentage of brands that say customer centricity is an even higher priority since the onset of COVID-19.KPMG (Jul, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
As the business landscape evolves, establishing a customer-centric organization has become increasingly important to ensuring success. But, in order to do this, companies need professionals with the skills to turn the insights they gain from the immense volumes of consumer data available today into actions.
Gain the enhanced skills needed to understand customer expectations to improve decision-making in your organization in the Product Marketing: Research, Consumer Behavior and Analytics online short course from Medill at Northwestern University. Over six weeks, you will examine consumer buying habits and discover the underlying motivations that influence their relationship with a brand. You will also learn how to use exploratory, descriptive and predictive analytics to identify, target and engage customers to create more personalized product and service offerings. At the end of the course, you will walk away with the tools and techniques required to draw actionable insights from market research data, and develop a successful product strategy that will help drive business growth.
Is this course for you?This course is designed to empower professionals across a variety of business functions with innovative techniques to turn consumer data into business insights that will help drive success. Individuals currently in a product marketing or market research role will hone and update their skills to improve performance in their role. Those with some experience working with market research and consumer data, and who are looking to make a career change into product marketing, will benefit from this course. Executives and leaders of small businesses that do not necessarily have a product marketing department and need to enhance their understanding of what drives their customer to inform their product strategy will also find value in this course.

title: Technology and Innovation in Legal Services
about: Optimize and innovate your legal-services delivery with data-driven decision-making.
Course overview: Course overview64%The amount of law firms that already use AI-based technologies for their legal research.Thomson Reuters (2019).75%The time saved within signature processes when technology and digital platforms are used.Raconteur (Oct, 2019).Duration: 6 weeksNearly every industry across the globe is being driven to adopt digital processes and tools in one way or another. Digital transformation has become inevitable, but for the legal industry, the push to innovate has been slow. Legal culture, business models, and firm structures have, until now, followed a history of tradition. But as data and technology rises within industries, firms will need to adapt to meet the demands of an evolving digital world.Start your journey towards innovation with the Technology and Innovation in Legal Services online short course from Northwestern Pritzker Law. This six-week course starts by exploring the technological forces driving change in the legal-services industry before taking an in-depth look into the way these technologies solve business challenges. You’ll learn about the potential of data analytics and artificial intelligence (AI), including machine learning and natural language processing, to improve legal-services delivery. With this holistic overview, you’ll discover other disciplines and frameworks to create an ecosystem for innovation in the legal services industry. Walk away from this outcomes-based course with the insight and tools to drive change and deliver superior legal services to your customers.Is this course for you?This course has been developed for junior- to senior-level lawyers working in the legal industry, as well as other legal professionals who want insight into the technological trends impacting their industry. Those looking to prepare for current and future changes will be able to gain the required skills, frameworks, and knowledge to adapt their firms and services, and harness the power of technology to optimize their businesses.Individual consultants and change-management specialists will also benefit from learning to better assist legal firms in building a case for digital transformation.

title: Managing People and Teams
about: Engage, motivate, and inspire your modern workforce to drive team performance.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview23%The increase in profitability of organisations whose employees are highly engaged at work.Gallup (Nd). Accessed 22 July 2021.80%The amount of organisations that consider employee well-being important or very important to their success.Deloitte (2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Research has shown that there exists a strong link between employee engagement and performance.1 However, ensuring your employees remain engaged is challenging in a work environment that is increasingly online and flexible. Navigating these challenges requires managers who are able to effectively motivate, inspire, and ultimately engage those who report to them.
The Managing People and Teams online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) teaches you to engage effectively with employees to motivate and inspire performance. On it, you’ll gain insights into managing flexible schedules and remote teams, and learn to promote diversity and employee well-being while guiding talent and driving retention through development. Take this expert-led opportunity to reflect on your leadership style and its impact on your team, as well as your own management abilities. You’ll also have the chance to draw on the expertise of LSE’s Department of Management, home to world-class education and research in business and management.
1Gallup (Nd). Accessed 22 July 2021.
Is this course for you?This course's focus on broadly applicable management tools makes it beneficial for a wide range of roles and industries. If you’re an experienced manager, you’ll gain insights into motivating your team in any situation, including virtual environments. New managers, meanwhile, will learn the underlying motivations you can use to inspire your employees and drive performance. If you’re an aspiring manager, this course will provide you with a toolkit to navigate the modern organisation, while laying the groundwork for future leadership roles. For those working in human resources, this course offers tools you can use in your day-to-day management work, while giving you the confidence to advise other managers in their operations.This Managing People and Teams online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 70 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Blockchain for Business Program
about: Explore the power of Bitcoin and blockchain technology, and learn to implement blockchain solutions that unlock business opportunities.
Course overview:
Program overview$6.6 billionThe estimated global spend on blockchain solutions in 2021.IDC (Apr, 2021).$120 billionThe estimated value locked across decentralized finance-related smart contracts.Glassnode (May, 2021).Duration: 5 weeks (excluding orientation)Blockchain technology’s power to cut costs and mitigate risks has sparked buy-in from large enterprises and private individuals across the globe. Regardless of the controversy and speculation surrounding Bitcoin, blockchain – the basis of such cryptocurrencies – has immense potential. While blockchain technology was initially designed to upend the traditional banking system, it’s starting to transform numerous other sectors too.The SDA Bocconi School of Management Bitcoin and Blockchain Program cuts through the hype by exploring the technical pillars that underpin these technologies. Over five weeks, you’ll examine blockchain’s capabilities and how it applies to Bitcoin, as well as the associated regulatory frameworks and challenges. Designed by expert faculty, the program will help you make informed decisions about incorporating blockchain technology into your organization. You’ll walk away with insights into the practical applications of the technology to unlock new business opportunities and, ultimately, competitive advantage.Is this program for you?Blockchain capabilities have topped the list of in-demand skills around the world.1 This program is ideally suited to individuals driven to remain relevant by upskilling to address this new business need. Leaders from various industries will expand their understanding of blockchain’s technological pillars to take advantage of its business applications. Similarly, lawyers, accountants, analysts, consultants and tech professionals will gain insight into industry applications alongside a cohort of like-minded professionals.
1LinkedIn (Jan, 2020).
SDA Bocconi is one of the few elite business schools to have garnered the ‘triple crown’ of the world’s most prestigious international accreditations (AMBA, AACSB, and EQUIS). It is also the only Italian institution to feature in all the major global business school rankings, including those of the Financial Times, Forbes, Bloomberg Businessweek and The Economist.*
*SDA Bocconi (2021)

title: Leading Digital Innovation in Supply Chain and Logistics
about: Identify opportunities to transform your supply chain. Learn online with a globally recognized business school.
Course overview:
Program overview50%The percentage of global product-centric enterprises that will have invested in real-time transportation visibility platforms by 2023.Gartner (Feb, 2021).11.2%The predicted compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of the global supply-chain management market from 2020 to 2027. Business Wire (Aug, 2020).Duration: 5 weeks (excluding orientation)Emerging supply chain and last mile logistics technology is a major source of competitive advantage. Now that more efficient digital solutions have become available, companies can make greater improvements in supply chain performance. Combining digital applications with operational changes helps yield significant performance improvements that transform the supply chain.The Leading Digital Innovation in Supply Chain and Logistics online program from the Institute for Management Development (IMD) will help you identify opportunities to streamline and optimize your business supply chain. Over five weeks, you’ll discover the best way to adapt your organization to new technologies and examine the digital logistics available to support a customer-centric supply chain, from strategic sourcing to production. Guided by Carlos Cordon, Professor of Strategy and Supply Chain Management, you’ll explore efficient supply chain network design operations and how to address changing customer needs. Walk away with a roadmap to digitally transform your supply chain.Is this program for you?This program will appeal to logistics, transport management, warehousing, procurement, and supply chain professionals seeking a better understanding of the opportunities afforded by digital initiatives in this sector. It’s particularly relevant to business professionals in the retail, wholesale, and manufacturing sectors. These roles include, but are not limited to, operations, project management, consultancy, business development, sales, engineering, and entrepreneurship.

The Leading Digital Innovation in Supply Chain and Logistics online program from the Institute for Management Development (IMD) is accredited by the International Supply Chain Education Alliance (ISCEA). ISCEA is the global leader in supply chain education, certification, and recognition programs. By completing this program, participants will receive globally recognized skills in the supply chain occupation, networking opportunities with like-minded individuals, and discounted fees for Certified Professional in Logistics Management (CPLM) certification. For more information on the benefits of taking this ISCEA-accredited program, click here.
Please note that GetSmarter and IMD bear no responsibility for the claiming of these benefits with ISCEA. The onus, therefore, falls on you to do so.
IMD is a triple-accredited academic institution, with the Financial Times ranking it first for its open programs, nine years in a row. IMD attributes its success to its unique “Real Learning. Real Impact” approach. Based in Switzerland and Singapore, IMD is led by expert and diverse faculty who use their insights, tools, and perspectives to prepare participants for the future of business. As an independent academic institution with a global reach, IMD strives to educate ambitious individuals and organizations worldwide.By taking this program, you have the opportunity to accelerate your career with the IMD Digital Excellence Diploma. Customize your learning journey with 15 days of programs that are relevant to your digital needs and pass an exam to earn the diploma. See the programs here, and discover how participants are customizing their diploma.

title: Child Development: Behavior and Mental Health
about: Gain a practical, science-informed approach toward helping children be happier and healthier, with the tools to handle challenging behavior, encourage social connection, and support mental health.
Course overview: Course overview25%The potential increase in future earnings by adults who received early stimulation interventions as infants and toddlers.The World Bank (Mar, 2021).6-10%The estimated percentage of all children who develop serious emotional or personality problems at some point in their development.Britannica (Nd). Accessed June 22, 2021.It’s well known that childhood plays a significant role in the shaping of physically and mentally healthy adults. Positive social, environmental, and behavioral factors can contribute towards a child thriving in later life. However, not all children are the same: each requires a unique approach, and it’s imperative that the role of individual identity development within supportive environments is recognized. Study child psychology from this important perspective in the Child Development: Behavior and Mental Health online short course, designed by child development experts from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE), part of Stanford Medicine. By capitalizing on each child’s personal interests and motivations, you'll learn to create a space that fosters positive interactions and optimal learning. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll look at practical, science-based approaches to encourage a child’s innate learning abilities, and positive behavioral discipline techniques to prevent and address children acting out. You’ll also explore the impact of parenting and grasp the importance of a child’s social connection with adults and peers. Lastly, the course examines the steps you can take to support a child’s mental health, in order to help them develop in a healthy and happy way. Is this course for you?Professionals who engage with children, either in educational or healthcare contexts, will benefit from this practical, science-informed online course. These individuals will gain the techniques and knowledge to better support a child’s development while working in roles within the medical or healthcare industry, such as physicians, pediatric specialists, therapists, and social workers. Those within child-related occupations, including teachers, parents, caregivers, and school counselors, will have the opportunity to study positive child-rearing approaches and key developmental milestones. All learners will walk away with a clear, in-depth understanding of how to support and encourage a child as they develop — socially, emotionally, and physically.

Convenors: {'Dr. Grace Gengoux': ['Clinical Professor, Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences, Stanford University School of Medicine', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdmtKIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--fe1138d726e8d6482ea0d89a1dce1d5cf27dcd93/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/stanford_center_for_health_education_exercise_physiology_course_convenor_gengoux_grace.jpg']}

title: Speaking in Public: Storytelling, Influence, and Presence
about: You have something important to say. Learn how to say it. Become a strong communicator with award-winning journalist and presenter Bruce Whitfield.
Course overview:
Course overview77%The percentage of the population that feels fear and anxiety around public speaking.Verywell Mind (Jul, 2021).An important skill for workplace successStrong and dynamic speakers are in high demand for the many professions that require the ability to engage a group of people. Professionals can leverage this skill to land important roles and leadership positions.The Balance Careers (Aug, 2021).You want to command the room, but when it’s time to speak up, your voice trembles, and picturing everyone naked doesn’t seem to be working. What steps can you take to become a better public speaker while feeling – and appearing – more confident in the spotlight?
Public speaking is part of the storytelling art form that’s been practiced generation after generation. But strong communicators aren’t born. Communicating well is a technical skill that can be learned and mastered. Whether in the boardroom or on a high-stakes public panel, it’s important to be intentional about the way you present yourself. Delivery is everything, especially when you’re competing with digital devices and waning attention spans. But your message should also be worthy of attention. Ultimately, no matter who your audience is, you’re telling a story, and it’s your job to make sure everyone’s listening.
Learn to communicate like a pro with practical insights from an award-winning South African journalist and public speaker, Bruce Whitfield, in the exclusive Speaking in Public: Storytelling, Influence, and Presence online micro course from GetSmarter.
Over two weeks, you’ll discover how to use one of the world’s most underutilized tools for professional advancement: the ability to communicate ideas compellingly. You’ll also gain media-engagement strategies and more broadly applicable communication skills to use in a personal, professional, and public setting.
Is this course for you?Led by expert public speaker Bruce Whitfield and featuring well-known South African business leaders and public speakers, this course teaches students to think on their feet and leverage the art of storytelling to engage audiences. The course content is beneficial to business leaders who are expected to speak publicly about complex, sometimes controversial topics, and founders ready to build a powerful brand through storytelling. Managers who need to represent their companies will learn to communicate clearly and confidently to a wide range of stakeholders. Professionals, specialists, and panelists with big and bold ideas will learn how to effectively express these to a broad audience while working towards improving themselves in a personal and career-enhancing capacity. In addition, existing public speakers will learn new presentation techniques and tools so that they can get and stay ahead in their industry.
Course curriculum: {'Module 1 Telling stories with impact and confidence': 'Learn how to communicate in a way that is relatable and memorable, and appeals to a specific audience.', 'Module 2 Communicate like a pro: Be good, be brief, be gone': 'Define the purpose of your message and learn how to leverage communication for career advancement.'}
What will set you apart: ['The ability to translate complex ideas into authentic, engaging presentations.', 'Impactful, influential, and memorable communication skills that can be tailored to any audience.', 'The ability to pitch yourself and your ideas to build your professional profile and promote your personal brand.', 'Valuable, career-enhancing feedback on your communication style that you can use to become more persuasive.', '', 'Engage with your online course material', 'Interact with your peers and learning facilitators through class-wide forums and live sessions', 'Enjoy a wide range of engaging and interactive components, including videos, podcasts, activities, and resources', 'Receive tips for practical application in your career', 'Apply what you learn throughout this online experience and develop the skills to communicate ideas compellingly.']
About the certificate: Validate your skills online with an official digital badge from GetSmarter.

title: Customer Experience Innovation Online Short Course
about: Develop the skills and frameworks needed to drive innovative customer experience and deliver measurable business success.
Course overview:
Course overview75%The proportion of businesses able to show that customer satisfaction increases lifetime value and drives revenue growth.Gartner (Jan, 2020).Engagement drives revenueDigital engagement is a powerful revenue driver and is proven to create future sales opportunities.Spiegel Research Centre (Jan, 2019).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)The Customer Experience Innovation online short course from Medill at Northwestern University is designed to expand your understanding of what drives positive customer interactions, allowing you to explore why these interactions are crucial in the current business landscape and to reveal how they can be shaped through dynamic marketing. This course will help you create highly relevant and personalized engagement at each point in the customer journey.Over the course of six weeks, you will have the opportunity to use the 5Cs framework (Content, Context, Calibration, Conversion and Collaboration) under the guidance of faculty who developed it. You will explore marketing technology (MarTech) and learn how to leverage it, along with analyzing data, to more efficiently and effectively acquire, retain and expand client relationships. On completion of this course, you will have the ability to align a MarTech strategy with your organization’s business objectives and a customer experience (CX) tool kit to create measurable business growth.Is this CX course for you?This online short course is for any professional who recognizes the importance of turning positive customer experiences into repeat clients who act as brand ambassadors and support business success. If you have existing marketing experience, you will have the opportunity to hone and expand your current capabilities, while exploring the MarTech innovations that shape CX. Industry leaders and senior executives will familiarize themselves with best practices in order to guide their teams and identify realistic opportunities for MarTech implementation. Business leaders and entrepreneurs will develop a functional understanding of how to create a better CX journey to drive the success of their organization.
The importance of customer experience innovationCustomer experience is the new battleground for leading companies. In a world where customers are more connected and empowered than ever before, customer experience innovation has become the key differentiator for companies across industries.
The innovation of customer experience requires a strong understanding of customer needs, preferences and behaviors. This means that customer experience training must be carefully planned and thoughtfully implemented to deliver meaningful results. Through customer experience innovation, organizations can create stronger customer connections, drive higher levels of customer loyalty and ultimately generate greater revenue growth over time.
Create an innovative customer experience strategyTo create an innovative customer experience strategy, businesses need to understand what drives customer engagement and how to use customer data to create relevant, personalized interactions. Marketing technology plays a crucial role in this process, as it provides the tools and data needed to create targeted customer experiences.
Develop a strategic journey for customersCreating a dynamic customer journey is essential to achieving customer satisfaction. Through this customer experience course, you'll learn how to understand a customer's needs and wants. Businesses can create a customer journey that meets those needs and wants at every touchpoint. CX professionals, consultants and working professionals looking to gain the skills and knowledge needed to create innovative customer experiences can do so through this Customer Experience Innovation online short course from Medill at Northwestern University.
What is meant by customer satisfaction?Customer satisfaction refers to the level of fulfillment that a customer experiences when using a product or service. It can be measured through surveys, ratings and other forms of feedback, and is often seen as an indicator of overall customer experience quality. Factors such as product performance, reliability, responsiveness and ease of use are all examples.

title: Leading Through Crisis
about: Change your mindset and develop an effective intellectual tool kit to better prepare for, respond to, and learn from major global crises.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview:
Program overview79%Global board members who feel that their organization is not well-prepared to deal with a crisis event. EY (Apr, 2020).69%Business leaders who have experienced a crisis within the last five years.PwC (2019).These are turbulent times. From political shocks, to growing concerns over the economy and climate, to the earth-shattering impact of COVID-19, the past half-decade has played host to uncertainty on an unparalleled scale. Despite this, research suggests that more than two-thirds of executives feel that their organization is not well-prepared to deal with a crisis event.1
Change the way you think about crises on the Leading Through Crisis online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education. Over seven weeks, you’ll gain an intellectual tool kit for understanding, preparing for, and responding to major events. Analyzing a diverse range of crisis responses with relevance between sectors, you’ll gain a better understanding of what successful leadership and communication entails in the face of catastrophe. Develop your capacity to prepare for unforeseen events with world-class guidance from Program Convener Jeffrey E Garten and leading international industry experts, and walk away with an enhanced perspective as part of a network of global professionals.*
*Upon successful completion of your program, you’ll gain access to the exclusive Yale School of Management Executive Education group on LinkedIn.
1 EY (Apr, 2020).
Is this program for you?This program is designed for any professional interested in handling a crisis effectively, whether it be a minor ruction within their team, a large organizational issue, or a major catastrophe on an international scale. Those who already work within crisis response, such as consultants and risk analysts, emergency and security management specialists, and directors of risk management will find useful frameworks for enhancing their current role performance and enabling future growth. Business leaders such as HR, PR, and health and safety managers, senior managers, and C-suite executives will also benefit from world-class insights to better prepare their organizations for future crises. All program participants will unlock key learnings that are applicable across industries, including the private and public or non-profit spheres.

', 'Real-world case studies from multiple countries to unpack universal concepts and their common applications across and between sectors.', 'Unlimited access to both the exclusive Yale School of Management Executive Education Community group on LinkedIn and 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']

title: Business Sustainability Strategy: Technology and Management
about: Develop a strategy for driving positive change and sustainable business practices as you learn to navigate complex sustainability issues.
Course overview: Course overview70%The percentage of targets underpinning the UN Sustainable Development Goals that could be enabled by existing Fourth Industrial Revolution technology innovations.World Economic Forum (Jan, 2020).$12 trillionThe estimated rewards for investors and businesses who invest in the UN Sustainable Development Goals.PwC (Apr, 2019).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)With an increasing number of environmental regulations and concerns from consumers and stakeholders, the topic of sustainability has moved to the forefront of business endeavors. Yet, despite the demand for greater accountability, organizations still need to remain profitable. In order to have a sustainable future, leaders need to learn to address these inherent challenges.The Business Sustainability Strategy: Technology and Management online short course explores the process of successfully navigating the trade-offs and tensions between sustainability and profitability. Guided by the MIT Sloan School of Management faculty and a host of guest experts, you’ll learn to pursue sustainability through innovation and behavioral change. Using the PROMISE framework as a lens to holistically examine business choices and sustainability goals, you’ll analyze some of the most prominent sustainability concerns facing modern companies today. You’ll engage in a range of diverse topics, including climate change, dematerialization, and the main types of market failures. After six weeks, you’ll walk away with a strategy for engaging others in developing sustainable business practices, with the skills and knowledge to drive long-lasting change within and beyond your organization.Is this course for you?This six-week program offers business decision makers and strategy drivers the skills to drive sustainability management and leadership in their organizations. Professionals who are responsible for moving their businesses forward will gain the skills to oversee sustainability initiatives and ensure ethical business practices meet organizational goals. Those involved in the day-to-day operations of their organization who hope to move into a leadership position will gain the knowledge required to drive new strategies or company-wide policies. Additionally, professionals with environmental knowledge will have the opportunity to align their practice with the business world and learn to promote the value of sustainability in the marketplace.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'World challenges: Environment, inequality, poverty, and social well-being', 'Module 2': 'The standard playbook: Managing for sustainability', 'Module 3': 'The PROMISE framework: Tensions, trade-offs, and impact', 'Module 4': 'Next-generation strategies for sustainability: Technology and innovation', 'Module 5': 'Market failures and institutions: Changing the rules of the game', 'Module 6': 'Management for the 21st century: Agents of change'}
Convenors: {'Roberto Rigobon': ['Society of Sloan Fellows Professor of Management and Professor of Applied Economics, MIT Sloan School of Management', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBLUT09IiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--1161bec472cd81b12c2d189ffdde9c2dbc31f6f2/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/mit_sloan_economics_for_business_course_convenor_roberto_rigobon.jpg'], 'Jason Jay': ['Jason Jay', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdWNMIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--35f7b3c0921c608ce29eb9283151960af5e5c073/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/mit_sloan_business_sustainability_strategy_course_convenor_jason_jay.jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['The skills to navigate complex sustainability issues, with insight from the holistic PROMISE framework that examines the impact of sustainability goals and choices.', 'A strategy for engaging stakeholders in sustainability challenges and motivating for positive, long-lasting change in your organization.', 'Insights from MIT faculty and guest experts on sustainability challenges within businesses, and an understanding of how technology can drive sustainability solutions. ', 'The ability to navigate the tension between implementing business sustainability initiatives and increasing financial performance.', '']
About the certificate:
Learn how to implement sustainability strategies within your organization and earn an official digital certificate of completion from MIT Sloan.
This program also counts toward an MIT Sloan Executive Certificate, which you can earn upon completion of four programs where at least three of the four come from your chosen certificate track and at least one is completed in person. Find full details here.

title: Organizational Leadership: Driving Culture and Performance
about: Develop an adaptive approach to leadership to create a work environment that supports and drives employee performance.
Course overview:
Course overview1 in 3Only a third of CEOs believe that their organization’s frontline leadership is of a very good quality.DDI (2021).85%The proportion of employees who feel their well-being has declined due to high-pressure work conditions, with more than half feeling that job demands have increased.Deloitte (Jul, 2021).Duration: 5 weeks (excluding orientation)Traditional models of leadership tend to focus on how leaders should behave, assuming that these behaviors and tasks will lead to high performance and success, regardless of context. In a simple and stable environment, this approach may be effective, but today’s business world is far from simple or stable. As the corporate landscape becomes more changeable and complex — with multicultural teams, hybrid working, competitive markets, faster product cycles, digitalization and AI — there is an urgent need for organizations and their leaders to become more agile and flexible in how they respond. They should pay attention to the context in which they operate, be ready to deploy a range of leadership approaches, and adapt as their business landscape changes.Based on years of research by the Program Directors, the Organizational Leadership: Driving Culture and Performance online program from the Institute for Management Development (IMD) is designed to enhance your impact as a leader. It explains how you can achieve this impact by improving and adapting the workplace environments you create for your business and teams. You’ll be introduced to, and have the opportunity to create a Leadership Operating System (OS) built on the foundations of trust, clarity, and momentum. Over five weeks, you’ll explore the elements of the Leadership OS and discover how to use it to motivate people and set the tone for organizational culture and performance. Walk away with your tailored Leadership OS action plan, ready to implement immediate changes in your own business.Is this program for you?This program is aimed at leaders who want to prepare for, and become more effective in, directing and supporting others to achieve objectives. It would benefit anyone who manages people — regardless of industry or company size — who wants to help foster a better working environment, and a more resilient organization. Mid- to senior-level leaders will gain a new approach to maximize their impact on individuals, teams, and, in turn, overall performance. HR specialists, strategists, consultants, and aspiring leaders will learn how to prepare for the challenges of a more globalized, uncertain, and complex business landscape. This program is for all managers and executives who would like to enhance productivity, motivation, and innovation in a disrupted business world.
IMD is a triple-accredited academic institution, with the Financial Times ranking it first for its open programs, nine years in a row. IMD attributes its success to its unique “Real Learning. Real Impact” approach. Based in Switzerland and Singapore, IMD is led by expert and diverse faculty who use their insights, tools, and perspectives to prepare participants for the future of business. As an independent academic institution with a global reach, IMD strives to educate ambitious individuals and organizations worldwide.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'The Leadership Operating System', 'Module 2': 'Building trust', 'Module 3': 'Creating clarity', 'Module 4': 'Generating momentum', 'Module 5': 'Making it happen: Leaving your leadership imprint'}

In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the program handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the program.Successful completion of this online program counts towards your IMD alumni status. Find out more.

title: Agile Project Management
about: Explore the principles of the Agile approach, and discover strategies to continuously improve products, processes, and teams.
Course overview:
Course overview61%The proportion of companies surveyed that reported an increase in team productivity after adopting Agile practices.State of Agile (May, 2019). 53%The average percentage of projects run by high-performing companies that use Agile or hybrid approaches.PMI Pulse of the Profession (2018).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)More and more, organisations are adopting an Agile Project Management strategy that prioritises frequent reassessment and adaptation of plans, in order to improve project efficiency and respond to the dynamic complexities of modern business. Accordingly, it can be hugely beneficial for project management practitioners to have a firm grasp of the core principles, values, and methods of this approach.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Agile Project Management online short course aims to equip you with the knowledge and practical tools you need to function effectively in Agile business environments. You’ll gain skills applicable to your current role, and learn to develop an Agile Project Management framework, including appropriate implementation methods, an adaptive plan, and a risk-monitoring strategy.Is this course for you?
This course is suited to working professionals who want to harness the benefits of the Agile approach to enhance project efficiency and adaptability. It is ideal for existing project managers who are eager to develop relevant skills and acquire up-to-date knowledge that will help them perform optimally in current and future roles. Similarly, it may be beneficial for managers seeking to understand the business contexts that are best suited to the Agile methodology. While there are no formal prerequisites for this course, some knowledge of, or prior experience in project management is recommended.

GetSmarter is approved by the Project Management Institute (PMI®) as an Authorized Training Partner (ATP), a partnership that enables you to join the world’s largest project management network. This Agile Project Management online short course will count for 68.50 PDUs in total, and the division of hours is as follows: Technical - 33.25, Leadership - 9.25, Strategic - 26.00.
PMI is responsible for setting project management standards and providing certification. By taking this course, you’ll gain PMI-endorsed skills that are globally recognised. You can also use these learning hours towards furthering your professional project management development. See PMI.org for more information.
Please note that GetSmarter and UCT bear no responsibility for the reporting of these PDUs and/or hours to the PMI. The onus, therefore, falls on you to do so.
The PMI® Authorized Training Partner seal is a mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.

title: AI-Driven Digital Marketing
about: Deliver a higher ROI using AI-driven digital marketing strategies tailored to your business and customer needs.
Course overview: Course overview84 percentThe proportion of customers who believe that personalized engagement across multiple channels is just as vital to brand perception as a company’s products and services.Salesforce (2020).50 percentThe percentage of organizations that are increasing their AI and ML usage to improve customer experiences, automate processes and generate customer intelligence in 2020.Algorithmia (2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Artificial intelligence (AI) is fast becoming a core capability in customer experience improvement and process automation. Traditionally, marketing professionals focused on project execution and post-campaign performance analyses to gain insights. But today’s digital marketer can generate relevant, real-time engagement using AI-driven customer insights and proactive audience targeting. In this new environment, marketers must embrace innovation to respond to novel challenges while leveraging advanced analytics to understand customers better and enhance decision-making.The six-week AI-Driven Digital Marketing online short course from Medill at Northwestern University investigates the development of AI and its growing applications in digital marketing. Led by expert faculty, you will explore ways to enrich the customer journey using personalized content marketing initiatives driven by advanced consumer insights. Throughout the course, you will assess how your organization should respond to AI innovation in marketing, culminating in the development of an AI-driven digital marketing strategy.Is this course for you?This online short course is designed for professionals looking to improve their organizations’ digital marketing strategies by integrating AI solutions. Those in both technical and functional leadership roles, regardless of marketing duties, will benefit from a balanced overview of AI’s ability to improve the customer experience. IT, product and project managers leading operational and strategic initiatives will learn to articulate how AI-driven insights align customer needs with organizational goals. Marketing professionals interested in future role growth and improving their current role performance will learn from industry experts and validate their skills with a certificate of completion from Northwestern Medill.

title: Oxford Executive Strategy Programme
about: Strengthen your organisational strategy by developing the skills to lead your business through complexity.
University name: Saïd Business School, University of Oxford
Course overview:
Programme overview58%The percentage of chief strategy officers who believe that strategy played a critical role in accelerating digital transformation during the COVID-19 pandemic.Deloitte (Nd.) Accessed Apr, 2021.30%Less than a third of strategists believe that their execution efforts are effectively aligned with strategy.Gartner (2020).
Duration: 7 weeks (excluding orientation)
As the business environment becomes increasingly uncertain, it’s apparent that traditional approaches to strategy are no longer sufficient to navigate such rapid change. Leaders now need to ask, “How should strategy evolve to better prepare us for the future?” The Oxford Executive Strategy Programme seeks to answer this question.
Informed by the distinct research strengths of Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, the programme unpacks how strategy is changing and how breadth within strategic thinking, in addition to thinking long-term, is imperative to leading strategy. You’ll learn about strategy from Oxford’s unique perspective, based on a core framework of the four Ps: purposes, players, partnerships, and processes. With this new approach to organisational strategy that considers rapidly changing environments, stakeholders, and digital transformation, you’ll become prepared to lead strategy in disruptive environments.
The content of this programme also forms part of the six-month online Oxford Strategic Management Executive Programme, designed to help you advance as a business executive.
Is this programme for you?This online programme is relevant to business leaders and senior executives who are responsible for making strategic decisions, driving digital innovation, and managing strategy within disruptive environments. Those looking to optimise their current performance for a competitive and digital business landscape will be able to immediately apply the Oxford approach to strategy within their own context. Professionals working towards a future leadership role or career will gain practical guidance on improving strategies within their teams. Over the course of seven weeks online, the programme balances theory with practical global case studies from various industries, ensuring those in traditional corporate spaces, finance, business development, healthcare, and IT find relevance within their own organisational context.


This Oxford Executive Strategy Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 70 hours of learning.
Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Healthcare Leadership
about: Gain the practical tools to effectively lead innovative improvements in your healthcare setting.
Course overview:
Course overview52%The percentage of healthcare leaders who named physician and leader alignment as their top investment priority.Huron (2020).Leading employeesHealthcare professionals ranked the ability to lead people as the most important leadership skill for success in healthcare organizations.Center for Creative Leadership (Feb, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
Due to the rapidly evolving and complex nature of healthcare organizations, it’s crucial that they’re run effectively to positively influence how patients receive medical care. To be successful in this industry, healthcare professionals need to develop their leadership capacity and ability to adapt, respond to, and lead change.
The Healthcare Leadership online short course from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE) provides you with the leadership knowledge and skills to foster meaningful, long-term positive change in your healthcare setting. Over eight weeks, you’ll use practical tools to identify growth areas in healthcare systems and gain the ability to lead healthcare change initiatives. Guided by experts, you’ll develop effective strategies to maximize team performance, and discover how to harness the power of vulnerability to build trust and collaboration.
Throughout the course, you’ll engage with various systems improvement frameworks, learn to effectively manage and overcome a crisis, and improve your ability to make leadership decisions in high-pressure situations. Finally, you’ll explore the power of storytelling to achieve the full potential of yourself, your teams and your organization, and create an impactful narrative for change.
Is this course for you?
This course is suited to professionals who work in the healthcare sector and are looking to improve their capacity for leadership. Medical professionals will benefit from learning effective approaches for leading healthcare teams and organizations. This course is also designed for non-medical professionals who require the skills to effectively respond to changes and new demands in the healthcare sector. Experienced business leaders can also take advantage of this course by developing their ability to foster efficient healthcare systems and navigate complex problems.

title: Data Monetization Strategy: Creating Value Through Data
about: Incorporate data monetization into your business strategy and compete in a digital economy.
Course overview:
Course overview$4.8 billionThe projected growth of the global data monetization market by 2027.ReportLinker (Jul, 2020).2.5Top-performing companies in data monetization drive greater monetization outcomes by a factor of 2.5 as compared to bottom performers. MIT CISR and AlixPartners (Jul, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Data, and the value it supplies, has become an invaluable business asset in today’s digital economy. Data monetization — converting data and analytics into financial gain — is now a crucial source of economic value for organizations across the globe.1
Explore how your organization can realize the full and future value of its data assets in the Data Monetization Strategy: Creating Value Through Data online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management. Guided by renowned Faculty Director Dr. Barbara Wixom, you’ll learn to identify opportunities to create value from data to generate financial returns, drive process improvements, and leverage data-based insights to enrich products. In six weeks, you’ll gain a comprehensive understanding of data monetization using CISR-developed frameworks to empower you and your teams to strategically maximize value creation through data.
1MIT CISR (Nov, 2019).
Is this course for you?The growing importance of data as a primary driver of business strategy, requires that data-driven business leaders elevate data and analytics strategies to advance a new vision of business problem-solving. This course is relevant to data-driven business leaders and analytics leaders intent on creating economic value from organizational data. People in these roles may include, but are not limited to, chief data officers, chief information officers, chief technology officers, and chief analytics officers. Technology, data, and information managers, not to mention non-tech leaders and business directors, will elevate any existing knowledge and benefit from the practical frameworks unpacked in the course.

', 'A comprehensive understanding of how to monetize data and the associated opportunities and challenges of data-based value creation. ', 'A chosen data monetization strategy to help your company optimize current and future value creation from its data assets.', '', '']

Demystify the concept of data monetization and earn an official digital certificate of completion from MIT Sloan.
This program also counts toward an MIT Sloan Executive Certificate, which you can earn upon completion of four programs where at least three of the four come from your chosen certificate track and at least one is completed in person. Find full details here.

title: Artificial Intelligence in Health Care online short course
about: Discover how machine learning and artificial intelligence can be deployed in the health care industry to overcome challenges and optimize processes.
Course overview:
Course overview40%The combined percentage of surveyed health care organizations that are in some way focused on increasing their proportion of AI-assisted applications.Accenture (Jan, 2019).$6.6 billionThe projected value of the AI health care market by 2021.Business News Daily (Jun, 2019).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Improving prediction is one of the key challenges the medical industry faces in advancing patient care. Enhancing diagnosis, individualizing treatments, and understanding disease progression are all matters of prediction, an area where machine learning (ML) and  artificial intelligence (AI) excels.1
Discover the impact AI innovations can have in medicine — on both traditional health care systems and decision-making approaches — with the Artificial Intelligence in Health Care online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management and the MIT J-Clinic. Through industry case studies, you’ll better understand AI’s applications and limitations, examine the challenges AI can help overcome, and explore how it’s already been successfully deployed in the sector.
You’ll gain insight and knowledge from MIT, an institution renowned for developing ML methods with applications in health care. Regina Barzilay, your Faculty Director, is also globally recognized for her work in AI and breast cancer detection.1MIT Technology Review (Apr, 2019).Is this course for you?Whether you work in business or medicine, this course will give you an understanding of the transformative role that artificial intelligence and machine learning can play in the health care industry. Health care professionals will benefit from an understanding of the types of problems that AI technology and techniques can help solve. This program covers key topics such as the basics of ML, neural networks, and deep learning. The knowledge gained throughout this course can be immediately and directly applied to roles within the health care sector.
Machine learning
ML is a field of artificial intelligence that uses algorithms to learn from and make predictions on data. This course will introduce you to machine learning algorithms and how they are used in the health care industry.
Neural networks
The MIT Sloan Artificial Intelligence in Health Care online course provides insights into the different types of neural networks and how they can be applied to health care data. Neural networks are a type of machine learning algorithm that are particularly well suited for tasks such as image recognition and classification.
Deep learning
Additionally, the AI in health care course will cover the basics of deep learning. Deep learning is the process of using artificial neural networks with many layers to learn complex patterns in data. It is a subfield of machine learning that is concerned with algorithms that learn from data that is unstructured or unlabelled. This course will introduce you to deep learning methods and how they are used in the health care industry.
Computer science professionals
The course is taught by computer science experts from MIT and the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL). CSAIL is one of the world’s leading centers for artificial intelligence research. The faculty members teaching this course are at the forefront of their field and are developing cutting-edge technology that is being used in multiple industries today.

']
About the certificate:
Realize the potential of AI and ML in health care, and earn an official digital certificate of completion from MIT Sloan School of Management.
This program also counts toward an MIT Sloan Executive Certificate, which you can earn by completing four programs; three from your chosen certificate track and one completed in person. Find out more.

title: Corporate Innovation: Strategies for Leveraging Ecosystems
about: Develop a culture of innovation and engage with stakeholders to mobilize opportunities for change.
Course overview: Course overview38%The percentage of surveyed digitally mature organizations who believe that innovating faster during the COVID-19 pandemic had a large positive impact on their business.Deloitte (Apr, 2021).50%The percentage of revenue generated from new products and services developed through innovation.Forrester / Atlassian (Jul, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Innovation is imperative in the fast-paced landscape of contemporary business. Forward-thinking managers understand that a strategy for innovation must be an integral part of an organization’s primary operation in order to remain competitive.This online course offers a unique iEcosystem framework, designed by MIT faculty, to help companies align internal and external processes, leverage key stakeholders, embrace technology and overcome business challenges through disruptive innovation. Gain access to this framework, along with a range of cutting-edge concepts and tools, enabling you to foster a culture of sustainable innovation in your organization.Is this course for you?This online course in innovation management is designed for decision-makers who want to improve their organization’s capacity to formulate and implement innovative strategies, as well as entrepreneurs and business leaders launching new offerings. By exploring the key levers of innovation, it’ll offer you the tools to remove barriers and effectively drive change in your business. Whether you’re an executive, consultant, business strategist, or simply a professional with innovative ideas, this course could help you.

title: Business Systems Analysis Online Short Course
about: Create business change by improving management’s understanding of technical solutions, and developing your IT team’s awareness of organisational goals.
Course overview:
Course overviewTop 15Systems analysis and evaluation is one of the top 15 skills expected to grow in prominence by 2025.World Economic Forum (Oct, 2020).33%The projected percentage of large organisations that will have analysts using decision intelligence by 2023.Gartner (Oct, 2020).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)
In today’s fast-paced world, businesses that fail to leverage technology and adapt to changing conditions are less likely to reach their objectives. This has led to a greater demand for professionals who can identify the need for change and facilitate the design and implementation of process solutions. Additionally, business systems analysts play a vital role in bridging IT and leadership teams by guiding management toward understanding technical solutions, and equipping IT professionals to identify organisational goals.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Business Systems Analysis online short course explores how a variety of business systems analysis theories can be used to examine existing processes and implement change in a practical, effective way. Gain the skills to leverage IT business systems and technological tools as an analyst, and impact your organisation’s overall success and efficiency. Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll learn the fundamentals of business systems analysis, identify system requirements, and translate these into project specifications and user-friendly solutions that support the strategic objectives of a business.
Is this course for you?This course is suitable for individuals who are new to business systems analysis as well as experienced employees who would like to formalise their expertise and keep their skills current in a competitive environment. Established IT professionals and business systems analysts will be able to sharpen their tool kit and earn a certificate of completion online from Africa’s leading university.1 Additionally, those individuals who are outside of the field but eager to leverage technical and business-oriented strategies to transform the way their company operates will find this course especially valuable.
Through this course, professionals can enable career development by building practical techniques such as data modelling to design IT systems, data analysis to understand vital trends, and stakeholder communication to align and achieve business objectives. There are no formal prerequisites for this course, and the flexible online learning framework ensures that students are adequately supported to complete their studies on a part-time basis.
1QS Top Universities (Apr, 2021).

GetSmarter is endorsed by the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) as an Endorsed Education Provider. The IIBA is dedicated to the development, maintenance of standards, certification, and recognition of practitioners in business analysis. The Business Systems Analysis course is fully aligned with the Guide to the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge® (BABOK® Guide) and offers participants Continuing Development Units (CDUs), qualifying for 40 Professional Development (PD) hours and Continuing Development Units (CDUs), as well contemporary skills and latest industry insight. See here for further information.
Please note that GetSmarter and UCT bear no responsibility for the reporting of these PD hours and/or CDUs to the IIBA. The onus therefore falls on you to do so.

title: Economic and Political Development in Developing Countries
about: Why have some developing countries become rich while others have stayed poor? Understand this form of inequality from a multidisciplinary perspective, and gain the skills to promote inclusive development across states, markets, and civil society.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overviewIncome inequality on the riseThe average income gap between the top 10% and bottom 50% of individuals within countries has nearly doubled over the past two decades.World Inequality Database (Dec, 2021).Economic inequality fuels the climate crisisGlobal inequalities aren’t only a rich versus poor country problem, it’s a high emitters versus low emitters issue in all countries. The redistribution of income and wealth is needed to effectively accelerate efforts to tackle climate change.World Inequality Database (Dec, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
Inequalities in developing countries are at a 30-year peak and climbing due to the COVID-19 pandemic.1 These and other global struggles – such as the climate crisis and political polarisation – have led to worldwide consensus for a more inclusive and sustainable development model that promotes high living standards for all. As a result, there’s a wealth of opportunity for accelerated growth in emerging markets. But to drive lasting progress, leaders and practitioners in the public, private, and social sectors require a holistic understanding of the complex and vast factors that determine the development of the Global South.
Emerging markets are diverse and therefore defy a uniform narrative. This is why the  Economic and Political Development in Developing Countries online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) takes a socioeconomic and political approach to various issues relevant to growth. Guided by esteemed faculty from LSE’s Department of International Development, you’ll leverage unique insights and real-world case studies to make more informed decisions about policies and projects in the emerging markets. By the end of this impactful six-week course, you’ll gain a practical toolkit to improve governance, make private and public organisations more effective, solve collective action issues, and increase accountability across the board.
1 OECD, (Nd.) Accessed 23 February 2022.Is this course for you?This course will appeal to practitioners in the public, private, and social sectors with an interest in promoting equitable growth in emerging countries. It’s equally valuable to those working at the interface between emerging and advanced markets who would like a practical, holistic understanding of the development process. Guided by LSE faculty, the course is designed to inform decision-making regarding policies and projects in emerging markets. As a result, it will also benefit NGO employees, civil servants with investment imperatives, agency and bilateral agency staff, and private sector executives with existing operations or expansion opportunities in developing countries. Lastly, decision-makers at major multinational firms will critically engage with expert insights to enhance their business practices and inform financial decisions.This Economic and Political Development in Developing Countries online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 50 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Women's Leadership Program: Leading With Power and Influence
about: Effectively harness your unique sources of power to become a positively energizing woman leader and changemaker.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview:
Program overview$1.4 millionThe amount that women leaders save their organizations for every 1,000 employees by driving greater engagement.Potential Project (Mar, 2022).61%The share of women managers that consistently check on employee well-being (7% more than their male counterparts), while 31% provide emotional support (compared with 19% of men), and 21% take action to curb burnout (versus 16% of men).McKinsey (2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
For years, power in the workplace has been associated with traits such as persuasion, charisma, and outward displays of authority and strength. This has caused some women leaders to disidentify with power as a concept, even undermining their own progression. However, as traditional productivity metrics become unsustainable in the face of growing burnout and disengagement, a new leadership approach focusing on well-being, purpose, and belonging is needed. Communication, empathy, authenticity, and honesty hold more value than ever before.    The Women’s Leadership Program: Leading With Power and Influence from the Yale School of Management Executive Education equips you to become the positively energizing leader to drive change. Over the course of six weeks online, you’ll discover a broader definition of power as a buildable skill set that incorporates both strong and empathic traits and can shift depending on context. You’ll explore existing power structures and dynamics in organizations, and uncover how a growth mindset can help you influence others and effect positive change in your sphere of influence. Guided by experts, you’ll also discover key strategies that can help you use everyday junctures for power and change, and enhance your ability to cultivate positive relational energy to promote organizational success. Walk away with the tools and knowledge to effectively harness your unique power as a woman leader, and an official certificate of participation from a world-leading business school.1
1Yale SOM (Mar, 2021).Yale SOM Executive Education offers multiple online, on-campus, and live-online women's leadership programs. This program is a natural continuation of the online and on-campus versions of the Women’s Leadership Program and the online Women’s Leadership Program: Leading Teams. Each can be taken independently, as a stand alone program, but they also build on each other to offer a holistic approach to leadership. View all Yale SOM programs for women and those who support them here. 
Is this program for you?This program will benefit women leaders, including those in the C-suite and entrepreneurs or owners seeking to generate long-term success. Mid- and senior-level women managers will have the opportunity to build their skill sets and networks to advance in their careers, and professionals such as product or project managers, analysts, and consultants will gain the tools to become highly effective and energizing leaders. Professionals from across sectors, such as business development, media and marketing, finance, education, and the public sector will find great value in the program’s insights. While the program is primarily aimed at women, it will also be of relevance to all who want to understand structures of power and support positive change.
