title: Rotman Women in Leadership
about: Overcome the internalized barriers to your success as a woman in the workplace and embark on a journey of reflection.
Course overview: Course overviewGet financial aidThe Ontario Student Assistance Program (OSAP) offers funding to qualifying Canadian citizens.Rotman Financial Assistance (2022).29%The percentage of women who are in senior management positions within North America.Catalyst (Aug, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Societal and cultural beliefs have long dictated a woman’s opportunities in the workplace. Although the conversation around women in leadership has increased in recent years, women continue to use male-normed management theories, and face unique challenges once in positions of power.The purpose of the Women in Leadership online program is to reveal and address these systemic barriers and empower women within business. Developed by the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto, this six-week program delves into the historical and cultural constructs that have shaped belief systems of what it means to be a woman in the workplace. You’ll gain development tools and communication skills to overcome barriers to success, and be exposed to a global and diverse cohort of fellow women leaders. The program analyzes the impact of gender stereotypes and focuses on building your leadership presence through non-verbal cues and emotional intelligence. You’ll learn to overcome inner obstacles such as imposter syndrome and understand how an inner dialogue is produced and harnessed. Upon completion of the program, you’ll have your own leadership plan, based on your personal goals and leadership vision. Is this program for you?This program is applicable to women across industries, in business and government. It holds particular value to women who are currently in leadership and management positions, but will also benefit those who aspire to move into these roles. Women executives and managers will gain the opportunity to elevate their leadership skills, presence, and effectiveness. Aspiring leaders will have the chance to develop their leadership skills and take the next step in their career journey. Women who are looking to empower other women will gain more insight into gender inclusivity and how it’s fostered in the workplace, and become more aware of internalized workplace challenges. While the program is designed for those who identify as women and non-binary professionals, those who identify as male are welcome as well.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Women in the workplace', 'Module 2': 'Reflect on your own motivations and wants', 'Module 3': 'Overcoming inner obstacles to success', 'Module 4': 'Develop your leadership presence', 'Module 5': 'Communication and conflict management', 'Module 6': 'Craft a personal leadership vision'}

', 'A leadership plan for your future that’s designed to achieve your personal goals and leadership vision.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']

title: Chief Technology Officer Program
about: Develop the leadership skills and business acumen to drive transformation and shape organizational strategy.
Course overview:
Program overview83%The percentage of executives who believe that their company’s business and technology strategies are becoming inseparable.Accenture (2021).29%The proportion of CTOs who report that they expect their next role to be a CEO.IBM (Dec, 2021).Duration: 5 weeks (excluding orientation)As technology continues to infiltrate every business function, chief technology officers (CTOs) have started to play an increasingly influential role in organizations and the way they function. As a result, these executives now need more than technical expertise. They require the organizational knowledge and soft skills to participate in business discussions, drive decision-making, and reimagine enterprise strategy alongside other C-suite leaders.
Gain the business acumen, innovation techniques, and the leadership capabilities to guide a company through significant change in the Chief Technology Officer Program from IE University, one of Europe’s leading higher-education institutions.1 Over the course of five weeks online, you’ll examine the CTO’s role in enabling effective digital transformation, managing cultural shifts, and shaping business strategy. Guided by Professor Manuel López Martín de Blas, you’ll learn how to put different lean implementation methodologies into practice, and explore sourcing and recruitment strategies for IT transformation. Finally, you’ll look into the latest technology trends and ways to scout and select the right innovations to advance business outcomes.
1 IE University (2021).
Is this program for you?Both current and aspiring technology leaders looking to broaden their skill set and play a more active role in business strategy will find this online program beneficial. CTOs, chief information officers, chief data officers, IT directors, and heads of technology can profit by building organizational awareness and gaining innovation tactics to excel in their executive roles and meet new business needs. The program will also support the professional growth of technical and IT professionals who want to unlock opportunities for promotion into a leadership role. In addition, technology entrepreneurs, founders, and start-up owners can draw on the content to improve business outcomes, and will benefit from the flexible, yet supported, nature of the online learning experience.

title: Graphic Design Online Short Course
about: Develop the creative, technical, and business skills needed to launch your career in graphic design.
Course overview:
Course overview39%The percentage of designers who choose personal flexibility and freedom as the main reasons for working as freelancers.99designs (2020).68%The proportion of marketers who say visuals are very important in their marketing strategies.Venngage (Mar, 2020).Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)
Most organisations will, at some point, require the skills of a graphic designer. Professionals in this field play an integral role in enhancing a brand’s visual presence, and are highly valued for their ability to convey meaning through visual elements.
This Graphic Design online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will provide you with the technical skills and creative knowledge needed to make a start in this profession. Guided by a media expert, you’ll develop a basic understanding of how to use Adobe Illustrator,* learn to work with digital images, and explore how to choose effective typefaces to create compelling content for both print and web platforms. As you gain design knowledge and proficiency in the relevant software, you’ll also learn more about the business of graphic design and how to create a professional portfolio.
*GetSmarter won’t provide the software needed for this course; you’ll be responsible for ensuring you have access to it.
Is this course for you?This course is aimed at anyone considering graphic design as a new career opportunity. The content offers an introduction to the subject matter, and aims to equip students with a strong foundation in visual communications. Those looking to refresh existing graphic design knowledge may also find this course beneficial. There are no formal prerequisites for registration.

title: Regulation Strategy
about: Gain the insight to understand and effectively navigate regulation in your industry, and beyond.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview: Course overviewRegulators announce data initiatives“Over the next five years, the Financial Conduct Authority’s (FCA) wide-ranging Data Strategy is intended to enable the regulator to improve its understanding and leverage of data and innovative technology, and to reduce the future burden on firms.”KPMG (2020).$29.2 billionThe value of the global governance, risk, and compliance market in 2020.Research and Markets (Apr, 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Regulation can have a significant impact on the way organisations function, which is why decision makers must have a sound understanding of the evolving regulatory environment and the role it plays in their industry.The Regulation Strategy online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) is designed to provide both regulators and those in regulated industries with a firm grounding in the key features and processes of regulatory strategy, and offers the tools to help you think critically about how regulation should be designed and evaluated. With this LSE online certificate course, you’ll learn to identify risks affecting regulatory compliance and understand how to perform risk management. Over eight weeks, participants will consider law and policy regulation from a practical and multidisciplinary perspective, drawing on expertise from LSE Law School. Using cross-sectoral and cross-national examples, this course allows participants from a range of backgrounds to gain highly transferable skills and remain up to date in an increasingly dynamic field.Is this course for you?This course will be of value to the business professional impacted by regulation, whether in risk, legal, or compliance departments, or to the business leader whose company is subject to significant law and policy regulations. If you are an entrepreneur beginning a new venture, or a consultant with a client portfolio that is subject to regulation, the course will provide you with a firm foundation in managing a regulatory strategy. The course is also relevant if you are an employee working within a regulatory organisation and would like to validate or enhance your skill set. If you are a public policy professional in a non-governmental and non-profit organisation, a government employee, or if you’re working in a regulatory agency in a government department tasked with risk management, this course will be of equal benefit.This Regulation Strategy online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 70 hours of learning.  Note: should participants wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon them. LSE and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Healthcare Management
about: Learn how applying fundamental business and management principles to healthcare administration can improve access, quality, and safety.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview:
Program overviewBottom 10%The tier where the US ranks on the Bloomberg Health-Efficiency Index, which grades countries’ healthcare system in terms of efficiency.Bloomberg (Dec, 2020).32%The expected growth in employment of medical and health services managers in the US by 2029, which is significantly faster than the 4% average for all occupations.Bureau of Labor Statistics (Jun, 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
The US healthcare system wastes billions of dollars annually as a result of administrative inefficiencies.1 In light of this, there’s an increasing demand for clinicians and health-services managers who understand the operational and economic impact of their everyday business decisions.2
The eight-week Healthcare Management online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education will give you a grounding in the business principles and organizational practices that underpin the modern healthcare system.
Throughout the program, you’ll gain practical health administration and operational skills to help you manage finances, maximize throughput, optimize patient care, and ultimately become a more effective leader.
With a unique, integrated curriculum and specific industry case studies that shed light on the US healthcare system, you’ll find actionable insights applicable to your own context. Sharpen your healthcare-management skills, gain the tools to drive change in your organization, and earn a certificate of participation online from the Yale SOM Executive Education.
1 JAMA Network (Oct, 2019).2 Bureau of Labor Statistics (Jun, 2021).Is this course for you?This program is aimed at both medical and non-medical professionals who are looking to gain a fundamental understanding of business and organizational principles, and their application in healthcare.It’s ideal for medical professionals who currently manage or aim to run their own private practices,  and who require the financial and managerial skills to do so, or for those who are looking to transition into a more administrative or senior role within healthcare. Physicians, registered nurses, surgeons, and allied health professionals will also benefit from this introduction to the essentials of health-services administration.

About the certificate: Get recognized for your knowledge when you earn an official certificate of participation from Yale SOM Executive Education — and use it to set yourself apart as a professional equipped with strong healthcare-management skills.

title: Digital Marketing Analytics Online Short Course
about: Discover how digital channels and marketing analytics can be leveraged to optimize marketing spend.
Course overview:
Course overview15%The increase in website traffic from a consumer packaged goods company that started using data with AI to customize content and offer a more personalized experience.MIT Sloan Management Review (Jun, 2019).
5 yearsData shows that, in eight weeks, we jumped five years forward in consumer and business digital adoption due to COVID-19 forcing many companies to digitize at least part of their business.McKinsey (Oct, 2020)Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Digital technologies have reshaped marketing, leading to a drastic shift in the quality and quantity of information we can store, access, and analyze. This proliferation of data allows businesses to better understand and react to consumer patterns. However, it also increases the need to evolve measurement, planning, and implementation of their marketing activity. Companies require skilled professionals who are equipped to ensure optimal return on investment (ROI) for marketing spend, and to deliver valuable insights that drive better customer service. The MIT Sloan Digital Marketing Analytics online short course unpacks how to leverage measurement and analysis within the technological side of your marketing strategy. With a focus on digital marketing analytics, you’ll assess the latest applications of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and predictive modeling that will help drive ROI for campaigns. Digital marketing courses are perfect for business owners and managers who want to learn how to use data to make more informed decisions about their marketing strategies. Data-driven marketing is the future, and this course will ensure you have the skills to stay ahead of the curve.Is this course for you?Digital media and marketing analytics tools have transformed traditional marketing theory and practice, making this online course valuable to anyone working within the field or aspiring to a marketing career. No matter your level of experience, this course will give you the skills and knowledge necessary to make an impact in today's business world.
This MIT Sloan School of Management marketing analytics online program is designed to give you the opportunity to close the gaps in your analytical knowledge and digital skills. If you’re involved in the field of marketing, this online course will help to supplement your level of expertise, provide the opportunity for career growth, and increase your attractiveness to potential employers. If you’re the owner of a small business, this online program aims to help develop your ability to generate sales and improve revenue. This program is also aimed at validating the data analytics skills of established marketing professionals with an MIT Sloan digital certificate of completion.
What is the difference between data analytics and web analytics?
When considering taking a marketing analytics online short course, it's important to understand the difference between data analytics and web analytics. Web analytics is the measurement, collection, analysis, and reporting of web data for understanding and optimizing web usage.1 Data analytics, on the other hand, is the process of analyzing data to gain insights that can be used to make better business decisions.2
1TechTarget (May, 2021).
2Investopedia (Sept, 2021).
Interpret data analytics and improve marketing performance
What does this mean for you? If you're interested in learning how to measure and improve marketing performance, then this MIT Sloan School of Management online short course will equip you with the skills for leveraging digital channels to reach business objectives.
MIT marketing courses are designed to give you an in-depth understanding of the latest marketing analytical tools and techniques so that you can make strategic decisions that will have a positive impact on your organization.
Learn how to visualize data
It’s important to have the capability to understand and interpret data analytics, and then to visualize it. This MIT Sloan online short course covers marketing analytics and teaches you to visualize the data as a way to find opportunities to optimize marketing spend. 
Gain actionable insights from data analysis
This marketing analytics online short course is designed for professionals who want to use data science to influence business decision-making. Learn how to analyze data for actionable insights that can improve your marketing campaigns.

Learn to apply data analytics knowledge to enhance your marketing efforts, and earn an official digital certificate of completion from MIT Sloan.

I am still amazed at how much I learnt in just six weeks.'}

title: Telehealth: Strategy, Implementation, and Optimization
about: Gain the skills to empower your organization’s telehealth integration and remove barriers to healthcare.
Course overview:
Course overview$106 billionThe amount expected to be spent on virtual healthcare in the U.S. by 2023.Doximity (Sep, 2020).83%The percentage of patients who said they are likely to continue using telehealth solutions after COVID-19.Doctor.com (2020).Over the past year, telehealth — and its subcategory, telemedicine — has seen its usage spike dramatically as healthcare continues through a historically transformative period. By October 2020, virtual healthcare solutions had seen a 3,000 percent usage increase.1 The COVID-19 pandemic may help explain this boom to some extent, but the technology’s expansion is indicative of a long-term change in the way patients and healthcare workers interact, as telehealth offers a safe, efficient solution to many medical needs.
The Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE) Telehealth: Strategy, Implementation, and Optimization online short course allows you to explore the strategic considerations and best practices of telehealth and telemedicine. Take the opportunity to examine the clinical, operational, financial, and legal factors of telehealth, and assess how this technology can become a bridge to equitable healthcare access. In the course, you’ll identify and learn to overcome telehealth’s risks and barriers, while equipping yourself to make the most of its opportunities. Finally, you’ll explore how to effectively empower your organization’s telehealth efforts in order to enable successful implementation and ongoing optimization of telehealth delivery.
1 Health Leaders (Jan, 2021).

AccreditationIn support of improving patient care, Stanford Medicine is jointly accredited by the Accreditation Council for Continuing Medical Education (ACCME), the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE), and the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC), to provide continuing education for the healthcare team.Credit designationAmerican Medical Association (AMA)The Stanford University School of Medicine designates this enduring material for a maximum of 48.00 AMA PRA Category 1 Credits™. Physicians should claim only the credit commensurate with the extent of their participation in the activity.
View the full accreditation information here from Stanford Medicine.
Is this course for you?As this online short course examines the requirements and potential of telehealth solutions, it holds benefits for professionals across the healthcare industry. If you’re a medical doctor, nurse, or healthcare specialist, this course will provide you with insights for implementing telehealth in your practice, while equipping you to make the case for its use to your employers and peers. If you’re a senior executive or manager in the healthcare industry, you’ll gain business, operational, legal and financial insights for telehealth implementation, as well as the knowledge to identify telehealth opportunities.

title: Psychology for High Performance
about: Unlock your full potential. Develop practical tools for enhanced personal and professional performance.
Course overview: Course overview12xThe expected return on investment for every $1 spent on well-being.Xero (Apr, 2021).$1,500 billionThe annual cost of presenteeism – the presence of employees who are at work but not fully productive – to the US economy.Thrive Global (Jan, 2021).Duration: 2 weeksEveryone strives to be high performing individuals. But how do you achieve more success and sustain it over time? Often, the key to unlocking higher peaks of excellence lies within your own approach to your well-being. The Psychology for High Performance online micro course from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE) equips you with practical tools to maximize your potential at work and beyond. Based on fundamental psychological principles, you'll unpack actionable strategies to optimize performance and gain self-awareness. You'll not only be provided with the theory to enhance your performance, but also be challenged to apply this theory through reflective and practical methods. Ultimately, you’ll examine the importance of exercise, nutrition, and sleep on physical and psychological well-being, and learn to build durable and effective habits.Is this course for you?This course is suited to individuals who are invested in their personal well-being, and looking for additional tools to thrive personally and professionally. It’s applicable to working professionals in a multitude of roles and industries, and offers both practical and theoretical opportunities to better understand one’s own actions, thoughts, and behaviors. These roles could include healthcare professionals and those in sports or wellness fields, but equally office professionals, technical specialists, aspiring managers and executives will benefit from the ability to unlock performance that this micro course offers.
What will set you apart: ['Practical strategies for redefining success and failure from a binary approach to a process-oriented one.', 'Skills that promote cognitive flexibility and maximize potential by helping you navigate conflicting and overwhelming thoughts.', 'Knowledge of how to enhance performance by modifying your lifestyle around exercise, nutrition, and sleep.', 'A better understanding of how to build and maintain new habits that improve performance. ', '', 'Work through your downloadable and online instructional material', 'Interact with your peers and learning facilitators through class-wide forums and reviewed small group discussions ', 'Enjoy a wide range of interactive content including live sessions, round-up videos, podcasts, quizzes, and more ', 'Receive a tool kit for practical application in your career', 'Apply what you learn throughout this two-week online micro course experience and develop practical tools to achieve your goals and optimize productivity.']
About the certificate: Validate your skills online with an official digital badge from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE). In order to be issued with a digital badge, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the two-week online micro course.

title: Interpersonal Communication: Strategies for Executives
about: Gain the ability to effectively communicate with diverse teams, and across a dispersed workforce, to manage and motivate in the modern business environment.
Course overview: Course overview9%The percentage of survey respondents who agree that their companies have leaders with the skills needed to thrive in the digital economy.Cognizant (Jan, 2020).Top 3The ability to communicate across remote or distributed teams is one of the top three skills learning and development professionals consider essential for success.LinkedIn (2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Strong communication skills and interpersonal relationships are essential in an increasingly complex, dynamic, and technical world.Communicating persuasively is crucial to inspiring and motivating others, and a requirement when leading a diverse — and often dispersed — workforce. This skill is also valuable when working with external stakeholders such as clients or business partners from abroad.The MIT Sloan Interpersonal Communication: Strategies for Executives online short course combines research and practice-based methods to help you craft communication deliverables using the RELATE Framework — a scalable professional communication strategy created by the MIT Sloan School of Management. Throughout the course, you’ll also learn how to engage with various audiences and apply a strategic communication lens to understand machines in the corporate context.Is this course for you?This course is designed to support you in adopting effective personal and online communication techniques that meet the needs of an increasingly complex, digitalized world. Managers, entrepreneurs, and business leaders who need to communicate with a wide range of stakeholders will find value in developing their skill set and updating their communication approaches to meet modern business needs. Similarly, if you’re a consultant, you can enhance service delivery by improving your ability to communicate with diverse audiences or via virtual or social media tools, as required by most multinational companies. If you’re looking to improve your interpersonal skills to match your practical expertise, for example, as a technical or HR professional who wants to better communicate with a team, you’ll find value in the strategic approaches covered in this course.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Sharpening your communication capabilities through the RELATE Framework', 'Module 2': 'Navigating interpersonal dynamics', 'Module 3': 'Managing difficult conversations', 'Module 4': 'Communicating across cultures', 'Module 5': 'Maximizing your persuasive potential', 'Module 6': 'Addressing a new audience: Machines'}
Convenors: {'Ben Shields': ['Senior Lecturer in Managerial Communication, MIT Sloan ', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBWmM9IiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--fa2dbe5d2cd094766bf5bd4ee9817b0d9576612e/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/mit_sloan_management_analytics_decision_making_lessons_from_the_sports_industry_course_convenor_ben_shields.jpg'], 'Kara Blackburn': ['Senior Lecturer in Managerial Communication, MIT Sloan', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBallFIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--3c052ff73b8d66f2d8c1dac9dc32e18e960c34f1/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/mit_sloan_interpersonal_communication__strategies_for_executives_course_convenor_kara_blackburn.jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['Effective communication skills and strategies to help you manage remote teams in any business context or industry.', 'Skills in active listening and humble inquiry, and an improved ability to give and receive feedback.', 'A personal leadership narrative, and a range of tactics to effectively manage and participate in difficult conversations.', 'Strategies to persuade external and internal audiences.', 'An understanding of the significant impact of technology in the workplace, and the practices needed to communicate that impact in productive conversations with, through, and about machines.']
About the certificate:
Sharpen your professional communication skills to drive results in the corporate world and earn an official digital certificate of completion from the MIT Sloan School of Management.
This program also counts toward an MIT Sloan Executive Certificate, which you can earn upon completion of four programs where at least three of the four come from your chosen certificate track and at least one is completed in person. Find full details here.

title: Corporate Sustainability Management: Risk, Profit, and Purpose
about: Drive sustainability in your business with a practical implementation plan for the future.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview:
Program overview96%The amount of people who think businesses should be leading efforts to address climate change.Yale Center for Business and the Environment (2020).70%The percentage of consumers who say they’d be willing to pay more for sustainable packaging.McKinsey (Oct, 2020).Duration: 6 weeksAs sustainability becomes an increasingly critical part of global consciousness, businesses are faced with one of their biggest opportunities for innovation to date. Today, companies have the chance to transform their practices to drive not only progress, but profits as well. The Corporate Sustainability Management: Risk, Profit, and Purpose online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education provides a practical guide for incorporating sustainability into your business strategy. The program features a wide variety of on-the-job resources, insights from industry leaders, case studies, discussions, and real-world applications. At the end of six weeks, you’ll walk away with an understanding of the potential financial impact of sustainability issues, and be equipped with the best practices and tools for leveraging opportunities in sustainability to gain a competitive edge.Is this program for you?This program benefits business leaders and executives looking to develop a competitive advantage by offering them the tools needed to give strategic direction on sustainability. It also provides valuable resources for professionals and specialists who want to drive positive change in their role, as well as those working in the risk management and business continuity space. In addition, the program equips consultants with the insight needed to better advise clients, and provides public sector policymakers and regulators with an in-depth understanding of the impact of sustainability measures on business.
How does this program differ from the Sustainable Finance and Investment online program?The Corporate Sustainability Management: Risk, Profit, and Purpose online program is designed to help you embed sustainability and sustainable practices into the core of your business strategies. TheSustainable Finance and Investment online program, on the other hand,  focuses primarily on equipping you to make more informed analyses and decisions when investing in sustainable assets and products.

title: Health Communication: Strategies for Impact and Success
about: Connect and build trust with patients, colleagues, the public, and the media as you gain the communication skills to ensure the dissemination of accurate health information.
Course overview:
Course overviewFact versus fictionStudies show that individuals share falsehoods more than evidence-based information through social media.Springer (Aug, 2020).3xReminders to judge the accuracy of non-COVID-19-related headlines almost tripled the level of truth discernment in users' subsequent online sharing.NCBI (Jun, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)With every pandemic comes another outbreak — a global infodemic.1 The scale of a crisis is matched by an equally mammoth flow of information and media coverage, however, much of it is false, misleading, and unsourced.2
The Stanford Center for Health Education, a part of Stanford Medicine, recognizes the need for communication that ensures medical facts, rather than falsehoods, spread. The Health Communication: Strategies for Impact and Success online short course aims to give you these fundamental skills. Guided by leaders in the field, you’ll learn to effectively communicate health and science information to broad audiences including patients, colleagues, the public, and the media. The course offers an in-depth look at the health information ecosystem, discussing how news is spread and why false details travel faster than the truth. Over a period of six weeks, you’ll learn to deliver impactful medical and scientific presentations, engage in challenging conversations, and facilitate positive media interaction. The power of improvisation in improving your communication skills will also be explored and practiced in role-play scenarios and sessions. As you gain these practical strategies and techniques, you’ll learn how to build strong relationships across contexts, empowering you to become a trusted source of health information.
1 Springer (Aug, 2020).
2 NCBI (Apr, 2020).
Is this course for you?This course is suited to professionals who have experience in the healthcare sector and are looking to improve their communications skills with their various stakeholders. This includes health administrators, consultants, researchers, healthcare and health service executives, and public health professionals. The course is also designed for medical doctors and scientists, nurses, specialists, pharmacists, and clinicians. These healthcare and science professionals will have the opportunity to enhance their skills in delivering technical information, and learn to navigate challenging interactions with patients, colleagues, news journalists, and the public, as well as on social media. Media and communications professionals will also benefit from the course; journalists, PR specialists, policymakers, spokespersons, and marketing individuals will learn to accurately relay health information, and separate fact from fiction.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Introduction to foundational communication skills', 'Module 2': 'The health information ecosystem', 'Module 3': 'Medical and scientific presentation skills', 'Module 4': 'Navigating challenging conversations', 'Module 5': 'Interacting with the media', 'Module 6': 'Putting it all together'}

', 'The ability to manage difficult conversations around health information, with best practices for exchanges within the public, as well as internally in your organization.   ', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']

title: Employee Wellness and Stress Management
about: Optimize your productivity and engagement at work with a mental and emotional tool kit to empower you to prioritize and support the well-being of self and others.
Course overview:
Course overview80%The percentage of individuals who report feeling significantly more stressed and anxious as a result of COVID-19.Thrive Global (2020).$1 trillionThe estimated cost of lost productivity for the global economy as a result of depression and anxiety.WHO (May, 2019).The consequences of stress are becoming increasingly apparent – not just to the individual, but to organizations as a whole. Stress causes 56 percent of workers to search for a new job, resulting in high turnover costs and productivity losses.1 As the interdependent relationship between personal well-being and team productivity is realized, businesses are beginning to prioritize wellness for the resilience and benefits it brings.The Employee Wellness and Stress Management online short course focuses on the impact you can have when you take the steps to improve your own, as well as others, health. Developed by Dr. Grace Gengoux from the Stanford Center for Health Education, you’ll gain strategies to support the self-care of the teams you lead and colleagues you influence, while also focusing on your own well-being and personal resilience. With this dual approach, you’ll explore the reciprocal relationship between a ‘healthy you’ and ‘healthy teams’ as you unpack the science and practical examples of self-care. With an understanding of how essential physical health practices are for stress and energy management, you’ll gain the tools and techniques to encourage well-being of self and others. The course uses self-reflection, goal setting, and global case studies to guide you as you define your wellness priorities, and build resilience for a fast-paced and complex working world.
1 Wrike (Nd). Accessed September 23, 2020.
Is this course for you?This course is suited to individual employees who are invested in their personal well-being, and who need the tools to manage stress and enhance resilience in others. Professionals who include consultants, team leaders, and HR managers will benefit from learning to support employee well-being, identify signs of stress and burnout, and navigate mental health issues in the workplace. With the tools to cultivate wellness, people managers will get the chance to improve their leadership skills while optimizing their own, as well as their team’s, health. The course is also designed for dedicated healthcare and wellness professionals who need to improve their professional offering and better understand the dynamic between stress and well-being.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Healthy you, healthy teams', 'Module 2': 'Daily habits as a foundation for resilience', 'Module 3': 'Team connection and meaningful contributions', 'Module 4': 'Overcoming cognitive biases and developing empathy', 'Module 5': 'Managing stress and mental health', 'Module 6': 'Sustaining well-being and resilience'}
Convenors: {'Dr. Grace Gengoux': ['Clinical Professor, Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences, Stanford University School of Medicine', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdmtKIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--fe1138d726e8d6482ea0d89a1dce1d5cf27dcd93/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/stanford_center_for_health_education_exercise_physiology_course_convenor_gengoux_grace.jpg']}

About the certificate: Study wellness and stress management, and earn an official certificate of completion from Stanford Center for Health Education. Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Communication and Influence in the Digital Age
about: Learn to engage attention in a media-dense environment and cultivate interpersonal skills through clear, effective communication.
Course overview: Course overviewCommunication in times of crisis“In an ongoing crisis, clear communication is more important and more difficult than when things seem normal. Employees and customers are hungry for information, so we’re tempted to pull together presentations and communicate with urgency instead of with careful planning.”– Nancy DuarteHarvard Business Review (May, 2020).Storytelling“The ability to create a well-thought-out narrative provides communicators a powerful method of persuasion, motivating audiences to act.”– Roshni Wijayasinha, FoxquiltForbes (Jun, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)In an increasingly complex global and local environment, where individuals need to cope with rapid change and abundant information, effective communication is crucial. The fast-paced and public nature of digital communication can mean a single misstep can lead to loss of credibility at both a company and an individual level.The Communication and Influence in the Digital Age online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) explores traditional communication skills adapted for today’s connected and technology-driven environment. Led by UCT faculty and subject matter experts, you’ll learn to communicate effectively with your teams, stakeholders, and digital audience to improve trust, clarity, and goodwill. You’ll learn how to navigate the current communication landscape through critical thinking, persuasion, storytelling, cultural awareness, interpersonal communication, presentation, and crisis management, all integral to manifesting influence and communicating successfully. Is this course for you?This course is aimed at professionals across industries who are looking to build their communication abilities – in person and online – to meet the needs of an increasingly complex, digitised world. In occupations where effective communication skills are required to engage with a range of stakeholders, this course will help to develop an interpersonal skill set applicable to the current communications landscape. If you’re seeking ways to influence and inspire others, build greater self-awareness and interpersonal skills, and communicate effectively, the course provides a practical roadmap to promote trust, clarity, and goodwill in your professional context. Relevant to early- and mid-career professionals who need to engage with a wide range of personnel, as well as new or aspiring leaders who need to communicate effectively with teams, you’ll be compelled to assess your interpersonal communication skills and the value of investing in communication as a professional and a leader. No matter what your context, building influence is crucial for reaching your personal and professional goals. This course will help you develop your personal brand and hone your presentation skills in order to cultivate influence and communicate persuasively.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'The current communications landscape', 'Module 2': 'Critical thinking: Avoiding miscommunication', 'Module 3': 'Persuasive communication', 'Module 4': 'Communicating with influence: Strategies and techniques', 'Module 5': 'Communication as an investment in leadership and ethics', 'Module 6': 'Crisis communication and reputation management'}

Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

I have gained immeasurable insight into a topic that I have been intimidated by for a long time."}

title: Programme Management: A Monitoring and Evaluation Approach
about: Learn to manage complex programmes, and discover the key monitoring and evaluation tools that help facilitate success.
Course overview: Course overview34%The percentage of South African organisations that have no understanding of programme and portfolio management, in contrast with the 99% that understand the value of project management.Project Portfolio Office (2019). ​19%The number of projects and programmes that deliver to full success.IPMA (Nov, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)While project management is vital in ensuring that specific tasks run according to plan, it takes a programme manager to successfully lead a collection of projects to meet high-level goals.The Programme Management: A Monitoring and Evaluation Approach online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) helps you understand how best to design, plan, and implement a programme, as well as actively monitor and evaluate phases throughout the process.Over eight weeks, you’ll engage with the core aspects of programme management across the four key phases of the programme life cycle, namely diagnosis, planning and design, monitoring and implementation, and outcomes. You’ll also explore the tools required in each phase, and gain strategies for finance and resource tracking against a programme goal.With expert guidance from experienced UCT faculty, you’ll walk away with the key stakeholder management and governance skills needed to successfully deliver on programmes of various size and scope.Is this course for you?This course will be relevant to anyone who wants to lead a programme or collection of projects towards a common goal. This includes both individuals in the public sector who must strategically deliver on programmes with economic and social benefits, and private sector professionals who must report projects against funds and objectives. Project, product, and portfolio managers will find the programme management skills and tools learnt in this course valuable to their current roles. Additionally, existing programme managers, project coordinators, and programme coordinators can grow in confidence and signal their worth to their employers with an updated skill set and certificate of completion as validation of their knowledge.

title: Privacy Law and Data Protection
about: Critically engage with important developments in privacy law and legislation that impact the way you do business.
Course overview: Course overview81%Roughly four out of five people believe that the potential risks of data collection do not match the benefits.Pew Research Center (Nov, 2019).$8.64 millionThe median cost of a data breach in the U.S., double that of the global average.IBM Security (2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)As consumers become more aware of how their data is being used, companies will need to invest in new resources to better meet the demands for data privacy. For businesses intent on keeping abreast of regulations, preparedness is the best course of action. Gain an in-depth understanding of U.S. privacy laws with the Privacy Law and Data Protection online short course from Northwestern Pritzker School of Law. Over six weeks you will investigate privacy and data legislation in order to better protect data, mitigate risks and remain compliant.Exploring the differences between private and public data, you will gain a thorough understanding of the laws associated with each. You will also investigate medical privacy laws, such as Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), to determine their effect on privacy regulations in business. By the end of the course you will have designed a privacy law road map that can be used in your organization to help create better privacy policies.Is this course for you?This course is designed to equip professionals across a variety of industries with contextual knowledge of the effects of privacy law and regulations on business. Individuals in data- and cyber-related fields will learn to mitigate business risks that may be associated with data protection legislation. Those working in legal and risk management professions will gain the tools needed to manage and develop data protection and privacy initiatives with an understanding of the unique considerations data privacy entails. Additionally, anyone in a leadership position will benefit from an in-depth look at the challenges and complexities associated with popular data and privacy legislation, and how they affect business processes

title: Real Estate Finance and Investment
about: Deepen your knowledge of real estate investment to maximize returns and minimize mistakes.
Course overview:
Program overview75%The percentage of real estate professionals who believe market conditions will be moderately or significantly better in the next year, with an optimism level not seen since mid-2015.RCLCO (Jun, 2021).80%The amount of real estate professionals who believe that reskilling the workforce in new areas will be important in the coming years.Deloitte (Sep, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Despite the myriad market shocks of the past two decades, real estate has remained an in-demand and often lucrative investment option. However, many interested in the property market feel unequipped to navigate its challenges or seize its opportunities. To invest strategically, professionals need a solid foundation in the concepts, principles, and analytical methods involved in valuing and financing a property.
In the Real Estate Finance and Investment online program from Kellogg Executive Education at Northwestern University, you’ll unpack the key factors needed to make effective investment decisions. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll examine the process of acquiring a profit-generating property, including valuing it, financing it, and measuring the impact of the tax laws governing it. You’ll also learn how to actively forecast expected cash flow and avoid common investment mistakes and risks. Each module includes a practical, real-world case study — designed specifically by an industry expert to consolidate learnings — giving you the confidence to execute effective investment decisions by the program’s end.
Is this program for you?This program is designed for any professionals interested in real estate investment who want to develop their knowledge of financing, valuation, and investing techniques. Chief among these are senior executives and investors operating in the real estate industry who are seeking to gain new insights, drive decision-making, and avoid common pitfalls. Real estate professionals such as advisers, analysts, consultants, and managers will also find value in the program’s exploration of key principles and analytical methods. All students will gain the practical skills and the confidence to accurately determine the potential return on a real estate investment, whether in their professional or personal capacity.

title: Leadership for Global Business and Politics
about: Develop the knowledge and skills for effective leadership in a changing social, political, and environmental context.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview: Program overview47%The percentage of millennials who believe that business has a positive impact on society.Deloitte (Jan, 2021). 7x The revenue growth of Fortune 500 companies that achieved a high ROL100 score.Nasdaq (Jun, 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Organizations operate within the context of their competitors, suppliers, and customers, but also within a broader nonmarket environment that includes social, political, environmental, and regulatory forces.The Leadership for Global Business and Politics online program, from the Yale School of Management Executive Education, offers business leaders an evolved perspective of nonmarket factors that affect business. It provides strategies, language, frameworks, and tools to analyze and respond to these factors to gain a competitive advantage. Guided by industry expert David Bach, you’ll develop the skills and knowledge to drive strategies that anticipate and plan for change and disruption. Explore the move toward stakeholder capitalism, how it relates to your organization, and how it can be leveraged for a sustainable, strategic edge. You’ll also gain the opportunity to engage with a diverse and international group of participants, and grow your global network online.Is this program for you?This online program will equip you with transnational leadership practices and the skills to assess the global and political economy. Led by experts on international affairs, you’ll learn how multinational organizations can balance the effects of globalization and maintain sound international relations. This program is designed for those working in strategy, communications, government affairs, corporate responsibility, business development, and leading industries, who need to be cognizant of topical social, political, and environmental issues. Executives who need to consider the impact of political and social issues on their business will be equipped with the terminology and a best practice approach to leadership in a rapidly changing corporate and societal landscape. Functional managers who are interested in pursuing a greater involvement in business strategy will benefit from access to frameworks and tools that will allow them to engage effectively with the impact of nonmarket forces on their organization, while managing stakeholder engagement in a global context.

title: Managerial Finance
about: Be empowered to participate in your firm’s strategic financial decisions with an accessible approach to the fundamental principles that underpin executive finance.
Course overview: Program overview74%The proportion of survey respondents who feel managers require reskilling or upskilling.TalentLMS (Jun, 2020).Top 10 business skillsFinancial literacy is considered to be one of the most important capabilities, even for professionals who aren’t in a financial or accounting role.U.S. News (Oct, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Is your non-financial background holding you back from engaging in constructive discussions or making key financial decisions that drive your business forward? The Managerial Finance online program from Kellogg Executive Education at Northwestern University aims to teach you how to structure your questions and thought processes when making financial decisions. It’s specifically designed to make corporate finance more accessible by simplifying it into three fundamental decisions: investments, funding, and payouts. Over six weeks, you’ll build on your existing management expertise and learn about the mechanics and intuition at every step along the corporate finance decision-making process. This program uses real-world examples to make each concept easy to understand and apply in your own company.Is this program for you?This Kellogg Executive Education program is for leaders, managers, and executives with non-financial backgrounds and aims to equip them with the necessary skills to contribute to the financial decisions of their businesses. Financial acumen is a critical factor of strategic decision-making and is key to driving growth and organizational performance, so this program is relevant to both current and aspiring senior professionals across all industries.

Shrinking margins and rising costs are driving public and private health systems to improve operational efficiencies and reduce expenses. Rigorous financial management could help to improve care provision and combat unnecessary spending.
The Modelling Cost-Effectiveness in Healthcare online certificate course from LSE equips you with marketable skills in cost-effectiveness modelling. title: Data Science in Real Estate
about: Gain the analytical tools to utilize data for informed decision making in real estate.
University name: MIT School of Architecture and Planning

PwC (2020).34%The percentage of North American commercial real estate companies that plan to increase investment in data analytics in the next year.Deloitte (Dec, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Thanks to machine learning and data analytics, real estate professionals and investors are now able to make more accurate property assessments than ever before. This Data Science in Real Estate online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P) focuses on growing your data science skills within the context of the built environment. During the program, esteemed MIT faculty and industry experts will teach you how to harness statistical techniques to reveal key insights into the factors that impact property investment and development opportunities.Over the course of six weeks, you’ll learn how to evaluate and tidy data, expand data sets, and generate a selection of models that can be used to explain industry trends and forecast real estate values.Is this course for you?This MIT SA+P program provides participants with the data science skills to support decision making and grow a successful property portfolio. Those with experience in data analytics will benefit by learning to apply their skills to the real estate market, while real estate professionals and independent investors can increase their competitive edge by building data skills to improve analysis and valuation, helping them to make better decisions.While there are no formal prerequisites for this course, it’s highly recommended that you have a basic understanding of programming, in particular using R. You should be familiar with different data types and basic data structures, including objects, functions, vectors, matrices, data frames, and factors; and have used them practically in the past. If you don’t yet have an understanding of these concepts, you can explore the bridging resources made available in the course brochure.

title: Marketing Analytics for Consumer Insights
about: Gain highly marketable Python and data storytelling skills to translate consumer insights into actionable results.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overviewData-driven insightsTo develop ‘consumer-centred’ strategies, companies need to have a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of consumers, including their demography, social status, preference and behaviours, as well as the underlying psychological factors.Deloitte (Jan, 2020).73%The percentage of customers who expect companies to anticipate their needs and expectations.Salesforce (Jan, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)In an era of immediacy, technological acceleration, and massive consumer- and transactional-level data, insight into the needs, behaviours, and demands of your customers is crucial. These data-driven insights can be leveraged to identify pain points, drive brand loyalty, allocate resources effectively, and increase return of investment. While the data abounds, however, professionals who can analyse and transform this data into meaningful and actionable intelligence are rare.
The Marketing Analytics for Consumer Insights online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) offers you practical guidance to harnessing the power of big data and applying state-of-the-art analytical models to real-world marketing problems. With expert knowledge from noteworthy academics and a world-leading social science university, you’ll be equipped with not only an understanding of the key drivers of the digital ecosystem, but also highly marketable Python and data storytelling skills.
This course is technical in nature. Participants will be introduced to the coding language Python, as well as basic statistical concepts and analytical models that can be applied to real-world data sets. Despite its technical foundation, there are no prerequisites; prior statistical and programming knowledge is not required. Additionally, no specific software is needed.
Is this course for you?This online certificate course offers relevance to a variety of functional business areas, including market research, media planning, business intelligence, research and development, optimisation, personalisation, and CX. For marketing analytics professionals in need of tangible data analysis skills to better inform overall business and marketing strategy, the course offers both theoretical and practical application of Python and data storytelling techniques, segment targeting, web scraping, perceptual mapping, and customer sentiment analysis. It’s equally relevant to those in a marketing role, such as marketing managers, who wish to learn how to use data storytelling skills to translate consumer insights into actionable results. Whether you’re interested in upskilling, transitioning into a more analytical role, or eager to validate your existing knowledge, you’ll benefit from online learning models designed to work within your schedule.This Marketing Analytics for Consumer Insights online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. title: Leading Racial Equity and Inclusion in Organizations
about: Unpack the root causes of U.S. racial inequalities and structural realities, and gain the tools to create and promote a racially equitable and inclusive workforce.
Course overview: Course overview30%The increased likelihood a company will make better business decisions if it’s leading in diversity, equity, and inclusion.World Economic Forum (Jun, 2020).96%The percentage of CEOs who state that DEI is a strategic priority.Deloitte (Oct, 2020).Duration: 4 weeks (excluding orientation)Globally, the separation and suppression of ethnic minorities has led to a multitude of divides that exist at every level of society. Awareness of racial inequity, however, is growing, and small and large companies alike are realizing the impact exclusion and systemic racism has on employees, workplace culture, as well as performance. The Leading Racial Equity and Inclusion in Organizations online short course explores both the business priority, and greater social responsibility, of addressing racial inequality. Designed by the Weinberg College of Arts and Sciences at Northwestern University, this four-week course gives you the tools and insights to implement and promote racial equity and inclusion in your organization. You’ll begin by exploring the root causes of racial inequalities and structural realities within the U.S., and examine how these dynamics have shaped the business world today. Set against the context of a diverse range of real-world case-studies, you’ll engage with the Racial Equity Framework — a tool to improve racial equity outcomes in corporate, governmental, and nonprofit organizations. You’ll use this framework to turn theory into action when you create a Racial Equity Action Plan to support and drive equity and inclusion within your own context.Is this course for you?This course is for leaders and managers who are interested in increasing their diversity awareness. The course aims to give these executives an enhanced perspective of racial equity — including the history of U.S. inequality and its manifestations in modern society. With the skills and tools gained, they’ll be well positioned to better serve minority employee groups within their context, and drive racial equity and inclusion initiatives. The course is also designed for mid-level team leaders, as well as specialists, recruiters, and those involved in workplace diversity and inclusion. These professionals will walk away from the course equipped to create a supportive and unbiased culture that promotes equal opportunities and fair treatment for all employees.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Core racial equity concepts', 'Module 2': 'How racial inequalities shape current business practices', 'Module 3': 'Building a Racial Equity Framework', 'Module 4': 'Implementing a Racial Equity Framework'}

title: Sustainable Fashion: Brand and Business Strategy Program
about: Integrate sustainability practices into your operations and marketing strategies to build a robust, relevant and competitive brand.
Course overview:
Program overview60%The percentage of fashion and textile companies that rank sustainability as their second most important strategic objective.Edited (2020)66%The percentage of consumers who plan to cease or reduce supporting brands who engage in unfair treatment of suppliers and employees.McKinsey (Sep, 2020)Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
The fashion industry is known for expediting trends from runway to retail, sometimes at the expense of low-income factory workers and the environment. Thanks to evolving consumer and investor sentiment and events that have exposed the impact of poor production practices, conscious buyers are pushing brands to open up about their supply chain and build more transparent narratives. Now, more than ever, it’s imperative that fashion organizations – from fast fashion to luxury brands – make way for better, more sustainable business models.
The Sustainable Fashion: Brand and Business Strategy Program explores the fashion industry’s potential to build purpose-driven and sustainable brands. Guided by expert faculty from SDA Bocconi School of Management, you’ll be introduced to holistic and proactive sustainability practices based on the Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (ESG) criteria. Explore the need for transparency in the fashion supply chain by examining its structure and challenges. Supported by real-world, global case studies, you’ll also discover how a brand's narrative can be leveraged to address consumer demands for sustainability.
Is this program for you?If you’re a business leader or manager looking to build a fashion brand with a positive impact, this program offers you strategic insights and analytical tools to integrate sustainability across your organization. As a marketing or brand professional, this six-week program will equip you with the skills to build a strong brand strategy and narrative that communicates your organization’s sustainability efforts to different stakeholders. Additionally, investors and consultants working in the fashion and luxury sectors, or career newcomers who are ardent social and environmental supporters, can use this program to start or grow in this dynamic industry.
Participants who successfully earn a certificate of completion for the SDA Bocconi Sustainable Fashion: Brand and Business Strategy Program may apply to enroll for the Executive Master in Luxury Management (EMiLUX). The Sustainable Fashion: Brand and Business Strategy Program certificate will count toward a segment of the Executive Master. Upon successful admission to the Executive Master, participants will be entitled to receive a discount of €3,000.
Note: Application to the Executive Master in Luxury Management is required and the assessments remain mandatory.


SDA Bocconi is one of the few elite business schools to have garnered the ‘triple crown’ of the world’s most prestigious international accreditations (AMBA, AACSB, and EQUIS). It is also the only Italian institution to feature in all the major global business school rankings, including those of the Financial Times, Forbes, Bloomberg Businessweek and The Economist.*
*SDA Bocconi (2021)

title: MarTech Strategy: Leveraging Data and Technology in Marketing
about: Prepare for the future of marketing.
Course overview: Course overview83 percentThe percentage of global CEOs who recognize marketing as a major driver behind company growth and development.McKinsey (Mar, 2020)13.6 percentThe percentage by which the marketing technology landscape has grown from 2019 to 2020, with a total of 8,000 MarTech solutions now available.Chiefmartec (Nov, 2020)Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Digitization in the field of marketing continues to intensify the need for businesses to develop a strategic, consolidated and collaborative approach to marketing technology. Forward-thinking organizations are recognizing the value in teaming marketing efforts with key technologies to create a seamless customer journey and strengthen their marketing imperatives. As its popularity grows, so does the potential to overwhelm users with various MarTech tools which, if used incorrectly, becomes an ineffective and costly expense. It is, therefore, vital that professionals approach their MarTech strategy with the in-depth knowledge to leverage MarTech in their context. Human insight and oversight are essential to ensuring that the MarTech stack is used successfully.The MarTech: Leveraging Data and Technology in Marketing online short course from Medill at Northwestern University focuses on the six key components of marketing technology: advertising and promotion, content and experience, data and infrastructure, commerce and sales, customer relationship management and governance. It also offers key insights from contemporary case studies and expert guest lecturers in the industry. Over six weeks, you will explore how to combine and leverage MarTech stack capabilities and potential within your organization. At the end of the course, you will apply your learnings to develop a unique, innovative and forward-thinking MarTech business roadmap.Is this course for you?This online short course is for professionals who recognize the need to establish an all-encompassing view of marketing technology and how it impacts an organization’s bottom line. Whether you are a marketing professional or senior business leader, this course will provide you with vital skills to harness dynamic marketing strategies, grow your business and enhance the customer journey. If your role is advertising-related, this course provides a vital stepping stone toward becoming a skilled marketing technologist. If you primarily work with technology, you will benefit from expert insight, useful templates and tools for solving real-world business challenges using dynamic marketing strategies.

title: Real Estate Financial Analytics
about: Learn how to leverage quantitative analytical techniques and financial modeling to inform real estate investment decisions and risk.
University name: MIT School of Architecture and Planning
Course overview: Course overviewOver $450 billionThe commercial property deal volume for the first three quarters of 2021 — the first time it's reached such a high level.Real Capital Analytics (Oct, 2021).$1 trillionThe US commercial real estate market size.Ibis World (Oct, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Changing tenant expectations, sustainability concerns, and where people choose to live due to work-from-home protocols are reshaping the commercial and residential real estate markets. It requires data and quantitative analysis skills to predict the full impact of this on the property sector, and investment and development decisions. The Real Estate Financial Analytics online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P) will enable you to transform uncertainty (‘unknown unknowns’) into risk (‘known unknowns’). You’ll gain the technical skills and tools to assess the viability of residential and commercial real estate investments using rigorous analysis techniques, simulation modeling, and financial modeling. This six-week program introduces real estate price dynamics and teaches you to quantitatively model them using Microsoft Excel, in order to understand some of the challenges of real estate price indexing. It also explores the lure and limitations of forecasting and how to make more accurate predictions using Monte Carlo simulation. In addition, you’ll explore how flexibility in the context of uncertainty can add value to investments, as well as assess the quantitative and qualitative value of real estate investment decision flexibility using simulation modeling. With guidance from MIT academics and industry experts, you’ll discover the potential for new financial engineering tools based on real estate price indexing.Is this course for you?This program is designed to help equip finance and built environment professionals with the knowledge and techniques to navigate real estate investment decisions successfully. Whether for personal investment management or in a professional capacity, this course aims to provide you with the skills and tools to make better recommendations and projections, identify high-return investments, and build an enduringly strong portfolio.Business leaders, financial executives, real estate entrepreneurs, developers, and fund managers and advisers will build on their current skill set, and gain insight into the latest investment trends and structures. Analysts — especially those looking to hone in-demand, specialist real estate expertise — will benefit from the expert thought leadership in areas such as property price dynamics and valuation in the capital market. Due to the technical nature of this course, it’s best suited to those with existing knowledge of finance or economic analysis and experience using Microsoft Excel.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Real estate price dynamics', 'Module 2': 'Tracking real estate prices: Indexes and performance', 'Module 3': 'The forecast is ‘always’ wrong', 'Module 4': 'Simulation modeling for real estate investment', 'Module 5': 'Valuing flexibility in real estate', 'Module 6': 'The real estate financial analytics frontier: The case of index-based derivatives'}
Convenors: {'David Geltner': ['Emeritus Professor of Real Estate Finance, MIT Department of Urban Studies and Planning; Associate Director of Research, MIT Center for Real Estate\n', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBMQT09IiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--ea54a1e136918f245cb3bf83af523c74a77e015e/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/mit_sap_commercial_real_estate_analysis_and_investment_course_convenor_david_geltner.jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['The skills to use quantitative techniques and financial modeling to understand real estate price dynamics.', 'Insight into leveraging investment flexibility to manage and take advantage of uncertainty.', 'The ability to interpret Monte Carlo simulation analysis to determine risk and return in real estate investment decisions.', 'Statistical analysis techniques to inform real estate investment decision making, and the knowledge to assess the financial viability of residential and commercial investments.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']

Learn how to analyze the financial risks and opportunities of the real estate marketplace, and earn an official MIT SA+P digital certificate.

title: Digital Marketing and Media Strategy
about: Gain the tools to develop a digital media strategy that combines an integrated, audience-first approach with timeless marketing principles.
Course overview: Course overview44.8%The amount of internet users who turn to social media when searching for brand information.Datareportal (Jan, 2021).$4.89 trillionThe expected size of the global e-commerce market in 2021.Shopify (May, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)The rapid evolution of the modern digital environment is widely recognized. From its nascent beginnings, the digital media landscape has grown exponentially. Today, brands must fight to be heard amongst a plethora of competitors and new platforms are emerging at an increasingly rapid speed. Marketing in this environment poses unique challenges, as it becomes necessary to adapt to new circumstances seemingly on the fly.The Digital Marketing and Media Strategy online short course from Medill at Northwestern University equips you to face the modern media landscape by arming you with timeless principles of media strategy. These tools are highly adaptable, offering an integrated, audience-first approach to creating strategies that deliver on objectives and priorities. With guidance from Northwestern Medill faculty and industry experts, you will gain the ability to anticipate new challenges and seize new opportunities in digital media. You will learn to create your own digital media strategy, based on your newly informed understanding of the advantages and opportunities of various approaches and media marketplaces.Is this course for you?This course is broadly applicable to a variety of roles and skill levels. If you are a marketing professional, the course will provide you with new tools for adapting to changes in the media landscape. If you currently work adjacent to the marketing space and are interested in switching careers, you will gain formal skills and the opportunity to validate your experience. If you lead or own a small business and do not have the budget for a dedicated marketing function, then this course will provide you with the understanding needed to build an effective digital marketing strategy for your organization.
