title: Entrepreneurial Finance
about: Turn ideas into action. Gain insight into the mechanics of business evaluation and learn how to pitch your business concept in the real world.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview$288 billionThe all-time high amount attributed to global venture funding in the first half of 2021.Crunchbase (Jul, 2021).65%The percentage of Generation Z currently in the workforce who expect to start their own businesses in the next 10 years.EY (Apr, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
Shifting attitudes, new technologies, and a growing investment landscape are creating the ideal habitat for start-ups, yet two out of three entrepreneurial endeavours don’t succeed.1 Two major reasons for failure are cash depletion and the inability to secure financing or investor interest. Capital investment is available – as can be gleaned from the record $8 billion invested in UK technology sector start-ups – but it’s up to entrepreneurs to ensure that they have the skills to negotiate and pitch their ideas in order to secure funding from the right investors at the right time.2 Similarly, investors who are looking to capitalise on the budding start-up market require the insight to effectively evaluate business opportunities in order to make sound financing decisions.
The Entrepreneurial Finance online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) is designed to address both sides of the investment paradigm. Over six weeks online, you’ll learn to critically evaluate business opportunities and explore how to match financing needs with the most appropriate investor type. You’ll be given top tips from industry experts on how to negotiate with investors and sell your business concept. By the end of this functional six-week course, you’ll learn how to develop an effective pitch deck to prepare for real-life pitch scenarios.
1 HBR (Jun, 2021).2 Financial Times (Mar, 2021).
Is this course for you?This course focuses on both the investment and entrepreneurial paradigms within the venture capital sector. As a result, it’s aimed at a broad spectrum of professionals who wish to better navigate the funding and business evaluation aspects of entrepreneurship. If you’re a current or aspiring entrepreneur who would like to effectively pitch business ideas and learn how to access funding, this course will provide you with the tools and strategies to do so. As an executive or business owner, you can use the insights gained on this course to guide other entrepreneurs or invest in start-ups. This course will also appeal to those interested in pursuing a career in venture capital, as well as investors who are looking to upskill themselves.This Entrepreneurial Finance online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 60 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Teaching Certificate: The Science of Social and Emotional Learning
about: Harness essential Social and Emotional Learning techniques to create an enhanced teaching and learning experience.
University name: School of Education and Social Policy
Course overview: Course overview$3.9 billionThe amount that the Social and Emotional Learning market is expected to grow by 2025.Markets and Markets (July 2020).94%The percentage of elementary school educators who claim their efforts to promote SEL techniques will help improve their students’ academic achievement.Rand (2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)In an increasingly fast-changing and diverse world, the role of social and emotional skills is more important than ever. Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) provides a foundation for positive, long-term effects in children, adults, and communities. People with strong social-emotional skills are better able to cope with everyday challenges and benefit academically, professionally, and socially. The Teaching Certificate: The Science of Social and Emotional Learning* from Northwestern University’s School of Education and Social Policy will give you  the tools to effectively plan classroom experiences that promote self-awareness, self-management, social awareness, relationship-building, and decision-making through an equity and trauma-informed lens. Throughout this online short course, you’ll learn how SEL can help mitigate stress, anxiety, and trauma while promoting well-being and improved social awareness. With an in-depth look at the key concepts of SEL, you’ll learn how to enhance the teaching and learning experience in your classroom practices.Over six weeks, you’ll develop a plan to implement SEL techniques in your educational context as you work towards earning a certificate of completion from a highly ranked education school.* This online short course does not constitute licensure. Is this course for you?The course is designed for all teachers, but particularly those at PreK-12 and PreK-16 levels. Educators from all backgrounds, including educational providers, professors, lecturers, researchers, and academic staff will benefit from the SEL insights in this course. The practical nature of the course benefits anyone with an interest in education, no matter the level. Professionals tasked with evaluating teachers in relation to SEL will also be equipped with the knowledge and tools to do so.

title: Rotman Leading Strategic Change
about: Implement small and large-scale, sustainable change in your organization.
Course overview:
Program overviewGet financial aidThe Ontario Student Assistance Program (OSAP) offers funding to qualifying Canadian citizens.Rotman Financial Assistance (2022).61%The share of business leaders who plan to implement a major transformation initiative over the next year.EY Global (Mar, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)It’s widely accepted that change is the only constant. But for your organization to benefit from change, its implementation needs to be strategic.Learn how to develop sustainable change initiatives with the Rotman Leading Strategic Change online program from the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto. By examining the concepts underpinning strategic change, and what it takes to create, implement, and maintain the necessary actions, you’ll be equipped to design a strategic change initiative (SCI) for your business context. Over six weeks, you’ll focus on various change initiatives with each module covering the specific technique or system involved, such as role modeling, leveraging personal networks, management resistance, and designing mechanisms for sustainable change.Is this program for you?
This program reinforces that leaders across all levels of an organization can guide a change initiative. The design of this program will be beneficial to mid- and senior-level managers and leaders involved in a current or future change initiative. The program also applies to change management and other professionals at the individual contributor level. This includes analysts, specialists, and consultants acting in an advisory capacity to help initiate and implement organizational change.

title: Fintech and the Future of Finance: Blockchain, Cryptocurrencies, Govcoins and the Payments Revolution
about: Understand how the financial system works, why it is open for disruption, and who is competing and co-operating in this contested space.
Course overview: Course overview$31.9 billionThe amount payments companies raised in investments in 2021.Payments Dive (2021).79%The percentage of UK consumers that regularly make use of fintech applications for banking and payments.Raconteur (Nov, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)The fintech industry has become increasingly competitive—caught between the disruptive startups and big-tech companies that are shaking things up and the giants of finance who are protecting their turf. You need to understand fintech disruption before truly capturing its opportunities.Economist Education’s Fintech and the Future of Finance: Blockchain, Cryptocurrencies, Govcoins and the Payments Revolution online short course examines the future of this industry, with a focus on debunking common myths and misconceptions. From the birth of cryptocurrencies to the transformation of payments, this course examines the tech and business models set to impact the sector—as well as those that should be approached with scepticism. You will learn how to see past jargon and technical complexity to understand how financial technologies work and what they can do for you. Over six weeks, you will be guided through key fintech trends by The Economist’s Matthieu Favas, an authoritative source on finance. With sights set firmly on the future, you will assess the outlook for fintech and how new technologies could turn the world of money upside down.Is this course for you?This course is designed for professionals in the finance and technology sectors looking to better understand the fintech landscape and the technologies disrupting it. This includes those in management and leadership positions in charge of making decisions about adopting financial technologies. The course will also benefit business owners or entrepreneurs who are already running or are interested in starting a fintech business.

title: Economics for Business
about: Identify the economic forces shaping your business and make informed decisions that drive change.
Course overview: Course overviewMacroeconomics and business"An understanding of macroeconomics is fundamental to acting responsibly in industry, government, and as an individual."– Roberto Rigobon, Faculty Director6 yearsIt takes entrepreneurs this much longer to start a business in the bottom 50 ranked economies as opposed to the top 20.World Bank Group (2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Large-scale economic trends can profoundly affect businesses of all sizes, whether it’s inflation, governmental policy, or changes in market demand. For contemporary organizations to remain competitive, executives must account for the impact in their strategic decision making. The Economics for Business online program from MIT Sloan offers you the opportunity to explore economics from a business perspective, guided by renowned economist Professor Roberto Rigobon. You’ll be exposed to an engaging mix of case studies, narratives, and problem-solving activities designed to build your understanding of macroeconomics. On completion, you’ll be able to apply your knowledge to interpret and manage economic change within your organization.Is this course for you?The program is geared toward business professionals and leaders looking to understand the influence of economic trends on business, and who are seeking tools, concepts, and models to inform their decision making. Aspiring managers and executives with decision-making responsibilities stand to benefit from an understanding of the broader business environment. The cross-industry applications of macroeconomics is beneficial for business professionals aiming to enhance their knowledge of economic trends and advance within their career.

title: Technological Disruption: Managing the Impact on Business, Society and Politics
about: Develop the tools to lead effectively through the disruptive innovations that are reshaping the fabric of business and society.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview: Course overview55%The amount of professionals from high-growth companies who are highly concerned about the ethical ramifications of technology.Deloitte (2020).23%The expected portion of all information and communications technology spending that is expected to be devoted to new technologies by 2023.International Data Corporation (Nd). Accessed 20 October 2020.Duration: 8 weeksDisruptive technology has led to significant changes in the way we live and work, particularly over the past 20 years. For business, the large-scale adoption of artificial intelligence (AI), robotics, and even social media demands new focus on innovation and adaptability to rapidly evolving global markets.The Technological Disruption: Managing the Impact on Business, Society and Politics online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) is designed to provide you with the tools to develop a strategic response to disruptive innovation. On the course, you’ll engage with a network of like-minded professionals, as you investigate the impact of rapid technological change in modern economies and societies. Through a broad lens, you’ll discover the impact of technology on economics and competitive policy, business models, and the fundamental processes which drive society, including the democratic process itself. Drawing on insights from leading LSE faculty representing a diverse range of disciplines, you’ll learn to identify disruptive technologies, their organisational implications, and deploy a strategic response.Is this course for you?This online certificate course is designed for leaders and professionals seeking to understand the role of technological disruption in their sector. It offers insights into innovation and disruption for managers interested in developing a strategic response to new technologies. Policy professionals and public sector workers will have the opportunity to explore how legislation and policy are used to address disruption, while consultants will benefit from an expanded understanding of technologies such as AI, automation, and robotics, and the impact of these technologies on their industries. Finance and marketing professionals will learn how technology is already changing their industries, and will gain strategies for response. Executives will be able to examine the risks associated with global technology competition, and how these can be navigated. IT professionals will learn how to spot the vulnerabilities of innovation, and how they lead to negative outcomes including fraud and cybercrime.

title: Inclusive Leadership Through Behavioural Science
about: Discover how behavioural science can be leveraged to create and lead a more inclusive organisation.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview90%The percentage of organisations executing at least one DEI action. Yet over a third of these institutions don’t have a strategy in place to monitor these initiatives.Workday (2021).1 in 3Employees who say leadership and commitment from the top is needed to make more progress on DEI initiatives.Workday (2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
Increased movement and mobility of people has accelerated cultural diversity in the workforce. Organisations and leaders are positioned to ensure that employees – no matter their race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or religion – are treated fairly. But in reality, ideas, intent, and action are often disconnected.
Inclusion in today’s workplace is an important measure that directly impacts not only the balance sheet, but talent retention. If, and when, employees don’t feel heard, accepted, or truly valued, they’re far less likely to remain at a company. In one study, employees who identified as ‘different’ were shown to experience greater burnout and felt a lesser sense of belonging.1 With trends like the great resignation in full swing, employers are in crisis mode trying to resolve the retention issues upending the job market.2 But increased pay and elevated role titles aren’t enough, inclusion is the essential third factor, and it starts with leaders who build well-being and openness into their organisation’s DNA.
This eight-week course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) provides you with insights from behavioural science that will enable you to create a more resilient and collaborative organisation. Leveraging an inclusive approach to leadership, you’ll learn how to implement practical and effective solutions to problems caused by entrenched bias, heuristics, and groupthink. With insights from Dr Grace Lordan, founder of The Inclusion Initiative (TII) at LSE, you’ll develop keen interpersonal and relational skills to improve search and hiring processes, mitigate poor conduct, and ensure career opportunities across the board.
1 OC TANNER (2021).2 SHRM (2021).
Is this course for you?This online certificate course is designed for managers who would like to better understand and lead their teams, and are interested in the behavioural science approach (which focuses on motivations, group dynamics, and attitudes) to overcoming barriers to inclusion. Leaders will gain the tools to create an inclusive organisational culture that promotes fair opportunities, while driving meaningful conversations about DEI in the workplace. Human resources professionals and project and operations managers with the intention of becoming an expert on DEI will gain the knowledge to improve their professional and leadership skills to foster inclusion and well-being in their teams. In addition, anyone who would like to shift their career focus and transition into the DEI space may use this course as a stepping stone towards a new position in this crucial area.This Inclusive Leadership Through Behavioural Science online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 70 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

Learn to use behavioural science as a leadership tool for inclusivity, and earn an official certificate of competence from the London School of Economics and Political Science.

title: Understanding Discrimination
about: Gain a holistic understanding of discrimination and learn how it can be addressed for the benefit of individuals, organisations, and society.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview20%The amount by which more diverse organisations are able to outperform their less diverse peers in measures of innovation.WEF (Jun, 2020).
75%The percentage increase by which companies perceived as diverse are more likely to report a pro-teamwork leadership culture.McKinsey (May, 2020).
Duration: 3 weeksDespite an increasing focus on diversity and inclusion, discrimination is still prevalent in modern organisations and society at large. In order to affect change in the world and in the workplace, it’s vital to understand what discrimination means, how it manifests, and how it can be overcome.
To play their part in challenging systemic bias and inequity in the workplace, professionals in every industry and sector need to learn how to address discrimination in their realm of influence. The Understanding Discrimination three-week online course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) will empower you with a deeper understanding of the political, social, and economic sources that drive discrimination against minorities. You’ll gain a unique social science perspective on the issue of discrimination, the different types of discrimination and how to measure it, as well as develop the understanding to inform future policy discussions and decisions.
This highly topical and applicable master class provides you with expert, high-quality insights from world-leading LSE faculty, industry experts and guest speakers, and enables you to understand and participate in one of the most pressing academic and social debates of our time.
Is this course for you?This course is uniquely designed to offer anyone with an interest in understanding discrimination the tools and knowledge from the social sciences to develop an awareness of its nuances and complexities. Those in a position of leadership or management looking to foster collaboration and inclusion in their organisation or sector will gain a better understanding of diversity initiatives and what commonly causes them to fail. Professionals working in government or policy will benefit from a broader perspective on the problem of discrimination, and learn how this informs policy discussions and decisions. Additionally, professionals in the media industry will be exposed to valuable knowledge and insights that will enhance their ability to analyse events from different perspectives and provide a more accurate analysis of the many examples of discrimination around the world.
What will set you apart: ['An in-depth understanding of how discrimination manifests and why it should be addressed.', 'Methods and approaches to effectively measure discrimination.', 'Practical strategies for addressing discrimination during hiring and promotion.', 'The ability to explore discrimination in your personal context, share reflections and experiences, and engage with participants from around the globe.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.', 'Work through your downloadable and online instructional material', 'Interact with your peers and learning facilitators through discussion forums', 'Enjoy a wide range of interactive content including videos, podcasts, quizzes, and more ', 'Develop an essential skill set to apply immediately in your context and career', 'Apply what you learn throughout this master class experience and broaden your understanding of discrimination with targeted, expert-led insights.']
About the certificate: Validate your skills online with an official digital badge from the London School of Economics and Political Science.

title: Rotman Blockchain and Decentralized Finance
about: Gain the necessary knowledge and practical tools to navigate a changing financial system.
Course overview: Program overviewGet financial aidThe Ontario Student Assistance Program (OSAP) offers funding to qualifying Canadian citizens.Rotman Financial Assistance (2022).$67.4 billionThe amount the global blockchain market is expected to reach by 2026.Markets and Markets (Nov, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)The financial sector has long been defined by strict regulations and traditional processes. Yet, despite the barriers to entry, a growing number of firms are migrating toward blockchain and decentralized finance (DeFi), which are revealing themselves  to be reliable, efficient ways for financial institutions to carry out daily operations.The Rotman Blockchain and Decentralized Finance online program from the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto examines which traditional financial services these financial technologies are set to offer the most benefits. You’ll also explore opportunities and assess the potential risks of managing and integrating blockchain into your business. This program consists of six weekly modules, covering fintech topics such as crypto-wallets, digital money and stablecoins, and oracles. Business owners and entrepreneurs who are wanting to launch ventures in the decentralized finance space will also benefit. This program will present blockchain technology as an alternative to traditional financial systems and will be useful to those wanting to learn about the alternative opportunities blockchain technology presents for them or their business.  It’s encouraged that participants have a mid-level understanding of investing terms and processes to get the most out of this program, but a formal background in finance is not required.

title: Real Estate Investment and Development
about: Identify and analyze the commercial viability of real estate investments and developments.
Course overview: Course overview$500 billionThe amount that U.S. commercial real estate transaction volumes are estimated to reach in 2021.Urban Land Institute (May, 2021).5.8%The share of GDP accounted for by commercial and residential construction in the U.S., equal to $1.11 trillion.The Balance (Jun, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Despite the economic turbulence of the past decade, the real estate industry in the U.S. has only gone from strength to strength in recent years. In this online short course from Rice University’s Jones Graduate School of Business, gain an introduction to the current commercial real estate and property development market. By examining the real estate ecosystem from a holistic perspective, you’ll unpack the fundamental skills necessary to facilitate informed commercial real estate investment and development decisions.Over the course of eight short weeks online, you’ll learn to assess the feasibility of property investments, explore the concepts and techniques used to analyze commercial real estate assets and discover the instruments commonly used to finance these assets. You’ll also learn to personally analyze and identify commercially viable real estate for development.Is this course for you?This online short course is designed for both property developers and entrepreneurs who want to identify and analyze the viability of real estate investments and developments. It is beneficial for real estate agents, brokers and property managers who want to deepen their knowledge of the commercial real estate ecosystem. Finance professionals will gain a holistic understanding of the specific financial tools and techniques required to assess the feasibility of an investment.

title: Fintech: Disruption in Finance
about: Equip yourself for the future of finance with an understanding of today’s most important fintech innovations, and learn to fund your own disruptive business idea.
Course overview:
Course overview82%The majority of total fintech investment in Africa belongs to Egypt, Kenya, Nigeria, and South Africa.WT (Jan, 2021).31%The percentage of funding that African fintech start-ups received in 2020, pulling the largest investment within the continent’s tech industry.Quartz Africa (Jan, 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
As a result of inaccessible banking services, a large small-to-medium business sector, and growing populations, emerging markets have begun to find new solutions to long-standing financial pain points.1 Fintech has risen to the challenge and aims to address, disrupt, and innovate the current financial landscape.The University of Cape Town (UCT) Fintech: Disruption in Finance online short course prepares you to better understand, interpret, and respond to the disruptions and opportunities within the financial market. With a holistic approach to the financial industry, this course provides you with an overview of the main fields of technological disruption, such as blockchain, artificial intelligence (AI), and big data. You’ll develop the ability to identify financial problems and apply fintech solutions within the context of emerging markets. The course will enable you to refine your disruptive business ideas and develop a funding strategy to get your fintech start-up off the ground. You’ll walk away with the knowledge and skills to make more strategic business decisions, unlock new career opportunities, and prepare for fintech innovation within your organisation and beyond.1 McKinsey (Sep, 2020).
Is this course for you?This course is aimed at financial professionals and graduates looking to unlock new career opportunities, embrace innovation in their current roles, and remain relevant in an industry that is being increasingly changed and driven forward by fintech. The content is aimed at students who want to take their business idea to the next level – into action. It’s also suited to business decision makers who are eager to prepare for the future and make more informed strategic choices. No prior knowledge of fintech is required.

title: Oxford Leading Through Uncertainty and Disruption: Building Resilient Organisations Programme
about: Discover how organisational resilience can generate a competitive advantage and long-term sustainability for your business.
Course overview:
Programme overview70%The percentage of CXOs who lack confidence in their organisation’s ability to pivot and adapt to disruptive events.Deloitte (2021).52%The reported decrease in burnout experienced by leaders with higher resilience.BetterUp (2020). Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
The turbulent nature of the modern business environment requires a strategic perspective on sustainable solutions to ensure an organisation’s survival and success. By developing resilience, leaders can enable their enterprises to effectively anticipate, prepare, and respond to uncertainty – allowing them to not only bounce back but bounce forward and thrive.
Learn how to navigate disruption at an individual, business, and systemic level with the Oxford Leading Through Uncertainty and Disruption: Building Resilient Organisations Programme. Over the course of six weeks, you'll focus on Programme Director Eleanor Murray's exclusive 6S framework, and explore how to build resilience within the concepts of self, strategy, structures, social elements, supply chains, and systems. Using this framework, you’ll develop the skills to integrate a holistic approach to resilience throughout your organisation's business strategy and operations, identify ways to build resilient relationships with stakeholders, and lead effectively through disruptions.
Gain the support structures and networks to strengthen your ability to thrive as a leader through long-term volatility, and walk away with a strategic plan for building resilience to ensure the sustainability and longevity of your organisation.
Is this programme for you?This programme is designed for leaders across industries, in private business, public organisations, non-profits, and governments, with the need to enhance their organisation’s ability to effectively adapt and respond to uncertainty. Those in senior leadership or C-suite roles who need to remain competitive and want to ensure their organisation’s longevity will benefit from this programme. Additionally, these professionals will discover how to leverage disruption for new opportunities and ultimately strengthen their organisation’s ability to thrive in the face of new challenges. Human resource managers, resilience professionals, and organisational design leaders who are responsible for improving the operational resilience of their companies will also gain valuable tools and techniques to aid them in these objectives.This Oxford Leading Through Uncertainty and Disruption: Building Resilient Organisations Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The programme has an estimated 60 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Self: Advancing resilient leadership', 'Module 2': 'Strategy: Developing your strategic resilience', 'Module 3': 'Structures: Building operational resilience', 'Module 4': 'Social: Reinforcing social resilience', 'Module 5': 'Supply chains: Strengthening supply chain resilience', 'Module 6': 'Systems: Maximising systems-wide resilience'}

What will set you apart: ['The ability to build organisational capacities, capabilities, and cultures that enable your business to positively respond to, and thrive in, changing conditions.', 'The skills to strengthen your resilience as a leader, empowering you to effectively lead through uncertainty.', "The knowledge to recalibrate your organisation's approach and implement resilience into your business strategy.", 'A practical plan for enhancing your organisation’s resilience, using exclusive Oxford Saïd frameworks as well as insights from global thought leaders and industry experts. ', 'Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']

Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the programme handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the programme.

Focusing on developing skills to anticipate disruption and respond in a way that allows my team and organisation to bounce forward. The programme content and material was relevant to today's challenges and the support was fantastic. For anyone looking to explore developing as a leader in today's climate, I highly recommend the programme."}

title: Human-Computer Interaction for User Experience Design
about: Inform your user experience design with cutting-edge HCI concepts.
University name: MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory
Course overview: Course overview75%The percentage of consumers that expect companies to leverage emerging technologies, including artificial intelligence (AI) and voice search, for their customers.Salesforce (Jan, 2020).$7.6 billionThe projected size of the global market for human-machine interface solutions by 2025.GlobeNewswire (Sep, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) has evolved extensively over time. Along with advancements in technology, HCI has the potential to transform our experience with machines by creating simpler, more powerful, and intuitive digital experiences.The Human-Computer Interaction for User Experience Design online short course from the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL) helps you reflect on the current state of user and computer interaction. Eight experts from MIT CSAIL have dedicated their research efforts to exploring the ways in which HCI can be enhanced, and they’re opening that research up to you through this online course so you can apply it for improved user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design.Guided by their industry insight, you’ll have the opportunity to imagine the future of HCI by reflecting on non-traditional interaction, speech recognition, and rapid prototyping, among others. Over the course of six weeks online, you’ll examine real-world applications of technology aimed at bettering UX and UI design, as you take your understanding beyond interface by integrating future-focused HCI into your work.Is this course for you?This program is designed to equip those who are interested in understanding the latest HCI research as part of their professional education, or are looking to explore a new career in human-computer interaction. Industry UX designers also stand to benefit by exploring HCI thinking and real-world applications, empowering them to conceptualize better interface designs.

title: Social Media Strategy: Creating Engagement, Insight, and Action
about: Gain an understanding of the science behind social media to optimize your social media strategy.
Course overview: Course overview4.33 billionThe total number of people using social media globally.Hootsuite (Apr, 2021). 490 millionThe number of people who started using social media for the first time between January 2020 and January 2021.We Are Social (Jan, 2021). As social media evolves, it provides organizations with new and exciting ways to share their message and engage their audiences. However, to drive real action, they need to understand the science behind social media and the key to harnessing it effectively for business success.The Social Media Strategy: Creating Engagement, Insight, and Action online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management offers an in-depth look into the forces driving social media and how you can use them strategically to reach your organization’s goals. Drawing on Sinan Aral’s book, The Hype Machine, you’ll gain an understanding of the technologies and trends impacting the social media landscape, as well as the neurological and economic factors that shape human behavior. Throughout this course, you’ll also learn about several powerful techniques to improve your social media marketing strategy. With guidance from MIT faculty and industry experts, you’ll walk away with the tools to leverage social media’s potential now and in the future. Is this course for you?The functional and strategic skills taught in this social media strategy course from MIT Sloan can be applied across any organization, both in the public or private sector. Business leaders and marketing professionals will all benefit from the various case studies featured throughout the program, as well as the practical frameworks for navigating today’s social media environment. It’s also relevant for NGOs, governments, policymakers, and influencers who wish to influence and engage their audience in an effective but ethical way.

title: Self-Driving Cars and the Future of Real Estate: Challenges and Market Opportunities
about: Develop an understanding of how mobility innovations will impact the future of real estate and learn to take advantage of the opportunities they create.
University name: MIT School of Architecture and Planning
Course overview:
Course overview35%The estimated percentage of shrinkage in land areas needed for parking due to autonomous vehicles and micro-mobility options.BCG (Jul, 2020).40+The number of major brands such as Google, Apple, and Mercedes Benz that are currently building autonomous vehicles.CB Insights (Jul, 2021).
Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
The real estate industry faces disruption as a result of mobility innovations that are dramatically changing where and how people work, live, and play. These innovations significantly impact the demand for and value of residential, commercial, and industrial properties at various locations in cities. Such demand dynamics, coupled with developers’ response, will determine the financial performance of real estate products and their asset value.
Gain the knowledge and tools to strategically leverage the real estate opportunities that new and future mobilities have to offer in the Self-Driving Cars and the Future of Real Estate: Challenges and Market Opportunities online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P). Throughout the program, you’ll develop a comprehensive understanding of the current industry state of autonomous vehicles, on-demand delivery, ride-sharing, and micro-mobility. Guided by MIT faculty and industry experts, you’ll also discover how mobility innovations are already transforming real estate products, as well as how self-driving vehicles will influence cities and the real estate market of the future. Develop the practical skills to prepare for and influence the rapidly evolving mobility landscape, and learn to identify opportunities and address real estate market problems.
Is this course for you?This program is aimed at individuals who are looking to upgrade their skills to meet the demands of their current role as well as a rapidly changing industry. Professionals in the built environment, urban planning, and logistics management industries who want to learn how artificial intelligence (AI) and self-driving vehicles will impact urban developments, last mile delivery, and their occupations will also benefit from this course. Those with a background in finance, investment, or real estate will develop an understanding of the innovations in mobility, discover how these impact the real estate landscape, and learn to identify opportunities and avoid pitfalls. Professionals in the IT sector will discover ways in which they can apply their skills to developing products that link autonomous vehicle technology to the real estate market.

title: Business Development Management
about: Gain the tools needed for successful business development and learn to create long-term value for your organisation.
Course overview: Course overviewDriving development“Growth is never by mere chance; it is the result of forces working together.”– James Cash Penney, Founder, JCPenneyHelpSquad (Aug, 2018).Lead growth through development"You will either step forward into growth or you will step back into safety.”– Abraham Maslow, Creator, Maslow’s hierarchy of needsThe Balance Small Business (Apr, 2019).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Business development varies from company to company. As a discipline, it has a wide-ranging scope of skills and focuses, but irrespective of the kind of industry or product, driving development impacts the growth and ultimately, the success of any business. The University of Cape Town (UCT) Business Development Management online short course explores the creation of long-term value over the three stages of business development: pre-sales, pitch, and post-sales. By engaging with case studies and focusing on practical outcomes, you’ll gain hard and soft skills and develop strategies to drive and sustain growth.Ultimately, by understanding the impact that business development holds for your business, you’ll become equipped to pursue long-term value creation for new and existing customers, products, and relationships.Is this course for you?This course has been created for professionals working in a business development, account management, or relationship management position. The content will also be helpful for anyone who wants to improve their negotiation and pitching skills, especially those responsible for achieving sales targets. Individuals aspiring to move into a business development role will also benefit by gaining formal university recognition. As a far-reaching discipline that covers a range of business areas, this course is fitting for all professionals regardless of their specific company or market.

title: Data Visualization With Tableau
about: Learn to present data effectively using the tools and techniques required for impactful data visualization.
Course overview:
Course overview48.5%The share of industry-leading firms that are reportedly driving innovation with data.NewVantage Partners (2021).Top 3Data quality, data visualization, and a data-driven organizational culture are the top three most important trends in business intelligence, analytics, and data management.Bi-Survey (January 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Data-driven insights are an increasingly valuable resource across industries. This has accelerated the demand for analytics professionals who can communicate complex data sets in a clear and visual way. The Northwestern Engineering Data Visualization With Tableau online short course provides the tools and insights to communicate data and uncertainty using a leading platform in data visualization and business intelligence.1 Over eight weeks, you’ll explore best practices and techniques grounded in cognitive psychology and graphic design, and learn how to select the right visualization technique to make data easier to understand for stakeholders at all levels. With guidance from expert faculty, you’ll learn to use data storytelling to improve organizational decision-making, while balancing operational goals.
1 Tableau (2021).
Is this course for you?Existing data analysts, business intelligence and functional analysts, and managers who are responsible for making data-driven decisions will find this Northwestern Engineering online short course useful. The content is specifically geared toward those who would like to further their careers in the sought-after field of data visualization. By expanding their practical Tableau skills and learning to effectively present and communicate data to non-technical audiences, data science professionals — whether experienced or new to the world of work — can effectively transmit data in a pictorial or graphical way to help uncover trends and inform decision-making.Please note: Basic data comprehension is required for this course. This includes a familiarity with tabular data (e.g., using Microsoft Excel) and basic statistical terms (e.g., mean, median, and mode).

title: Data Strategy and Management
about: Capitalize on the abundance of your data by selecting the right governance frameworks and monetization strategies to generate real business value.
Course overview:
Program overview$5.28 billionThe projected value of the data governance market by 2026.Mordor Intelligence (2022)17%The amount of surveyed companies that have established data monetization initiatives.Bi-Survey (2022)Duration: 5 weeks (excluding orientation)
As organizations become more digitized, data becomes more abundant. But many questions remain: how can companies best manage their data and leverage it for a competitive advantage in an ethical and strategic way?
In the Data Strategy and Management online program from IE University, you’ll get the answers to these questions by gaining the strategic frameworks to effectively manage your organization’s data. Over five weeks online, you’ll examine why data is a business asset that can be monetized, and build the skills to merge your business strategy and data strategy. Guided by industry experts and faculty from one of Europe’s leading higher-learning institutions,1 you’ll investigate the risks and ethics that influence your current and future data, and the importance of data governance. Finally, you’ll explore the opportunities that exist in the face of disruptive data-related technologies.
1IE University (2021).Is this program for you?This program helps C-suite executives discover how data can create business value, and what needs to be done to achieve this. Data and digital leaders will become better empowered to assess what is required to best manage data using different architectures and frameworks. Decision makers, managers, and consultants will increase their capabilities to develop, refine, and implement data strategies within organizations. The ethical governance aspect of the program is ideal for legal professionals searching for a framework to correctly handle data within their organizations.

title: Marketing Analytics: Strategy and Decision-Making
about: Enhance your digital marketing efforts by learning to harness data analytics and manage long-term, profitable customer relationships.
Course overview: Course overview$6.4 billionThe projected growth rate for marketing analytics by 2026; an increase from $3.2 billion in 2021.Globe Newswire (Jul, 2021).The digital analytics revolution“AI and analytics enable greater agility for consumer needs and help to effectively evaluate new ways to drive product innovation and market launch. Keeping the customer at the forefront – understanding consumer behaviour through analysis of social, internal, and external data – is key to drumming up effective customer engagement.” – Azmath Pasha, Chief Digital Officer, Paradigm TechnologyForbes (Oct, 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)The digital age provides businesses with a wealth of data about consumer choices. A major challenge organisations face, however, is an evident skills gap among marketing professionals to translate that information into meaningful and actionable insights. As a result, marketers are increasingly looking to engage, measure, adapt, and optimise every touchpoint of the customer experience. They need a strategy for their customer and performance data that moves in real time and at scale.The Marketing Analytics: Strategy and Decision-Making online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) addresses the why, where, and what of marketing analytics: Why is it needed, where are the main touchpoints, and what analytical techniques can be leveraged to drive marketing efficacy? Over eight weeks, you’ll answer these questions by exploring the current state of marketing analytics, including key challenges that restrict strategic choices. You’ll discover why big data has transformed marketing and learn how to design an analytics framework that leverages big data for marketing decision-making. Using a variety of real-world scenarios, you’ll engage with concepts and techniques to better understand your customers and create data-driven outcomes that optimise return on marketing investment. Finally, you’ll explore existing and proposed privacy frameworks, and the impact that emerging trends will have on the future of marketing.Is this course for you?This course is designed for anyone working in the field of marketing or aspiring towards a career in marketing analytics. It will also be beneficial to business leaders and C-suite professionals looking to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of their marketing departments to boost their bottom lines and stay ahead of competitors. Middle to senior managers looking to update their knowledge and move their career in a new direction will benefit from the real-world marketing scenarios discussed in the course. Newly qualified and existing marketing professionals who want to deepen their understanding of technologies, tools, and tactics will gain an expert-led skill set.

title: Leading the Future of Work
about: Learn how to adapt your organization for the future by leveraging technology, implementing high-road strategies, and empowering your workforce.
Course overview: Course overview50%The proportion of professionals who believe technology will be the dominant driver of change in the workplace in the next 18 months.GetSmarter (Sep, 2020).64%The majority of U.S. executives who believe that organizations should take the lead in closing the skills gap and preparing their employees for the future of work.McKinsey (Jan, 2020).Duration: 6 weeksThe world has experienced a fundamental shift in the business landscape. Automation and artificial intelligence (AI) are at the forefront of this, acting as the catalysts of workplace change. However, technology and business AI are only part of the evolution. The Leading the Future of Work online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management explores the various factors driving transformation and shaping the future of business design. It also highlights the role organizations, employees, government officials, and public policymakers must play in response to rapid change.  At the heart of it lies the need for a new social contract — the mutual expectations and obligations workers, employers and their communities, and society have for work and employment relationships. By developing a high-road business strategy that benefits employees and shareholders alike, you’ll be better positioned to stay ahead of your competitors while leading your business forward into the future.Is this course for you?This program will appeal to anyone interested in the future of work technology and design, and how key changes will impact their career or organization. Business leaders and managers will gain the confidence to make decisions and implement strategies that lead their firms toward the future. Those working in the public sector — such as policymakers, government officials, or members of civic institutions — can use their new skills to influence labor and work development policies. Consultants or specialists in HR transformation, organizational design, business agility, and change management will gain the tools necessary to drive change in their respective organizations and workforces.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'The current state of work: Challenges and opportunities', 'Module 2': 'The postwar social contract and the new world of work', 'Module 3': 'Partnering with the workforce to integrate new technology', 'Module 4': 'Managing work to benefit both labor and businesses', 'Module 5': 'Incorporating employee voice', 'Module 6': 'The future of work: Building a new social contract'}
Convenors: {'Thomas Kochan': ['George Maverick Bunker Professor of Management, Professor of Work and Organization Studies, and Co-Director, MIT Sloan Institute for Work and Employment Research', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBZzBLIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--f38b24c56686df1ccc3f34b495df3e3b9c4c3af9/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/mit_sloan_leading_the_future_of_work_course_convenor_thomas_kochan%20%20(1).jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['A leadership toolkit, as well as insight into the challenges and opportunities of the future of work.', 'The knowledge to strategically integrate technology into your organization.', 'High-road business strategies to lead your organization into the future and empower your workforce.', 'A practical understanding of the role companies, employees, government, and society play in shaping a new social contract.', '']
About the certificate: Explore the opportunities and challenges arising from the future of work and earn an official digital certificate of completion from MIT Sloan.This program also counts toward an MIT Sloan Executive Certificate, which you can earn upon completion of four programs where at least three of the four come from your chosen certificate track and at least one is completed in person. title: Rotman Cybersecurity: Leading Organizational Strategy
about: Discover the importance of creating and promoting a cyber-aware culture within your organization.
Course overview: Program overviewGet financial aidThe Ontario Student Assistance Program (OSAP) offers funding to qualifying Canadian citizens.Rotman Financial Assistance (2022).79%The percentage of organizations affected negatively by a lack of cyber preparedness.Mimecast (2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Even if your organization hasn’t already experienced a breach, it’s only a matter of time before it does. As cyberattacks rise rapidly in number and intensity, cybersecurity has become an enterprise-wide responsibility. Organizations need to understand what risks to prepare for and know how to manage attacks when they occur.The Rotman Cybersecurity: Leading Organizational Strategy online program from the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto aims to equip you with the tools to effectively oversee cybersecurity in your organization. Guided by industry experts, you’ll learn how to better prepare for and manage internal and external attacks. In addition, you’ll have the opportunity to create a custom action plan, empowering you to lead a cybersecurity strategy and foster a cyber-aware culture within your organization.Over six weeks, you’ll explore two simulations that will equip you with the first-hand experience needed to navigate through a cyberattack and implement and lead change management. Become fluent in the language of cybersecurity with a program designed for non-technical professionals.Is this course for you?The design of this program is well suited to non-technical leaders looking to develop a holistic understanding of the concepts and practices used in modern cybersecurity approaches. Those in a C-suite executive, director, or business leader role will develop insight into the organizational structure considerations required to lead cybersecurity strategies and use this knowledge to promote a culture of greater cybersecurity awareness in their business context. Senior or middle managers will benefit from learning how to better motivate for the adoption – or better implementation – of cybersecurity strategies and practices within their organizations. This program will also benefit consultants within the professional services sector by equipping them with in-depth cybersecurity knowledge that will help them assist their clients effectively.

title: Health Economics and Policy
about: Gain key insights into the economic principles governing global healthcare, and explore how effective policy can be used to address contemporary challenges.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview1 billionThe amount of people who will spend at least 10% of their household budgets on healthcare in 2020.United Nations (2020).3.9%The annual growth of global health spending between 2000 and 2017, compared to economic growth of 3%.World Health Organization (2019).Global healthcare is in transition. Since 2015, when the United Nations’ member states officially adopted the Sustainable Development Goals, global spending on healthcare has grown significantly. Unfortunately, low-income countries have lagged, managing only $41 per capita spent on health, compared to $2,937 in high-income countries.1 At the same time, advancement in technology has introduced new financial pressures, and healthcare labour markets are increasingly under threat.
The Health Economics and Policy online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) investigates the challenges facing healthcare and the economic principles that underpin the sector, while exploring policy proposals that could reduce inequality in the system. It’s been designed with faculty and experts from the Department of Health Policy at LSE, which aims to influence and improve how health policy is designed, implemented, and evaluated through multidisciplinary research and teaching. Experts from the Department have made substantive contributions to health planning and delivery on the global stage.
On the course, you’ll gain insight into healthcare financing and universal health coverage, and the complexities of the healthcare labour market. Ultimately, you’ll develop a balanced view of health and social justice, allowing you to assess healthcare’s inequalities and social determinants.
1 World Health Organization (2019).
This Health Economics and Policy online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 50 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.Is this course for you?This course is designed to provide you with the tools to understand the economics of the healthcare sector, and the policy solutions that can be used to address inequality. Professionals engaged in analysis, advocacy, and policy formulation will gain a contemporary understanding of healthcare economics, and its impact on topics including health funding and workforce dynamics. For those in the healthcare sector, this course will provide a global context on the state of the industry. The skills it teaches will prove beneficial to social scientists, public health specialists, and medical staff, whether working in health agencies, governments, or NGOs. For finance and economics professionals, this course offers insight into the economic challenges facing the healthcare sector. Participants will gain new perspectives on the economics of health insurance financing systems and the healthcare workforce, and how these can impact outcomes across contexts.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Economic principles applied to healthcare', 'Module 2': 'Health financing systems', 'Module 3': 'The healthcare labour market', 'Module 4': 'Paying healthcare providers', 'Module 5': 'The market for pharmaceuticals', 'Module 6': 'Health and social justice'}
Convenors: {"Who you'll learn from": ['Dr Laia Maynou-PujolrasLSE Fellow and Research Officer, Department of Health Policy, LSE', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBa1VLIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--9836b87b79425ff60e436a379206011891386f9e/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/lse_decision_making_judgements_biases_and_nudges_course_convenor_lse_logo.png']}
What will set you apart: ['An understanding of key economic principles governing the healthcare sector, such as supply and demand, and efficiency and equity.', 'A nuanced perspective on healthcare financing systems and how they can be utilised to realise true universal health coverage.', 'Insight into the complexities of the healthcare labour market, including workforce planning and forecasting, workforce shortages, and external shocks.', 'A balanced view of health and social justice based on assessing health inequalities and deconstructing the social determinants of health.', 'The ability to engage in discussions surrounding fairness in health delivery, alongside a network of experienced working professionals from the healthcare sector.']

Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Marketing
about: Learn how to develop and implement a holistic marketing strategy that incorporates industry best practice.
Course overview: Course overview39%The proportion of marketers who say that proving the ROI of their marketing activities is their top marketing HubSpot (2018).32%The percentage of marketing leaders who list market research and competitive insights as a top influencer when it comes to future budget allocation.Gartner (Oct, 2019). Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)In an increasingly competitive business environment, companies need to make use of the latest brand management and promotional tactics to differentiate their offerings and attract target customers. Professionals with strong marketing skills can, therefore, play an important part in boosting an organisation’s bottom line. The University of Cape Town (UCT) Marketing online short course covers the fundamentals of marketing management and offers a holistic view of this important field. You’ll learn how to set marketing goals, create buyer personas, and develop and implement a comprehensive strategy that incorporates digital marketing best practices while leveraging traditional channels. Throughout the course, you’ll receive detailed instruction from an engaged head tutor and have the chance to apply your learnings practically by making marketing decisions for a fictional business. Is this course for you?This course is designed for both current marketing and business development professionals who want to refresh their skills, and those looking for an introduction to the field. It’s also aimed at business owners and entrepreneurs who are eager to develop their marketing knowledge so they can better position and promote their own brand.

title: Startup Financing and Law
about: Develop the skills to navigate the legal and financial complexities of starting a new business.
Course overview:
Course overview32%The percentage of small business owners who consider lack of capital to be their biggest business challenge.Guidant Financial (2020).$136.5 billionThe amount invested by the venture capital industry in U.S.-based companies in 2019.NVCA (Jan, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks
For entrepreneurs, starting a business holds the promise of endless opportunity. But it also holds challenges that can stifle a new venture before it can realize its full potential. Understanding the challenges that a young business may face offers the best chance of building a sustainable company.
The Startup Financing and Law online short course from Northwestern Pritzker Law offers you the tools to establish a new venture. Designed to follow the natural life cycle of a new business, this course offers vital skills through a detailed, ongoing case study. You’ll engage with the legal aspects of entrepreneurship, learning to understand and select types of business entities, and navigate founders’ agreements, contract drafts, and trademark law. You’ll also learn to build a team based around clear business roles, and manage employment relationships. Finally, you’ll gain insights into financing your venture’s growth, including how to secure funding or future venture capital, in order to secure the long-term success of your business.
Is this course for you?If you’re an executive or senior manager interested in launching a new venture, this course will augment your management skills with an understanding of the legal and financial aspects of entrepreneurship. If you’re a seasoned professional, the course will offer you these same skills, while providing you with an understanding of people management as it relates to new businesses. The fundamental nature of this course makes it ideal across a broad range of industries: if you work in information technology, finance and banking, manufacturing, retail, and biotech and healthcare, this course will offer you new skills to pursue entrepreneurial opportunities. If you’re in the legal profession, the course will give you an overview of the financial and management knowledge needed to build a thriving business.

title: Technical Team Management
about: Tailor your leadership style to develop and support the unique needs of your technical team.
Course overview: Course overviewKey skills of aspiring tech leaders“We believe that technical skills are table stakes – successful team members must also be situationally aware, communicate well, and have the appetite for continual learning.” – Misti Fragen, Vice President of Learning for Digital Products and Services, Novant HealthThe Enterprisers Project (Jul, 2020).The value of upskilling technical teamsUpskilling technical teams can result in happier team members producing better quality work, and the opportunity to learn new skills without having to find a new job.Digital Leaders (Oct, 2020).Duration: 8 weeksRunning a technical team offers a unique set of management challenges. The demands, needs, and motivators held by technical staff are often underestimated in companies, resulting in high staff turnover. Furthermore, technical professionals are commonly encouraged to develop their technical skills at the expense of leadership and interpersonal skills. In order to retain these technical employees and ensure they are performing optimally, leadership approaches need to be tailored for a team’s effective development and growth. Enhance your leadership and soft skills on the Managing Technical Professionals online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT). Over eight weeks online, you’ll explore techniques that can be leveraged to improve team performance and innovation, and enhance career development opportunities for you and your direct reports. You’ll discover how to improve team dynamics, and manage change by cultivating effective communication channels, and strategic thinking. The course culminates in a team-specific and personal strategic action plan to help achieve organisational objectives.Is this course for you?This course aims to give existing or aspiring managers the ability to lead, support, and develop a team of technical employees, enhance their leadership skills and, by default, their careers. Due to its wide industry applicability, it can be relevant and beneficial to multiple technically-orientated roles and responsibilities, including, but not limited to, IT experts, developers, engineers, and data scientists. Although the areas of expertise are varied and diverse, the course addresses leadership and development needs that are common across differing management positions in an effort to upskill technical professionals for an increasingly complex and demanding workforce.

title: Leadership in an Exponentially Changing World
about: Gain the skills needed to strategically lead teams and reach company goals.
Course overview: Course overview72%The percentage of leaders who agree that their workforce’s capacity to adapt, reskill, and assume new roles is central to their company’s ability to navigate future disruptions.Deloitte (2021).2xThe margins of companies with a high capacity for change are double those of companies with a lower capacity for change.Bain & Company (Jun, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)A traditional approach to leadership is no longer sufficient in a world that is changing at an exponential rate. Leadership in the 21st century requires continuous learning and adaptation to the evolving landscape, new technologies, and shifting customer preferences.The Leadership in an Exponentially Changing World online program from the MIT Sloan School of Management provides new approaches for leading teams toward effectively reaching organizational goals by drawing on the 4-CAPS+ Leadership Framework, developed by Faculty Director Deborah Ancona and her colleagues at MIT. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll examine your leadership style and how to leverage others effectively — both inside and outside teams and organizations — to aid in successfully addressing and overcoming organizational challenges. At the end of this online program, you’ll leave with a digital certificate of completion from MIT Sloan and the executive leadership competencies to mobilize individuals toward change.Is this course for you?This MIT Sloan online course is designed for professionals looking to improve their leadership and management capabilities, while discovering their personal leadership style. Business leaders will expand and refine their current leadership knowledge, helping them facilitate innovation and adaptation and drive high-performance teams. Mid-level and senior managers will get a chance to engage with other professionals and develop their ability to lead teams more effectively, while meeting business objectives. Aspiring leaders will develop the confidence to demonstrate that they have the skills to lead.

title: Internet of Things: Business Implications and Opportunities
about: Build a business roadmap for successful tech integration.
Course overview:
Course overview95%The share of respondents who have seen a positive return on investment from IoT implementation.Vodafone (2020).11%The percentage of the world economy IoT could account for by 2025.The Economist (2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
The modern world is host to an enormous web of devices interconnected through sensors and networks — known as the Internet of Things (IoT). While the IoT has already made its presence felt in the home through smart appliances, it represents a rich opportunity for business.
The Internet of Things: Business Implications and Opportunities online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management steps beyond the bounds of technical jargon to help you learn about the potential benefits and impact of IoT adoption on an organizational level. Through case studies, interactive media, and peer-to-peer learning, you’ll develop an understanding of the technologies and conditions necessary for successful integration of IoT in a business context. Ultimately, you'll gain the skills and knowledge to create a practical roadmap for the real-world implementation of IoT, and earn a digital certificate of completion from MIT Sloan.
Is this course for you?This online program is ideal for managers and aspiring leaders looking to learn about the business opportunities that IoT can offer. Operations managers, entrepreneurs, and business analysts will benefit from understanding the impact and applications of IoT. Software engineers, data analysts, and IT engineers will learn to better communicate the benefits of IoT, while gaining methods for effective implementation.

title: Teaching With Technology
about: Explore the practical applications of teaching with technology at every phase, from primary school to higher education.
Course overview:
Course overview81%The percentage of teachers that see great value in using digital learning tools in the classroom.Gallup (2019).$404 billionThe amount that global edtech expenditure is expected to reach by 2025. HolonIQ (Aug, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks
As a result of accelerated global change, the integration of technology and education has become increasingly widespread. To excel in a modern classroom setting and the fast-evolving pedagogical landscape, educators need to adapt to new teaching and learning approaches to provide their students with an enhanced experience.
Discover how to incorporate technology into your classroom activities, lesson plans, and teaching strategies on the Teaching With Technology online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT). Guided by industry expert and associate professor Joanne Hardman, you’ll discover the history of technology as a teaching aid and develop the ability to initiate a pedagogical transformation using technology in your environment.
Explore highly practical and theoretical applications as you gain the tools you need to deliver excellent education to your students at every educational phase. Apply these learnings, not only in times of disruption, but throughout your career.
Is this course for you?The course is aimed at educators who are looking to improve their teaching skills and enhance the quality of the education they provide. Teachers and trainers interested in deploying technology and new pedagogical techniques into their teaching style will benefit from gaining the tools to build practical lesson plans and strategies. The flexible format of weekly modules and deadlines allows educators the opportunity to update their competencies around a busy schedule.

title: Public Policy Innovations
about: Understand public policy innovations and technology, and its strategies for transforming policymaking.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview: Course overview£22 billionThe annual increase in the UK government’s research and development investment.Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy (Jul, 2021). Learn to integrate"In a world of constant change, governments will need to be more intuitive, to sense and respond to new technology opportunities, social challenges, and citizen needs as they emerge."Deloitte (2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Policymakers face increasing challenges in public policy decision-making. Innovation and technology offer the potential to transform policymaking into something more efficient, equitable, and successful. While the possibilities for innovation are significant, professionals in these spaces require the skills and insight to execute them effectively. Understand innovation’s role in improving policy with the Public Policy Innovations online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE). Over eight weeks, you’ll explore the opportunities and pitfalls that different solutions present for the policy process. Armed with an understanding of these innovation tools, you’ll be empowered to propose new approaches to improve systems and navigate implementation. You’ll also learn how data can be used as a tool for policy innovation, and explore the opportunities and challenges technology like artificial intelligence presents for the public sector. Finally, you’ll leave the course with the skills to propose a new initiative to put policy innovations into practice.Is this course for you?This course is designed for public sector professionals interested in the cutting edge innovations associated with public policy and public management. Given the course’s operational and strategic nature, it’s relevant to anyone in government roles seeking ways to drive innovation. Policy professionals in consulting, advocacy, local government, and international development sectors will learn how modern policy innovations can benefit their division.
