title: Data Science: Text Analysis Using R
about: Learn how to extract business value from textual data through cutting-edge data science techniques.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview: Course overview80%The percentage of organisational data that is held in the form of text documents, including reports, web pages, emails, and call-centre notes. IBM (Jun, 2021).$16.46 billionThe predicted size of the global text analytics market by 2026, progressing at a compound annual growth rate of 17.8%.GlobeNewswire (Jul, 2021).Every business today generates a massive amount of textual information or data, through its marketing, reporting, and customer interactions via social media and email. The data science of text analysis helps organisations quantify this data, identify broad trends and priority areas, and garner competitive insights using machine learning.On the Data Science: Text Analysis Using R online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), you’ll gain a comprehensive, practical skill set for conducting effective text mining from start to finish. Guided by industry expert Professor Kenneth Benoit, you’ll learn how to prepare raw data, unpack and categorise it using clustering and topic modelling, conduct a sentiment analysis and evaluate document classification models, and apply these insights to social media data. You’ll also gain a grounding in Quanteda – an online library for deconstructing textual data, developed by Professor Benoit himself. Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll engage with a range of relevant case studies and real-world data sets, enhancing your ability to extract business-critical insights from textual data in your own organisation.This course is technical in nature and makes use of coding in R. Some algebraic and calculus knowledge is strongly advised, but is not required. Training in tertiary-level statistics and knowledge of a functional or object-orientated language are also advantageous. HTML is not considered a programming language in this context.Is this course for you?This is a technical course using R programming language, best suited to individuals with data or analytical proficiency. The skills and insights available to participants will have broad applicability and appeal across a range of industries and sectors. Existing data science and analytics professionals, including data analysts, software engineers, application developers, and computer scientists, will enhance their understanding of text mining, validate their skills in R, and gain the knowledge to stay ahead of the latest innovations in this field. Businesses, systems, and research analysts who work with reviews, transcripts, reports, articles, and social media on a daily basis will improve the efficiency and accuracy of their data analysis. IT technicians and systems analysts will expand their ability to effectively work with large volumes of organisational data in relation to information databases. Additionally, data-driven managers of teams in areas such as marketing, sales, operations, and project management will benefit from an improved understanding of text analysis. This Data Science: Text Analysis Using R online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 70 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Predictive Analytics in Business
about: Harness the benefits of predictive analytics to optimize business strategy and gain a competitive advantage.
Course overview:
Program overview95%The percentage of data that’s never dissected nor analyzed, as most business professionals are unaware of its potential.KPMG (Nd). Accessed December 14, 2021.99%The percentage of firms that are reporting investment in Big Data and AI initiatives to become more data-driven.New Vantage Partners (Jan, 2021).
Duration: 5 weeks (excluding orientation)
In today’s digital environment, data is a powerful tool available to all organizations. When harnessed correctly, data has the potential to drive decision-making, impact strategy formulation, and improve organizational performance. As a result, businesses that wish to maintain a competitive advantage can no longer forgo investing in data analytics.
Increase your ability to understand and interpret data in the Predictive Analytics in Business online program from IE University, Spain’s highest-ranked university.1 Over five weeks, you’ll develop an understanding of how predictive models can improve your ability to make decisions in a fast-paced business world. Leveraging the Cross-Industry Standard Process for Data Mining (CRISP-DM), you’ll gain an iterative approach to predictive analytics for business strategy, brought to life by real-world case studies. Guided by IE’s award-winning Dr. Rafif Srour Daher, you’ll learn to define business objectives, assess data quality, and action model outputs.
The program demonstrates the technical aspects of developing predictive models using Python. Activities are pre-populated with code, allowing you to engage with the technical process concepts without needing Python language proficiency. Some statistical, algebraic, and calculus knowledge is advised, but isn’t required.
1 IE University (2021).
Is this program for you?Relevant to analysts and analytics managers across industries, this program presents the opportunity to transform knowledge into impact and drive innovation at an organizational level. Professionals that require strong analytical skills in sectors such as operations and finance can benefit from this program’s qualitative focus. Business intelligence and functional analysts, including analytics managers in sectors such as marketing, finance, data, and business intelligence, will profit from the data-oriented approach. This program will also be advantageous to those wanting to develop predictive models using Python. Knowledge of a functional or object-oriented language is beneficial but not required.

title: Risk and Crisis Management
about: Develop an effective risk and crisis management strategy to better prepare your business for an uncertain future.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview: Course overview95%The share of business leaders who believe they need to improve their crisis management capabilities.PwC (2021).79%The percentage of board members that claim their organisations are not prepared to deal with a crisis event.EY (Apr, 2020).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Failing to acknowledge the possibility of unlikely events is often the reason many organisations are underprepared and ill-equipped when facing a crisis. Yet, if there’s one thing that businesses should take away from the COVID-19 global health crisis, it’s the critical need to have strategies in place for the likelihood of potential risks. The Risk and Crisis Management online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) is designed to equip you with accountability and responsibility strategies to mitigate the impact of unforeseen risks and crises in your organisation. Drawing on both private and public sector examples, the course provides you with an intensive, interdisciplinary perspective on the subject. Over eight weeks, you’ll learn from expert LSE faculty as you gain an in-depth understanding of key academic debates and central approaches to risk and crisis management to take forward into your current business strategies.Is this course for you?The design of this course is suited to professionals in a variety of industries across the corporate environment, and in the public and non-profit sectors. Any professional looking to move into the risk or crisis management space will benefit from an intensive introduction to this subject. Leaders and executives who want to play a more active role in managing risk within their businesses will benefit from improving their understanding of risk and crisis strategies. This course is also applicable to analysts and consultants who currently deal with risk management and want to optimise their skills.This Risk and Crisis Management online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 70 hours of learning.Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Higher Education Teaching Certificate
about: Refine your teaching practice by embracing reflective skills and updated methods.
Course overview:
Course overview9%The expected growth in postsecondary teaching positions in the United States by 2029.U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (Sep, 2020).$4.21 billionThe potential market growth of classroom management systems between 2021–2025. Technavio (Jan, 2021).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)Engage with effective postsecondary education teaching methods in this online short course, inspired by the in-person seminar program currently offered by Harvard’s Derek Bok Center for Teaching and Learning. The Harvard Bok Higher Education Teaching Certificate gives you the opportunity to reflect on your practices, portfolio, and teaching journey in this field. You’ll be exposed to the most relevant research on how students learn, and discover how to apply this insight in your own teaching context.Study pedagogical approaches through the lens of the higher education environment, including student engagement and classroom management. Use this opportunity to investigate reflective teaching methods and update your skills by adopting a more conscious, collaborative, and refined approach to your third-level education teaching practice.Is this course for you?
No matter what stage you’re at in your academic career, being an effective educator is key to progression and promotion. This online short course is designed for professors, lecturers, researchers, academic staff, or aspiring higher education teachers interested in improving their teaching practice, classroom management, and ability to meaningfully develop the mindsets of their students.
Teaching practice in the higher education field
Teaching practices are evolving. To stay ahead of the curve, it’s important to embrace reflective skills and update your methods regularly.
This online course is designed to help you refine your teaching practice by providing updated information on teaching methods, as well as opportunities to reflect on your own skills and performance. While you earn your premier certificate in this higher education teaching course, you’ll get the chance to network with other professionals in the field.
Whether you’re new to the field of higher education teaching or looking to refresh your skills, a higher education teaching course can be a valuable asset, with a certificate validating your teaching abilities.

title: Cybersecurity Leadership
about: Implement strategic cybersecurity initiatives and measures to protect the integrity, security, and confidentiality of your digital assets.
Course overview: Course overview46%The percentage of remote work employees worldwide who have had at least one cybersecurity scare since work-from-home protocols were introduced in 2020.Barracuda (May, 2020).36 billionThe number of records exposed by data breaches in the first three quarters of 2020.Risk Based Security (May, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)A significant number of cyber crimes are the result of human error. To mitigate this, organizational leaders need to adopt a holistic cybersecurity strategy and cyber-safe work culture that takes the latest technologies, people, practices, and procedures into account. The Cybersecurity Leadership online short course from Northwestern Engineering teaches professionals how to drive strategic cybersecurity initiatives. You’ll receive instruction from Todd Fitzgerald, a cybersecurity expert who has built and led Fortune 500 company information security programs for 20 years. Over six weeks, you’ll examine the technologies, laws, regulations, and policies that relate to cybersecurity, and learn how to foster a cybersecurity culture in your sphere of influence.Explore the measures your organization can take to build an innovative, cybersecurity-orientated workforce, and craft a plan for establishing strategic cybersecurity initiatives within your company.Is this course for you?This course is suited to those in leadership positions who are interested in implementing and leading cybersecurity strategies in their organization. Anyone in a management role looking to motivate the adoption or better implementation of cybersecurity strategies within their organizations will gain insight into the operational changes required. Chief information security officers (CISO), and those looking to move into a CISO position, will learn how they can align the cybersecurity-related motivations and goals of the individuals in their organizations. Additionally, consultants in the professional services industry will benefit from valuable insights and knowledge that will allow them to help their clients strengthen their cybersecurity strategies.

title: Diversity and Inclusive Leadership
about: Leverage diversity and inclusion to transform your business culture.
Course overview:
Course overview12%The improvement in employee performance between nondiverse and diverse organizations.Gartner (Sep, 2019).50%The percentage by which gender-diverse and inclusive teams outperform gender-homogeneous, less inclusive teams. Gartner (Sep, 2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
Advocating for inclusion enhances innovation, engagement and decision-making, but beyond business, building an inclusive workforce is essential to future equality.
The Diversity and Inclusive Leadership online short course from EGADE Business School at Tecnológico de Monterrey focuses on developing leaders to be effective in implementing and managing diverse and inclusive teams for the benefit of the business. Explore the way culture impacts team performance, and how diversity and inclusion affect the workplace, and uncover ways to interrupt biases and promote behaviors that foster an inclusive organizational culture.
Is this course for you?This course is designed for team leaders, managers and HR professionals interested in achieving true diversity and inclusion in their business. Those managing or building diverse teams will learn to increase their cultural competencies and diversity awareness, while HR professionals will develop the skills to champion an inclusive, supportive and unbiased company culture. Any professional who is interested in promoting equal opportunities and fair treatment for all employees will benefit from this course.





EGADE Business School has received the prestigious triple crown of international accreditation, from the three most highly influential organizations in global business education: the American Association of Colleges and Schools (AACSB), the Association of MBAs (AMBA) and the European Quality Improvement System (EQUIS). EGADE now belongs to the exclusive group of 1% of global business schools that have obtained these three accreditations.

title: Digital Transformation Strategy
about: Redefine your organization’s approach to digital transformation and lead measurable, value-driven innovation strategies.
University name: Yale School of Management Executive Education
Course overview:
Program overview72%The percentage of chief information officers who believe their organizations will radically change the way they interact with customers in the future.
Accenture (Nov, 2020).
$1,302.9 billionThe projected value that the digital transformation market is expected to reach by 2027.
Research and Markets (Jun, 2021).
Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)
The idea that digital transformation is key to business success isn’t new, but the urgency surrounding its adoption is. Industries are being disrupted by nimble start-ups who capitalize on advances in digital technology, requiring established organizations to play catch-up to remain competitive. But competing on the digital front isn’t solely about adopting the latest tech. The gap between aspiration and achievement is widening for enterprises attempting digital business transformation without a shared vision across the company. Developing the confidence to make investments in digital transformation strategies and capabilities that will enable continuous performance requires a deep understanding of the intricacies of effective digital transformation.
Equip yourself with the skills to drive transformation in the Digital Transformation Strategy online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education, and explore strategic development, implementation, and change management needs of effective transformation. Over six weeks, this program will help you navigate the digital transition with an in-depth understanding of how digitalization can add value within each business function. Using global case studies, you’ll discover how digital technologies are reshaping workforce needs, customer relationships, and business value. You'll also explore a holistic approach to achieving new modes of operation, with a focus on the opportunities that digital transformation holds, guided by leading Yale SOM faculty.
Is this program for you?
This program is designed to provide you with the skills to lead a high-level digital strategy and consolidate your place in today's competitive market. Senior and business leaders will gain the tools and frameworks to prepare for technological disruption, while learning to adapt internal processes to align with industry, workforce, and customer trends. Mid-level and technical managers, as well as specialists, will develop the understanding needed to bridge the gap between technical insight and the real-world business applications of new technologies. The holistic approach of the program means it is highly applicable to a wide variety of industries and roles where technological disruption is having an impact, and driving the need for digital transformation.

title: Product Management
about: Develop the expertise to oversee all phases of a product life cycle and ensure success in the marketplace.

Professionals who hope to use their knowledge of product development to boost business success may also benefit from this course, as will those seeking a practical product management toolkit for use in current or future roles.

title: Real Estate Development: Planning and Process
about: Explore the complex public regulatory processes that underpin and control private real estate development.
University name: MIT School of Architecture and Planning
Course overview:
Course overview75%The percentage of development executives that believe public sector infrastructure investment has a major influence on development planning. Altus Group (Oct, 2020).Drive PPPs in real estate"Public-private partnerships (PPPs) are not new, but they are becoming increasingly pivotal to accomplishing what both sides struggle to do alone: rolling out the high-quality development, redevelopment, and creation of public facilities, infrastructure and as we look to the future the development of digital infrastructure." – Sergio Fernandez de CordovaMedium (Apr, 2019).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

As the real estate industry becomes increasingly complex, both the public and private sectors require an in-depth understanding of the real estate development process. By developing a nuanced overview of public-private stakeholder interaction, professionals will be able to navigate the process more effectively and create value for all parties involved.

Gain insight into the real estate development process and explore the private-public stakeholder dynamic in the Real Estate Development: Planning and Process online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P). Through the use of real-world case studies, you’ll delve into the complexities of city planning and the urban development process and explore how various  stakeholders interact, compete, and negotiate.

Over six weeks, you’ll also learn how innovative public-private partnerships can create new and diverse opportunities in real estate development and assist in the transformation of cities. Guided by Professor Kairos Shen’s extensive professional and academic experience, you’ll gain the knowledge and skills to approach the public sector, and apply the concepts learned to your local context.
Is this course for you?This course is designed for professionals within the public and private real estate sectors. Public sector stakeholders will develop the insight to reform and innovate within the standard zoning regimen. Private real estate developers  will gain the knowledge and confidence to approach regulators with transformative ideas and proposals that benefit local communities. Investment professionals who understand the need for public-private partnerships within real estate will benefit from an understanding of how this relationship could affect predictions and developments within the industry.

To succeed in today's increasingly dynamic world, business executives need a holistic and strategic set of capabilities that will empower them to drive their careers, and organisation, forward in the face of complexity.
Gain the knowledge and tools to enhance your management capabilities and become a more effective leader on the Oxford Strategic Management Executive Programme. This learning journey leverages content from three leading online Oxford programmes to provide you with core leadership, strategy, and finance skills to drive a competitive advantage for your company. As you progress through the programme, you’ll learn how to better manage teams, make more informed financial decisions, and achieve organisation-wide strategic objectives.
Is this programme for you?This programme offers current and aspiring leaders, senior executives, and managers the chance to enhance their ability to make an impact in their roles. These professionals will learn how to overcome contemporary organisational challenges and create effective strategies to leverage new opportunities for their business. Additionally, those looking to gain holistic and transformative knowledge, and a powerful long-term network that will help accelerate their career growth and broaden their professional impact, will find this programme beneficial.The Oxford Strategic Management Executive Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Analysing Health Systems: Lessons From COVID-19
about: Leverage the knowledge gained from the global COVID-19 response to influence policymaking and facilitate future health service delivery
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overview90%The percentage of countries that reported disruptions to essential health services due to the impact of COVID-19.WHO (Aug, 2020).$38 billionThe predicted cost of producing 2 billion vaccine doses, 245 million treatments, and 500 million tests needed in the global fight against COVID-19.WHO (Sep, 2020).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)COVID-19 has tested the resilience of health systems around the world. Not only has the pandemic shown that global systems are unprepared for health crises of this nature, but it has also revealed other pre-existing failures in providing reliable and equitable care to people around the world. Why have there been more cases and deaths in some countries compared to others? How much of this difference is due to the country’s health system? This six-week Analysing Health Systems: Lessons From COVID-19 online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) has been designed by faculty from the Department of Health Policy at LSE. Their aim is to influence and improve how health policy and systems are designed, implemented, and evaluated through multidisciplinary research and teaching. These experts have made substantive contributions to health planning and delivery on the global stage.The course explores the many ways the pandemic has challenged the structure of existing health systems – these effects range from financial losses and disparities in healthcare quality and coverage to failings in institutional and health system governance. Through the lens of COVID-19, you’ll develop the tools and expertise to critically evaluate the performance of health systems, and examine the reasons why some were better prepared than, and outperformed, others. On this course, you’ll gain a technical understanding of health system performance and response, learn to identify and understand the systematic issues experienced around the world, and determine the actions required to improve these structures.Is this course for you?This course is designed to provide medical and public sector professionals with the tools to measure and monitor healthcare service delivery, analyse past response frameworks, and better prepare for future health crises. Civil servants, policymakers, researchers, and advisors will gain fresh insights and perspectives related to health system performance to help improve the analysis and development of related policy. Hospital directors, healthcare administrators, and public health specialists will benefit from validating their existing experience and engaging with an international cohort of peers. Senior managers and those in positions of leadership will enhance their ability to take charge in future pandemic situations.



This Analysing Health Systems: Lessons From COVID-19 online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 50 hours of learning.

Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Introduction to COVID-19 politics and policy', 'Module 2': 'Inequitable suffering', 'Module 3': 'The health and economic consequences of COVID-19', 'Module 4': 'A comparative perspective on assessing the COVID-19 health system impact', 'Module 5': 'Healthcare quality and the impact of COVID-19', 'Module 6': 'Health system surveillance'}
Convenors: {'LSE Faculty': ['Gather expert insights from Dr Clare Wenham, Dr Miqdad Asaira, Andrew Street, Dr Rocco Friebel and Dr Irene Papanicolas, among others', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBdkFLIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--ca7a6e952b1ab194a75e557d67dc3bde3b7b73c5/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/lse_decision_making_judgements_biases_and_nudges_course_convenor_lse_logo.png']}
What will set you apart: ['A comprehensive overview of the social, political, and policy structures influencing the level to which health systems are prepared for pandemics.', 'The expertise to technically assess health system performance, and leverage data integration to better manage current and future healthcare requirements.', 'An analytical view of the effect of COVID-19 on global health systems, and how factors such as resource and funding constraints impact responses.', 'A toolkit of strategies and tactics geared to repair and restructure health systems, and facilitate high-quality and equitable care.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']
About the certificate: Gain the skills to evaluate the performance of a health system and earn an official certificate of competence from the London School of Economics and Political Science. Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Leading Workplace Diversity
about: Promote inclusivity in the workplace with a diversity action plan to attract and retain diverse talent.
Course overview:
Course overview79%The percentage of organizations that, by fostering a sense of belonging in the workforce, are predicted to reap success over the next 12 to 18 months.Deloitte (May, 2020).76%The percentage of employees and job seekers who report that diversity in the workforce is important when evaluating companies and employment offers.Glassdoor (Sep, 2020).Duration: 6 weeksThe business case for diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) in the workplace is stronger than ever—and continues to strengthen as the relationship between diversity and retaining high quality talent becomes clearer. Making DEI a strategic imperative has the capacity to promote innovation, creativity and empathy in ways that homogeneous work cultures seldom do.1 And yet, due to slow adoption in workplaces, progress remains tepid; inclusion policies cannot change anything unless the work culture changes too. The Leading Workplace Diversity online short course from Rice University’s Jones Graduate School of Business equips you with a diversity action plan to not only promote meaningful change in your organization but also impact growth and business performance. Founded in effective and expert-led talent management strategies, you’ll explore diversity as a financial, moral and realistic imperative; the difference between elements of workplace and hiring bias and how these manifest as barriers to diversity; and how effective employee selection processes can cultivate diversity and reduce employee attrition. Based on Dr. Mikki Hebl and Dr. Eden King’s extensive teaching and research in the science of organizational diversity, you’ll explore practical talent management and organizational strategies to attract, select and retain talent in order to cultivate diversity within your organization.1 World Economic Forum (Apr, 2019).
Is this course for you?This course is applicable to anyone looking to position DEI as a business priority and drive business outcomes with the promotion and nurturance of diversity initiatives. With a focus on talent management strategies, the course is especially relevant to human resources and senior managers, training and performance management and business partners working across a broad spectrum of industries or functional areas. Directors, managers and leaders who are motivated to create a more diverse work environment will benefit from the practical and interdisciplinary approach.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Why diversity matters', 'Module 2': 'Elements of bias', 'Module 3': 'Reducing bias', 'Module 4': 'Attracting a diverse workforce', 'Module 5': 'Enhancing diversity through employee selection', 'Module 6': 'Maintaining diversity by reducing employee attrition'}
Convenors: {'Dr. Eden King': ['Lynette S. Autrey Professor of Industrial-Organizational Psychology, Rice University', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBbGtLIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--6e65aa23e0da2d3b6818a3b8c8ac7bbe6e133e30/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/rice_business_leading_workplace_diversity_course_convenor_eden_king%20(1).jpg'], 'Dr. Mikki Hebl': ['Martha and Henry Malcolm Lovett Chair of Psychology and Professor of Psychological Sciences and Management, Rice University', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBbG9LIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--979eb2fd82994b30459fb5e776a98ac2629cc7f4/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/rice_business_leading_workplace_diversity_course_convenor_Mikki%20Hebl.jpg']}
What will set you apart: ['Expert-led insights into how to lead diversity in your workplace through the creation and implementation of a diversity action plan.', 'Knowledge of discrimination reduction tactics to overcome workplace bias.  ', 'A diversity-needs analysis to promote meaningful organizational change.', 'Organizational leadership strategies to attract, select and retain diverse talent.', 'Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.']
About the certificate: Be empowered to lead diversity in the workplace and earn an official executive education certificate from Rice University's Jones Graduate School of Business.  Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the course handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the course.

title: Rotman FinTech: Future of Payments
about: Equip your organization to succeed in the changing FinTech landscape with an in-depth understanding of the past, present, and future of payments.
Course overview: Program overviewGet financial aidThe Ontario Student Assistance Program (OSAP) offers funding to qualifying Canadian citizens.Rotman (2022).$10.1 billionThe amount by which worldwide spending is predicted to increase by 2023.Erlang Solutions (2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Over the last decade, the world has seen a transformation in economic life due to numerous innovations in the payments sector. With a move toward blockchain technology, finance enthusiasts are working to develop platforms that function independently of traditional financial institutions or governments. Additionally, governments are preparing to issue digital money and develop new, alternative payment infrastructures. The FinTech: Future of Payments online program from the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto examines some of the most prominent innovations in FinTech today. Over six weeks, you’ll unpack the risks, opportunities, business applications, and legal challenges within the payment space. You’ll gain a better understanding of the past, present, and future of payments, and learn how to help your institution thrive in this changing landscape.Explore the practicalities and laws surrounding international payments to broaden your understanding of the flow of money within a global society. You’ll also learn more about the customer needs surrounding payments that are left unsatisfied by traditional banking solutions, and discover how PayTech innovations are addressing these needs to overcome existing challenges and financial exclusion.Is this program for you?This program will provide business decision makers and senior management with an in-depth understanding of FinTech innovations within the payment ecosystem. Those in finance, banking, and other related sectors will learn how to better respond to the disruptions and opportunities new FinTech presents. This program is designed to provide those in management and leadership positions with the skills to make effective FinTech and PayTech decisions. Any professionals interested in FinTech innovations will gain key insights into the current state of payments and how it has evolved over time.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'The evolution of payments', 'Module 2': 'SWIFT, scandals, and international payment laws', 'Module 3': 'Customer needs and PayTech innovation', 'Module 4': 'Payment innovations: An infrastructure perspective', 'Module 5': 'Blockchain technology and decentralized finance', 'Module 6': 'The future of FinTech: Open financial infrastructures'}
Convenors: {'Andreas Park': ['Professor of Finance, Department of Management, University of Toronto', 'https://www.getsmarter.com/rails/active_storage/representations/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBaHNQIiwiZXhwIjpudWxsLCJwdXIiOiJibG9iX2lkIn19--6ec8dc1cb7a0a494f09fcd722cfbdbb0e08e3482/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdCam9MY21WemFYcGxTU0lNTVRFd2VERXhNQVk2QmtWVSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoidmFyaWF0aW9uIn19--e8e4d52386516ed9566f111cb5206b7b0185063d/university_of_toronto_fintech_future_of_payments_program_course_convenor_andreas_park.jpg']}

Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. In order to be issued with a certificate, you’ll need to meet the requirements outlined in the program handbook. The handbook will be made available to you as soon as you begin the program.

title: Ciencias de la Nutrición (En Español)
about: Comprende la ciencia fundamental que es la base de la nutrición y cómo se relaciona con la salud y la prevención de enfermedades.
Course overview: Descripción general del curso480.700 millones de dólaresEl costo directo anual de las enfermedades relacionadas con la obesidad en los EE. UU., incluidas enfermedades crónicas, discapacidades y muerte.Milken Institute (Oct, 2018).14 %El porcentaje de médicos que informan sentirse preparados para asesorar sobre alimentación a sus pacientes.The Hill (Oct, 2019).Duración del curso:  8 semanas (Sin incluir la orientación.)Como profesional de la salud o el bienestar, resulta crucial tener una comprensión sólida de la ciencia que sustenta la nutrición para brindar a los clientes y pacientes consejos informados sobre longevidad, vitalidad y manejo holístico de la enfermedad.El curso corto virtual de Ciencias de la Nutrición le proporciona una base en nutrición, ya que explora la función de los micronutrientes y macronutrientes en el cuerpo, y cómo esto se relaciona con la salud humana en diferentes contextos del desarrollo humano.Aprenderá a interpretar la evidencia nutricional y a realizar evaluaciones nutricionales y análisis alimentarios con la guía del renombrado profesor Christopher Gardner. Además, adquirirá conocimientos para reconocer el valor de una nutrición óptima en términos de cuidados preventivos y las habilidades para examinar de manera crítica la investigación contemporánea.¿Este curso es para usted?Este curso está dirigido a profesionales de la salud, incluidos médicos, terapeutas ocupacionales, dietistas, farmacéuticos y enfermeros, así como especialistas en estilo de vida como nutricionistas, instructores de acondicionamiento físico, entrenadores, educadores de la salud y escritores sobre alimentos. El plan de estudios está diseñado para ayudar a estos profesionales a expandir sus funciones actuales al proporcionarles el conocimiento y la estructura para asesorar a pacientes y clientes sobre los planes alimentarios para una vida saludable y la prevención de enfermedades.Este curso se ofrece en español traducido. Se requiere dominio del inglés para navegar el curso, incluido el registro y el pago del curso, así como ciertos elementos del campus virtual.La mayoría de los materiales didácticos y materiales de apoyo se han traducido del inglés original al español (tenga en cuenta que los videos tienen subtítulos). Las tareas y los comentarios se proporcionan en español. El apoyo académico y estudiantil está a cargo de hispanohablantes. El entorno de aprendizaje (campus virtual) está diseñado para ayudar a los hispanohablantes con dominio del inglés. El soporte técnico está disponible en inglés. Los certificados se proporcionarán en inglés.  Adicionalmente, se le pedirá que acepte los Términos y Condiciones en inglés que rigen el Curso. Se dispone de una copia en español aquí. Si hubiera algún conflicto entre las versiones en inglés y español de los Términos y Condiciones, prevalecerá la versión en inglés, según corresponda.

What will set you apart: ['Una comprensión de la relación entre los alimentos y la nutrición.', 'Las habilidades para desarrollar planes nutricionales para diferentes personas y contextos.', 'Conocimientos sobre grasas y carbohidratos, los efectos del azúcar, los suplementos alimenticios, las dietas de moda y la importancia de las proteínas.', 'Un certificado de finalización del Stanford Center for Health Education, parte de Stanford Medicine. ', '']
About the certificate: Explore la nutrición basada en evidencias y obtenga un certificado de finalización del Stanford Center for Health Education, parte de Stanford Medicine.
What past students think: {'Sally DuplantierFundadora e instructora de salud y bienestar de Zing': '“Dado que se trata de un programa nuevo, pensé que les gustaría escuchar que estoy absolutamente satisfecha: el rigor, el contenido, el diseño de aprendizaje, los expertos invitados y, en especial, el pensamiento crítico que se necesita. Valoro que nos acerquemos a esto desde una perspectiva que se basa en la evidencia centrada en el sensacionalismo publicitario y las medias verdades, y que se nos proporcionen las herramientas para tomar una decisión informada. Disfruto especialmente la aplicación del aprendizaje a través de los estudios de casos. ¡No puedo esperar a ver quién viene al consultorio de mi nutricionista esta semana!”'}

title: Sustainable Finance and Investment
about: Gain a competitive advantage when you merge environmental, social, and governance factors into your financial and investment decisions.
Course overview:
Program overview63%The percentage of additional money gathered by sustainable equity funds, compared to traditional equity funds in the same period.Financial Times (Aug, 2020). $1.5 trillionThe amount of green finance that the 10 largest European banks have publicly committed to providing by 2030.EY (Feb, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)Environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues continue to gain momentum. But achieving targets like a net zero economy and equality will need the support of financial services.1 What’s more, companies have realized that integrating ESG criteria into business decisions goes beyond simply being more sustainable — it’s profitable too.
The Sustainable Finance and Investment online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education examines the ESG ecosystem: the terminology, activity, drivers, and participants. With this industry road map, you’ll become equipped to understand the core of sustainable finance systems with the skills to accelerate this shift in business. You’ll examine the challenges and opportunities of ESG data within the context of investment decision-making; explore its integration in asset-pricing models, portfolio management, and investment products; and learn how it can be used to determine investment strategies. The program features real-time data, gamified investment role playing, and interviews with a multitude of industry experts, giving you the practical skills, insights, and metrics to drive sustainable financial performance and investment strategies in your organization or career.
1 EY (Jan, 2021).
Is this program for you?This program has been designed for business leaders and professionals in strategic roles who are aiming to make more informed, sustainable investment decisions. It will be beneficial to individuals from a wide range of industries, including investment, asset management, and banking. They’ll gain the skills to accelerate the transformation towards sustainable finance in their organizations, and learn to better report on sustainable investment returns. Consultants working in sustainability and project execution, as well as public policy professionals, will similarly gain insight into the ESG data and metrics that help shape sustainable investments. How does this program differ from the Corporate Sustainability Management: Risk, Profit, and Purpose online program?The Sustainable Finance and Investment online program focuses primarily on equipping you to make more informed analyses and decisions when investing in sustainable assets and products. The Corporate Sustainability Management: Risk, Profit, and Purpose online program, on the other hand, is designed to help you embed sustainability and sustainable practices into the core of your business strategies.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'Sustainable investing strategies', 'Module 2': 'Key organizations and tools in sustainable finance', 'Module 3': 'ESG data, metrics, and analytics', 'Module 4': 'Asset pricing and portfolio management', 'Module 5': 'Impact metrics and investing', 'Module 6': 'Diversity of ESG investment products'}

title: Accounting for Investment and Managerial Decision-Making
about: Develop a financial and managerial accounting toolkit to drive performance and internal efficiency.
University name: The London School of Economics and Political Science
Course overview:
Course overviewTop 5 goalsInvesting in and enhancing finance talent and skills is a top priority in both executive management and the finance and accounting function. KPMG (Sep, 2019).3%The percentage of business profit that is put at risk due to unsound financial decision-making.Gartner (2019).Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)
In today’s shifting business landscape, a functional understanding of finance and accounting has become an integral part of any influential manager’s toolkit. On the eight-week Accounting for Investment and Managerial Decision-Making online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), you’ll develop a financial and managerial accounting toolkit to drive decision-making and enhance organisational performance. With a firm grounding in accounting principles, you’ll improve your ability to analyse statements, and learn how to communicate financial results to key business stakeholders.
With guidance from expert LSE faculty, you’ll discover how insights into your company’s costs, efficiencies, and profits can help create a culture of sustained improvement, and learn how delegating decision-making authority can foster a sense of responsibility in your team. Finally, you’ll assess the role of planning, budgeting, and performance targets, and explore how to design incentive, monitoring, and feedback systems that can achieve them.
Please note this course is geared towards non-financial managers and professionals from a broad range of industries and business areas. Prior knowledge of accounting is not required or expected.

This Accounting for Investment and Managerial Decision-Making online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 70 hours of learning.
Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.
Is this course for you?This course will benefit any non-financial manager or professional seeking to develop their accounting skills and knowledge to inform strategy and improve business performance. It’s aimed at individuals with limited accounting knowledge, whether they are new or aspiring managers looking to broaden their financial skill set, business owners or entrepreneurs responsible for organisational decision-making, or non-business management professionals wanting to accelerate their career progression. The course isn’t suitable for current finance or accounting professionals.
Course curriculum: {'Orientation module': 'Welcome to your Online Campus', 'Module 1': 'The building blocks of financial reporting', 'Module 2': 'Financial performance assessment: The income statement', 'Module 3': 'Financial position and capital structure: The balance sheet', 'Module 4': 'Financial statement analysis', 'Module 5': 'Management accounting concepts and principles', 'Module 6': 'Delegation and control', 'Module 7': 'Measuring and incentivising profitability', 'Module 8': 'Incentives, monitoring, and feedback to drive results'}

What will set you apart: ['A fundamental understanding of financial and managerial accounting concepts and principles to inform your business decision-making.', 'The ability to analyse income statements, balance sheets and market information, and communicate the results to stakeholders.', 'Insights into the costs, efficiencies, and profits of a company, and the tools for creating a sustainable culture of improved performance.', 'The capacity to recommend and delegate decision-making authority to foster personal and team responsibility among employees.', 'The skills to design incentive, monitoring, and feedback systems to drive performance and meet organisational targets.  ']
About the certificate: Learn how to make better financial and managerial accounting decisions, and earn an official certificate of competence from the London School of Economics and Political Science. Assessment is continuous and based on a series of practical assignments completed online. title: Rotman Enabling Impact Through Inclusive Leadership
about: Learn how to promote inclusivity by investigating how your own identity and privilege influence your approach to leadership.
Course overview: Program overview80%The proportion of workers who indicate inclusion as an important consideration when accepting a job.Fiix (Feb, 2022).76%The percentage of engaged employees in organizations with highly empathic senior leaders.Catalyst (Sep, 2021).Duration: 6 weeks (excluding duration)To drive transformation toward more diverse and inclusive workplaces, leaders need to ensure their organizational culture is geared toward fair treatment and equal opportunity for all.The Rotman Enabling Impact Through Inclusive Leadership online program from the University of Toronto Rotman School of Management delivers a unique set of insights and practical skills for leaders to drive this change. Over six weeks, you’ll investigate your own identity and privilege to better understand how they impact your approach to leadership. You’ll delve into the personal, interpersonal, and organizational dimensions of leadership, and gain an in-depth understanding of the impact of your awareness and appreciation of each employee’s individual culture. Using practical tools developed by the Program Director, Professor Ashraf, you’ll discover how to create a culture of meaningful engagement in your organization. Through the use of interactive exercises and case studies, you’ll walk away from the program with the practical skills needed to develop your leadership approach to become more inclusive.Is this program for you?This program is aimed at professionals and leaders interested in advancing, and understanding, equity, diversity, and inclusion (EDI) in their organization. People managers and supervisors will increase their behavioural empathy and allyship skills as they learn how to build and lead diverse teams, and facilitate engagement and communication surrounding EDI. Senior management and leaders will find this program useful as it equips them with practical tools to drive and improve diversity and inclusion as a strategic business initiative and priority. HR professionals tasked with increasing diversity and inclusion in the workplace will also benefit from the program material.

title: Investment Management: Investing With Data and Technology
about: Gain the knowledge and skills to make smarter, safer and more effective investment decisions.
Course overview: Course overview$23,082The amount of money potentially lost by investors who delay retirement saving by a single year.Nasdaq (2021).50%The percentage of surveyed millennials who regret how they invested in the last 12 months.CNBC (2022).For many people, investment markets are shrouded in mystery. Technical language, misconceptions and complex financial concepts restrict non-financially minded individuals from taking control of their personal investments and generating the wealth they need to create a financially sound future.Demystify the financial landscape with the Investment Management: Investing With Data and Technology online short course from the National University of Singapore (NUS) Advanced Computing for Executives (ACE). Over six weeks, you'll explore leading investment strategies and learn to manage your personal portfolio in a way that is smarter and safer. You’ll also gain practical experience using financial data and discover how it can be harnessed to inform and enhance your decision-making. Ultimately, the course will empower you with the knowledge and skills to work toward your financial goals.Is this course for you?This course takes a practical approach to generating personal wealth through informed investment decision-making. Those interested in creating a robust investment strategy which aligns with their risk appetite will benefit from the topics covered. Professionals working in finance, investment, consulting or advisory who are looking to brush up or formalise their skills will also benefit from this course.
